WAY4™ Release Notes (version 03.45.30)

Revision #44 (See revision history in section [Revision History].

This document contains an overview of the most significant changes in the new WAY4™ release and lists all changes (fixes and enhancements). A Customer's specific licenses determine whether a change is available. If you have any questions, please contact your Business Relation Manager.

Release Highlights

Major Modifications and Enhancements in WAY4™ version 03.45.30.

Click on the appropriate link to see the full list of changes: [Grouped by Products] or [Grouped by Releases].

To see Upgrade Notes for impact changes, click on the [Upgrade Notes for impact changes] link or [Grouped by Releases] link.

To see Check Scripts, click on the [Grouped by Products] link or [Grouped by Releases] link.

VISA interface

CARDS-52513

New financial transactions for Visa Claims Resolution (VCR) are supported: new inward dispute financials (with UsageCode=9) are mapped to legacy financials and new mandatory reference fields in outward clearing documents ("client-financials" mode) are supported. New Dispute Reason Codes and new Dispute Status Codes, corresponding to VCR rules, are supported.

Issuing authorisation

CARDS-52539

Added payment with IBAN routing. Now payment can be routed to different CBS interfaces by IBAN only.

CARDS-52825

Funds transfer transaction for core banking system has been added (payments with IBAN can be sent to the CBS interface).

Money transfers

CARDS-53107

Refactored money transfer routing (P2P transactions) for eChannels. Regression testing for client configuration is recommended.

CARDS-54243

Business to Card transaction licenses have been added. Please contact Customer Support for configuration if you use these transactions.

Data preparation and card personalization

CARDS-54089

The mechanism for handling 'Pre-Generated' RSA ICC Keys (for customers who use the "ICC Pregeneration" feature) has been changed as follows:
- these special keys have been moved to a dedicated DB table with specific "card production"-oriented Oracle indexes in order to improve performance of the data preparation stage for DDA / CDA cards.
- ICC Key Pools grouping has also been changed. Instead of splitting keys into different pools per PM Parms (range) entry, a set of common parameters (like length, public exponent, format, etc.) is used as a unifying attribute. Therefore, 'Pre-Generated' RSA ICC Keys can be used more effectively during the Data Preparation stage and it is no longer necessary to keep and manage a large number of different ICC Key Pools.

For more details, please refer to OW_HOME\manuals\russian\Data_preparation_and_card_personalisation\EMV_smart_cards\EMV_Card_Production_Setup.pdf or OW_HOME\manuals\english\Data_preparation_and_card_personalisation\EMV_smart_cards\EMV_Card_Production_Setup.pdf.
Updated Manuals: [data_preparation_and_card_personalisation\emv_smart_cards\EMV_Card_Production_Setup.pdf]

CARDS-54090

A new "Perso Bureau" entity has been introduced in the PIN Management module. Transport keys (Key Encryption Key and PIN Encryption Key) have been moved from "PM Parms" to "Perso Bureau". Now it is possible to prepare data for any "PM Job" in any "Perso Bureau" registered in WAY4. By default, each "PM Parms" is linked to one "Perso Bureau" which provides backward compatibility with old system behaviour.

From WAY4Cards 03.45.30.00, "Perso Bureau" functionality is optional. In order to start using it in this version, please contact Customer Support to get a special script which will change card production setup accordingly.

From WAY4Cards 03.46.30.00, "Perso Bureau" functionality will become mandatory and all configuration changes will be applied automatically.

For more information, please refer to "Data preparation and card personalization" manuals.
Updated Manuals: [data_preparation_and_card_personalisation\administrator_manuals\Card_Production_Setup.pdf] [data_preparation_and_card_personalisation\emv_smart_cards\EMV_Card_Production_Setup.pdf]

Acquiring authorisation

CARDS-53577

Multiple Capture (Split Shipment) transactions are supported for aggregators. Several sales completions can be used for one authorization with a special order id (booking id).

CARDS-53898

mVISA payments are supported. Merchants can receive mVISA payments for their accounts, issuer applications can read QR codes for payments and send transactions to a network.

CARDS-54106

Acquiring for transport merchants is supported: authorizations can be deferred and aggregated for cost reduction, special stop lists for merchants calculated. For details, please contact your business representatives.

Risk management

CARDS-47895

Added the ability to limit the number of different cards for a monitoring rule. Add the "DIFF_CARDS;" tag to the SpcParms field to activate this mode. See documentation for details.
Updated Manuals: [product_management\Usage_Limiters.pdf]

Scheduler

DBK-2916

Please be informed of end-of-life for the Scheduler R1 solution starting from the WAY4Cards 03.46.30.00 release. This includes the following steps:
- stopping delivery of new versions of the Scheduler R1 application and related configuration items (menus and manuals).
- discontinuing support for this application.
- termination of internal activities related to Scheduler R1 release processes.

Prior to the WAY4Cards 03.46.30.00 release, it is mandatory to upgrade from Scheduler R1 to Scheduler R2 (documentation for Scheduler R2 can be found in: OW_HOME\manuals\russian\Scheduler\R2\ and OW_HOME\manuals\english\Scheduler\R2\. For task configuration, please refer to the "Menu Item Editor" manual).

General questions (request for distributive / application installation / reconfiguration of existing tasks) regarding R1 to R2 upgrade can be addressed to Customer Support. There is also an option to perform upgrade as a separate Implementation Project (please contact your BRM / Account Manager regarding project initiation).

Technology End of Life

Pursuant to Oracle Statement of Direction regarding Oracle Reports (see http://www.oracle.com/technetwork/middleware/reports/downloads/oracle-reports-sod-3236098.pdf), OpenWay announces the start of a migration programme from Oracle Reports to alternative reporting products. OpenWay will announce a new reporting platform by the end of 2017. To estimate the scope of standard reports used by Customers, CMS Statistics information will be used. All banks need to provide CMS Statistics to their migration managers as always. Please contact your OpenWay Account Manager for details on the migration plan.

Support of International Payment System Releases (April 2018)

WAY4 03.45.30 supports the requirements of payment system releases. Documents for configuring WAY4™ to comply with payment system requirements will be available no later than one month before the corresponding payment system begins operation according to the new requirements.

Upgrade Notes on Impact Changes

Important! These changes may affect your data, please read carefully!

AMEX interface

CARDS-55512

Set the default parameter FILL_TID=Y for the AMEX GNS Outward pipe.
Upgrade Note:
Now the default pipe parameter is FILL_TID=Y.
Check the menu items "OpenWay\AMEX GNS\AMEX. Daily Procedures\AMEX. Outward Processing\AMEX GNS Outward Processing" and "OpenWay\AMEX GNS\AMEX. Daily Procedures\AMEX. Outward Processing\AMEX GNS OnUS Outward Processing" and the menu items inherited from them.

Accounting

CARDS-52827

Supported configuration of the "Cardholder_Account_Statement" and "Cardholder_Contract_Statement" reports using Date Schemes.
Upgrade Note:
The algorithm for due date calculation in customer reports has been changed to support configuration via contract functional dates. The new behaviour may differ from previous behaviour when the due date is a non-working day. In this case, explicit configuration of functional date shifts will be needed - see the manual <OW_HOME>\manuals\english\Product_management\Functional_Dates.pdf

Acquiring

CARDS-51929

"Service Card PIN Management" and "Service Card Send / Receive Production Batches" links have been added to the "OpenWay\Acquiring" menu branch.
Upgrade Note:
New functionality has been added to the "OpenWay \ Acquiring" menu branch (new menu branches "Service Card PIN Management" and "Service Card Send / Receive Production Batches"). Make sure users who have full access to this branch really should have the right to mark and issue service cards. If necessary, create the correct custom menu branches and update user rights.
Updated Manuals: [acquiring\user_manuals\Acquiring_Module.pdf]

CARDS-52181

The DCC_CONTRACT tag is checked during Nostro contract approve; it should be the same for Main and Sub Nostro contracts. When searching for the DCC_CONTRACT tag in Nostro contracts, the tag is first searched for in the Sub Nostro contract, then in the Main Nostro contract, and then on the Nostro Account Scheme. Earlier, the DCC_CONTRACT tag value in the Main Nostro contract was not considered.
Upgrade Note:
Clients using Dynamic Currency Conversion (DCC) or Multi Currency Pricing (MCP/MCA) products must perform a check using CHECK_v1_CARDS-52181_dcc_contract_numbers.sql script validating the settings of DCC_CONTRACT tags in NOSTRO contracts. If the check returns a non-empty number of strings, a detailed check must be performed and the results of both checks must be sent to Customer Support.
Updated Manuals: [dcc\DCC_Setup.pdf]

Acquiring authorisation

CARDS-55041

Included liability contracts in the contract hierarchy that is analysed to determine if a reversal can be accepted from a different terminal than that which sent the original request.
Upgrade Note:
A check of liability contracts has been added to the algorithm for determining if a reversal be processed for a request from a different terminal than that which sent the original request.
Contact Customer Support for additional information.

Application management

CARDS-52781

Added a new field, "WF Operation" to "OpenWay\Advanced Applications R2\Setup\Workflow Configuration\Activities" to define application workflow status after performing an activity: "To Closed" or "To Open". For a standard strategy it's recommended to set this field to "To Closed" for "Accept" and "Decline" activities and to "To Open" for "Approve" and "Capture and Edit Application" activities. 
"OpenWay\Advanced Applications R2\Application Processing\Close Posted Applications" allows workflow to be closed for all posted and declined applications when the workflow configuration is changed.
Upgrade Note:
A new field, "WF Operation" has been added to the form "OpenWay\Advanced Applications R2\Setup\Workflow Configuration\Activities". The field makes it possible to specify whether to close (To Closed) or to reopen (To Open) application workflow (WF) after an activity has been performed. 
In standard data, "To Closed" is set for the Accept and Decline (manual and system) activities and "To Open" is set for Approve, Capture and Edit Application activities. 
Previously, automatic closing of cases was not provided for in standard data. 
Since the absence of automatic closing of cases has a number of negative consequences (for example, open cases can't be deleted, it is not possible to determine whether application workflow has been completed according to case status, etc.), it is recommended to configure actions and workflow strategies to close the workflow process after work with an application has been completed.
To do so, it is sufficient to specify WF Operation=To Close for Accept and Decline activities (manual and system), or for other activities that are the last ones in application workflow, for custom strategies.
After custom actions have been corrected, all posted applications must be closed using the menu item "OpenWay\Advanced Applications R2\Application Processing\Close Posted Applications". This process can be performed in parallel mode if the PARALLEL parameter is configured for the "Close Posted Applications" process in "OpenWay\Full\Configuration Setup\Main Tables\Process Parameters"
After posted applications have been closed, the global parameter CHECK_OPEN_APPL_CASE can be set to "Y" to check if there are open application cases when closing the contract (if the CLOSE_IF_EMPTY tag is set in an Event to check whether there are open cases for a contract).
Updated Manuals: [application_management\r2\Advanced_Applications_Workflow.pdf]

CARDS-53369

Supported uniqueness of client individual taxpayer number (ITN field). It's only checked if the field is not empty and the global parameter "UNIQUENESS_CLIENT_ITN" for the financial institution is not set to "N" (No). The default parameter value is "Y" (Yes) and ITN uniqueness is checked.
Upgrade Note:
The uniqueness of the client individual taxpayer number (ITN field) is now checked during client creation and modification. It's necessary to ensure that this field value is unique or set the additional global parameter UNIQUENESS_CLIENT_ITN to "N". The default value for this parameter is "Y".
Updated Manuals: [application_management\r2\CBS_XML_Applications_R2.pdf] [core\Global_Parameters.pdf] [issuing\user_manuals\Issuing_Module.pdf]

CARDS-54341

Changed how the "RBS Number" and "MemberID" fields are filled in Advanced Application R2 for contract modification. Field values are now inherited from the parent contract if they are empty.
Upgrade Note:
Advanced Application R2 for contract modification now inherits RBS Number and MemberID from the parent contract if they are empty. Previously, this was only the case for new subcontracts.

UFX-359

XML Applications Overall Response pipe behavior has been aligned with the manual: extension is padded with zeros to be exactly three digits long.
Upgrade Note:
XML Applications Overall Response pipe has changed the naming of output files. Now extension is padded with zeros to be exactly three digits long. Previously is was never padded. There is no way to restore previous behavior.
If there are automated processes consuming files written by XML Applications Overall Response pipe, please make sure that they can correctly handle files with new naming (with zero-padded extension).

Automated routines

CARDS-52795

The Standard Evening Contract Daily Update process has been renamed from "Contr Daily Update2" to "Contr Daily Update Evening". In the Upgrade procedure, process parameters are automatically updated for "Contr Daily Update Evening" in the form OpenWay\Full\Configuration Setup\Main Tables\Process Parameters.
Upgrade Note:
Standard evening contracts daily update process has been renamed. The name "Contr Daily Update Evening" is used instead of "Contr Daily Update2". During the Upgrade procedure, default parameters from the "Contr Daily Update2" process will be copied to the new process "Contr Daily Update Evening". After installation, information about the copied parameters can be found in the form OpenWay\Full\Configuration Setup\Main Tables\Process Parameters.
It may be necessary to change the list of processes in monitoring forms used by operators on duty.

Case management

CARDS-53243

Changed the "CM.Operations.All Docs" form in the "CM Risk Management" and "Dispute Assistant" menu items. Removed the [TARGET_AMOUNT] and [TARGET_AMOUNT_FEE] computed fields. Added a new link [Srvc/Fee] to view all financial flows from all macrotransactions.
Upgrade Note:
To improve performance, the following changes have been made in the "CM.Operations.All Docs" form available from the "CM Risk Management" and "Dispute Assistant" menu items: 
- The [TARGET_AMOUNT] and [TARGET_AMOUNT_FEE] computed fields have been removed. 
- A new link [Srvc/Fee] has been added to view information about entries generated for a document.
This change may require to modify the internal regulations or customize the form to preserve previous behaviour.

CARDS-57800 / I1804119098

Added a check that the CODE field has been filled in for Case Parameters, Activity Reasons, Strategy Step, and Strategy. It is now mandatory to fill in the field. Also fixed the Duplicate Strategy procedure.
Upgrade Note:
The CODE field in the menu item "Case Management\Configuration Setup\Domain Configuration" must be filled in for the following objects: Case Parameters, Activity Reasons, Strategy, and Strategy Step. 
If the CODE field is not filled in, it is not possible to approve a strategy that was obtained by using the "Duplicate" action to copy an existing strategy.

To find objects with an empty CODE field, run check script .
Check Scripts:
<OWS Home>\db\scripts\oracle\check\checkdata\cards\CARDS-58609_CM_conf_check.sql
Updated Manuals: [case_management\Case_Management_Configuration.pdf]

Configuration inspector

DBK-3167

Fixed problem with Configuration Inspector which did not allow insertion of records into configuration tables after running "OpenWay\Copy Configuration\Copy Configuration Import Screen" -> [Data]-> [Import merged data] on WAY4 03.45.30.
Upgrade Note:
To fix configuration problems, run the OW_HOME\db\scripts\oracle\tools\synchseq.sql script after running "Configuration Import Screen\Data\Import Merged Data". It is only necessary to run the script if the configuration was imported to WAY4 versions between 03.45.30.00 and 03.45.30.32.

Core

CARDS-56959

Supported 3 logging modes for the CS_DECISION_LOG table. Default behaviour has been changed.
Upgrade Note:
Changes have been made that impact configurations using Decisions.

To check for the existence of such a configuration, use the standard form: OpenWay\Full\Configuration Setup\Common Handbooks\Decision.
If it is not empty, pay careful attention to the information below.

By default, logging of changes for all Decisions to the CS_DECISION_LOG table is disabled. This does cause any changes in processing, as this log is not used in processing. The current value of a Decision is always recalculated on the fly at the time it is asked.

Previously, logging of changes in Decisions was always deferred, using Object Task Scheduler, which sometimes resulted in a large queue of tasks for recalculating and logging the values of Decisions, although the CS_DECISION_LOG may not have been not used anywhere.

Disabling logging does not concern Decisions that are used in Datamart export. These decisions are always logged, regardless of any parameters. Only two log mode are possible for these Decisions: Deferred or Immediate (default).

Three log modes are now supported in WAY4:
1. SKIP - Don't log anything. Used by default for all Decisions, except those exported into Datamart.
2. DEFERRED - Deferred logging in CS_DECISION_LOG using Object Task Scheduler. This logging mode corresponds to the system's previous behaviour. Make sure that Object Task Scheduler is run regularly before enabling deferred log mode.
3. IMMEDIATE - Immediately recalculation and saving in CS_DECISION_LOG when a linked Classifier changes. This is used as the default mode for Decisions exported to Datamart. This mode is not recommended for Decisions that can be used for large contract trees, since a change in the value of a classifier in a hierarchy's top contract may cause immediate recalculation of dependent Decisions for all contracts in the hierarchy.

Log mode can be changed with the global parameter DECISION_LOG_MODE.
For the same behaviour for all Decisions (except those exported to Datamart), one of the aforementioned values should be used: SKIP or DEFERRED or IMMEDIATE.

To check logging mode for each Decision separately, use the value DECISION_LOG_MODE=CHECK_<Default Mode>, where Default Mode is a value: SKIP, DEFERRED, or IMMEDIATE. If the LOG_MODE tag is not set in a specific Decision, default mode will be used.

To set log mode for a Decision, use the LOG_MODE tag in the "Add Info" field. The mode in a specific decision is only checked when the global parameter has the value CHECK_<Default mode> and for Decisions used for export to Datamart.

If the CS_DECISION_LOG table is used in exports or custom processes, log mode should be changed according to these recommendations.

CARDS-57249

Improved entry description in the "Merchant Standing Order Entry Details" report. Entry description is now taken from the record of the approved Service that was current at the time of transaction so that later Service updates won't corrupt the entry description.
Upgrade Note:
The entry description in the "Merchant Standing Order Entry Details" report is now taken from the description of the approved Service that current when the transaction was posted. The change also also affects base amount entries that were previously described by "Base Amount". If custom logic is used with "Base Amount" as a constant to search for a transaction's base amount in a report, errors may occur. To maintain correct behaviour, instead of the "Base Amount" entry description, use the "Base" value in the Entry Type field. The old behaviour is not supported.

CARDS-51689

MIN_BILLING parameter default behaviour has been changed.
Upgrade Note:
The behaviour of the MIN_BILLING parameter has changed. This parameter is set as a tag value in days in an Accounting Scheme or as the Min Billing parameter in Billing Scheme tariffs.
Earlier it was necessary to set value to one day less than the required minimum length of a billing cycle. For example, to limit the minimum length of a cycle to 28 days it was necessary to set MIN_BILLING=27. Now the actual value, MIN_BILLING=28 must be set. Accordingly, the parameter's behaviour now corresponds to documentation.
The change only affects values set as days. Values set in months do not have this problem.
If a client's configuration uses the MIN_BILLING parameter in Accounting Schemes or in Billing Scheme tariffs, the preliminary phase of upgrade will show a message that a problematic configuration exists. Additional details can be found in Process Messages.
In this case, it is necessary to analyse if a shift of minus one day was used in existing settings. If so, the value must be corrected by adding one day.
Values should be corrected after the upgrade process is finished but before the first Contract Daily Update process.
For more information, contact WAY4 support.

CARDS-52384

A new API has been added, acnt_api.SEARCH_CLIENT_EXT. The API extends acnt_api.SEARCH_CLIENT with the ClientCategory input parameter.
Both APIs acnt_api.SEARCH_CLIENT(_EXT) now have different RetCode/RetMsg error values:
1/Client not found
2/Too many Clients were found
3/Client number conversion error
100/Internal error ORA-xxxxxx
For the old acnt_api.SEARCH_CLIENT API, search results have changed. If more than one client was found, the API returns null as ClientID and an error in RetCode.
Upgrade Note:
The client search algorithm has been changed for acnt_api.SEARCH_CLIENT. If more than one client was found, the API procedure now returns an error. 
It is recommended to use the new API procedure acnt_api.SEARCH_CLIENT_EXT instead of acnt_api.SEARCH_CLIENT for a more exact client search. 
A new input parameter, ClientCategory, can be used to specify the client category when 'CLIENT_NUMBER', 'REG_NUMBER', 'ITN' and 'SOCIAL_NUMBER'  values define the client search method.

CARDS-52528

Creation of transit macrotransactions has been fixed for 3-level financial institution hierarchies and the global parameter NEW_INTERBRANCH_ROUTING=Y.
Upgrade Note:
For clients using the "Y" value of the global parameter  NEW_INTERBRANCH_ROUTING and with a three-level hierarchy of financial institutions, the method for defining transit accounts in macrotransactions for the second level has been changed. If this configuration is used, please contact Customer Support for guidance.

CARDS-53809

Use of the TOTAL_BAL_TYPE tag for prepaid cards has been changed. See Client Upgrade Notes.
Upgrade Note:
The algorithm for using the TOTAL_BAL_TYPE tag in configuration of services, tariffs, etc. has changed.

If the TOTAL_BAL_TYPE tag with the value TOTAL_BAL_TYPE=AVAILABLE; is used for configuration of prepaid cards, the additional tag TOTAL_BAL_TYPE_SIGN=+; must be added. Otherwise, the system calculates the amount available for top-up incorrectly when a card has a negative AVAILABLE balance. A negative balance may be generated for a card due to fees charged for card issuing, etc.

Use of the TOTAL_BAL_TYPE tag is only recommended in configuration of prepaid cards and only in combination with the AVAILABLE balance. If this tag is used with another balance type, or in the configuration of other Product types (not prepaid cards), contact Customer Support.

Customer Support provides separate preliminary scripts that should be run in a copy of the production system before starting upgrade to the new version. 
If tpreliminary scripts find the aforementioned settings in the system, contact Customer Support for additional recommendations.
Updated Manuals: [tags description] [product_management\Service_Packages.pdf] [tariff_management\Tariff_Management.pdf]

CARDS-55727

Deleted some obsolete objects to prevent undesirable use of unsupported functionality. This has been done for future compatibility with the new Contract Parameter approach.
Upgrade Note:
For future compatibility with the new approach for the contract parameter handbook, some obsolete objects have been deleted to prevent their undesirable use:
Deleted Menu Items:
- OpenWay\WAY4 Data Warehouse Interface\Configuration Setup\Contract Parameters
- OpenWay\WAY4 Data Warehouse Interface\Runtime\Contract Parm Value Update

Deleted Forms:
- Contract Parameter - Export
- Contract Parameter - Export - Value

Deleted pl/sql procedures and functions:
- scdp.RUN_RENEW_TRF_LINK
- trf_export.RENEW_TARIFF_LINK
- trf_export.VALIDATE_CONTR_PARM

Deleted view:
- CONTR_PARM_VALUE

The Product Inspector option LOG_MODE=CONTR_PARM_EXPORT is no longer supported.

According to CMS Statistics, no one used these objects.
Updated Manuals: [product_inspector\WAY4_Product_Inspector_Manual.pdf]

CARDS-52967 / I1704121197

Processing of annual miscellaneous Service fees for contracts created on February 28 of any non-leap year has been fixed. See Client Upgrade Notes for details.
Upgrade Note:
The algorithm for calculating the date of generating/charging an annual miscellaneous Service fee has changed. If the following configuration is used, it is strongly recommended to perform thorough functional testing on the new WAY4 Cards version: 
- recurring fee type ("Full/Configuration Setup/Transaction Types/Fee Types") has the parameter value Charge Event="Yearly".

CARDS-51495

Reports XLS_CB_f250_1.rdf, XLS_CB_f250_2.rdf, XLS_CB_f250_3.rdf:
- Added count of contactless cards, transactions and devices.
- Supported consolidated report for all financial organization branches.
- Supported counting of cards with only 2 groups: debit/credit.
Upgrade Note:
Change in the logic of Reports XLS_CB_f250_1.rdf, XLS_CB_f250_2.rdf, XLS_CB_f250_3.rdf: the "SHOW_IN_250" tag will be automatically deleted from the "Add Info" field of the "DWD_CARD_CATEGORY" classifier in the "DWH_CONF" configuration group (OpenWay\WAY4 Datamart Interface\Configuration Groups).
Updated Manuals: [rf_reporting\250\Form_250.pdf]

Customer profile

CARDS-53839

Fixed issue. Now the "Client Template Details" form in the "Customer Profile\Operations" menu shows sensitive attributes as masked and non-editable. To comply with PA-DSS requirements, a service attribute which can contain PAN should inherit its value from a sensitive dynamic handbook parameter or be directly marked as sensitive by the SENSITIVE=Y tag in the Additional Data field.
Upgrade Note:
To comply with PA-DSS requirements, all service attributes which can contain PAN should inherit their values from a sensitive dynamic handbook parameter or be directly marked as sensitive by the SENSITIVE=Y tag in the "Additional Data" field.
The SENSITIVE=Y tag should be registered in "Full\DB Administrator Utilities\System Utilities\Tagged Data Objects" for the TD_MSG_ATTR.ADD_DATA object.
Updated Manuals: [customer_profile\Configuring_WAY4_Customer_Profile.pdf]

CARDS-55880

Changed behaviour. Now Customer Profile Handbook checks that the filtering item code exists. An error message will be returned if this code does not exist in the filtering handbook.
Upgrade Note:
Customer Profile Handbook checks that the filtering item code exists. An error message will be returned if this code does not exist in the filtering handbook. The old behaviour in which the entire handbook without filtering was retrieved can be restored by setting the value of the additional global parameter CP_HANDBOOK_FILTER to "WEAK".
Updated Manuals: [core\Global_Parameters.pdf]

Customer/account management

CARDS-57867 / NET-140

Changed the algorithm for creating client/contract address lists and logic for transliterating addresses so that addresses are no longer shown multiple times in WAY4 Web screens and in DB Manager/WAY4 Manager forms. See Client Upgrade Notes for additional information.
Upgrade Note:
The algorithm for defining a language for transliterating client or contract addresses has been changed so that addresses are no longer shown multiple times in WAY4 Web address screens and in the "Customer Service Screen" form in DB Manager/WAY4 Manager. 
Previously, to transliterate an address to English, WAY4 used a language specified for the client in case client address was used for the address_type by default (Default Address="Client Base Address" in "ROOT\OpenWay\Full\Configuration Setup\Client Classifiers\Address Types") and there was no address with such address type in the CLIENT_ADDRESS table, 
or in case there was no CLIENT_ADDRESS at all (address was specified only in Client record) . 
The new behaviour is supported by additional global parameter USE_SYSTEM_ADDR_LANG with the "Y" value (default). 
Now WAY4 does not take client language into account, and in the aforementioned case uses the default system language from Global Constants. If language is not set for client or contract address, or it is set to English, or officer language is not defined, no transliteration for this address is performed.
The behaviour can be switched to use client language with additional global parameter USE_SYSTEM_ADDR_LANG set to "N" in case client address was used for the address_type by default and there was no address with such address type in the CLIENT_ADDRESS table, 
or in case there is no CLIENT_ADDRESS at all.

Now the client address list does not contain address specified in client record. The behaviour can be switched to the previous behaviour using additional global parameter USE_CL_BASE_ADDR with the "Y" value.

Logic for transliterating addresses has been fixed:
1. If "Date To" of one address record equals to "Date From" of another address record with the same address type, WAY4 shows the latest created address record.
2. If the activation period of one address record overlaps the activation period of another address record with the same address type, WAY4 shows the address with fewer activation period.

DB kernel

DBK-2644

All java classes running within Oracle JVM will be recompiled in order to avoid internal Oracle JVM exceptions.
Upgrade Note:
The offline phase of upgrade may last longer than usual due to recompilation of all java classes running within Oracle JVM.

DBK-2836

Corrected work of functions SUBTRACT_LIST_ITEMS_D, ADD_LIST_ITEMS_D in sy_convert package with delimiters other than ";".
Upgrade Note:
Currently incoming delimiter variable value in the functions is used to separate tags list instead of standard delimiter value ";". Custom objects, which use aforementioned functions might be impacted. The old behavior can be kept if incoming delimiter variable value is set as ";".

DBK-3208

Changed the pipe com.openwaygroup.pipe.write_audit_log_file.jar output to syslog (rfc5424) format.
Upgrade Note:
If data are exported from the sy_audit_log table (for more information, see the document "WAY4 Audit Log Export") to an external monitoring system, ensure the external monitoring system is ready to receive logs in syslog format.
Check for this pipe in the process log. Process name is PIPE: Audit Log Writing(com.openwaygroup.pipe.write_audit_log_file.jar).
Check Scripts:
Check script for this change is: CHECK_v1_DBK-3208_write_audit_log_file.sql  Script returns either "passed" (no action required) or "warning" if any action required.

DB manager

DBK-3021

Migrated DB Manager to a new PowerBuilder version.
Upgrade Note:
1) File format of DB Manager forms (forms\*.srd) has changed. Forms synchronized or saved in WAY4 Cards version 03.46.30.00 (or later) can't be used in previous WAY4 Cards versions. 
2) DDDW libraries (dbm\dddw\*.pbl) format has changed. Custom DDDW libraries should be migrated to the new version of PowerBuilder during upgrade to WAY4Cards version 03.46.30.00 (or later). Please contact your Upgrade Manager for details.

Data preparation and card personalization

CARDS-54089

Global ICC Key Pools have been supported in the PIN Management module.
Upgrade Note:
Prior to this change all cryptographic keys for the following modules:
- authorization
- acquiring
- card production
- 3DSecure
were stored in one DB table - PM_KEYS. A significant volume of all the table's records was taken up by keys with the 'Pre-Generated' RSA ICC Key type (relevant when the "ICC Pregeneration" feature is used, described in the document "OW_HOME\manuals\english\Data_preparation_and_card_personalisation\EMV_smart_cards\EMV_Card_Production_Setup.pdf" manual) which are used solely for card production.

In order to reduce the impact of card production processes on other WAY4 system modules, 'Pre-Generated' RSA ICC Keys have been moved to a separate table (PM_PREGENED_KEYS).

After upgrading the production system, check the following:
1) The number of  'Pre-Generated' RSA ICC Keys in the new table is sufficient for the planned volume of card production in the nearest cycle (to do so, use the updated form available from the menu item OpenWay\EMV Smart Cards\Card Production\RSA ICC keys PRE-generation\RSA ICC keys PRE-generation)
2) Oracle indexes for the PM_KEYS table are up to date (a signification change in the number of table records may lead to index degradation).
Updated Manuals: [data_preparation_and_card_personalisation\emv_smart_cards\EMV_Card_Production_Setup.pdf]

CARDS-54090

Support for working with different Perso Bureaus has been introduced in the PIN Management module.
Upgrade Note:
Please verify current card production settings on test and production environments using the following SQL query:
---
select distinct pko.value pbid from pm_keys_opt pko where pko.amnd_state = 'A' and pko.code = 'PBID' 
and not exists (select 1 from pm_keys pk where pk.id = pko.pm_keys__oid and pk.des_key = '01010101010101012020202020202020');
---

If the query returns a non-empty result, please contact Customer Support for instructions on correcting system settings according to the new behaviour.
Updated Manuals: [data_preparation_and_card_personalisation\administrator_manuals\Card_Production_Setup.pdf] [data_preparation_and_card_personalisation\emv_smart_cards\EMV_Card_Production_Setup.pdf]

Datamart

CARDS-50363

Added a new configuration group with the "LIMIT" code (OpenWay\WAY4 Datamart Interface\Configuration Groups) for all classifiers related to DWF_CONTRACT_LIMIT mapping.
Upgrade Note:
A new configuration group with the "LIMIT" code has been added to OpenWay\Datamart\Report Representation Group\Configuration Groups\Configuration Groups. A new classifier
with the "DWF_CONTRACT_LIMIT" code has been automatically added to the "LIMIT" configuration group.
It is highly recommended to move the following classifiers to the new "LIMIT" group by loading DWH_HOME\db\scripts\oracle\dwh\opt_cards_objects\HEAD\client\datam\DWH_SY_CONF_GROUP_ENG.TXT file with the Copy Configuration tool:
CURRENT_LIMIT_AMOUNT_CODE (Usage Limiter Codes to be loaded into DWF_CONTRACT_LIMIT fact)
CONTRACT_AMOUNT_CODE (Current values used to limit contract financial operations from acnt_contract to be loaded into DWF_CONTRACT_LIMIT fact)
CONTRACT_AMOUNT_PRODUCT (List of products for enforcing calculation of a contract limit amount with the acnt_api.ACNT_BAL function to be loaded into DWF_CONTRACT_LIMIT fact)
ACNT_BALANCE_CODE (Current values used to limit contract financial operations from acnt_balance table to be loaded into DWF_CONTRACT_LIMIT fact)
DWF_CONTRACT_LIMIT (Limits current value)

CARDS-52722

The following menu items have been renamed:
OpenWay\WAY4 Datamart Interface\Objects mapping\Products Mapping Step by Step\Lock DWH Mapping ->
OpenWay\WAY4 Datamart Interface\Objects mapping\Products Mapping Step by Step\Lock Datamart Mapping

OpenWay\WAY4 Datamart Interface\Objects mapping\Products Mapping Step by Step\Release DWH Mapping ->
OpenWay\WAY4 Datamart Interface\Objects mapping\Products Mapping Step by Step\Release Datamart Mapping

OpenWay\WAY4 Datamart Interface\Objects mapping\Account Mapping Step by Step\Lock DWH Mapping ->
OpenWay\WAY4 Datamart Interface\Objects mapping\Account Mapping Step by Step\Lock Datamart Mapping

OpenWay\WAY4 Datamart Interface\Objects mapping\Account Mapping Step by Step\Release DWH Mapping ->
OpenWay\WAY4 Datamart Interface\Objects mapping\Account Mapping Step by Step\Release Datamart Mapping

The OpenWay\WAY4 Datamart Interface menu branch is only provided to customers with the corresponding license.
See the "Upgrade Notes on Impact changes" section for more details.
Upgrade Note:
Old menu item names are not supported. If there are custom menu items using the standard menu items listed above, it is necessary to update link names for them. If link names are not updated, custom menu items will become invalid.
Updated Manuals: Datamart | Datamart_WAY4_Settings.pdf

Diners Club interface

CARDS-57001

Added the LOAD_CLR parameter (default value is "Y") for the com.openwaygroup.pipe.dci.inward_processing.jar pipe run by the menu item "OpenWay\Diners Club\DCI. Daily Procedures\DCI. Inward Processing\DCI DXS Issuer Detail File Inward Processing". The parameter prevents loading clearing documents when its value is "N".
Upgrade Note:
DCI Issuers who use the com.openwaygroup.pipe.dci.clearing_import.jar pipe run by the menu item "OpenWay\Diners Club\DCI. Daily Procedures\DCI. Inward Processing\DCI DXS Inward Processing OLD" must add the LOAD_CLR=N parameter to the menu item "OpenWay\Diners Club\DCI. Daily Procedures\DCI. Inward Processing\DCI DXS Issuer Detail File Inward Processing".

CARDS-57646

Fixed loading outward Fee Collections/Funds Disbursements. Affected pipes: com.openwaygroup.pipe.dci.inward_processing.jar.
Upgrade Note:
Clients who use the Diners Club Interface must add the following new message codes (OpenWay\Full\Configuration Setup\Transaction Types\Message Types - All):
1. 
Channel = "Diners Club"
Name = "Fee Collection Out"
Code = "FFPO-1Z-"
Category = "Advice"
Is Authorization = "Fin"
Trans Type = "Fee Collection Out"
Msg Details = "OUT_ST=C;"

2.
Channel = "Diners Club"
Name = "Funds Disb Out"
Code = "FFPO-2Z-"
Category = "Advice"
Is Authorization = "Fin"
Trans Type = "Funds Disb Out"
Msg Details = "OUT_ST=C;"

CARDS-56538 / I1801165374

Corrected behaviour for DCI Clearing Import and DCI Inward Processing. Now ATM Service Fee transactions are processed as special Misc transactions. Previously they were processed as general ATM transactions.
Upgrade Note:
Clients who use the DCI Issuing Interface must manually add: 
1. New Trans Type (OpenWay\Full\Configuration Setup\Transaction Types\Transactions - All) with the following parameters:
Service Class = "Misc"
Source = ""
Target = "Card"
Name = "ATM Service Fee"
DR\CR = "Debit"
Chain Type = "Original"
Is Authorized = "Never"
Is Required = "Yes"
Category = "Individual"
RBS Code = "A1F"
RBS Rev Code = "a1f"
Dispute Class = "ATM Dispute"
Trans Type IDT = "0719F"

2. New SubType for "ATM Service Fee" Trans Type (using the [SubTypes] button in OpenWay\Full\Configuration Setup\Transaction Types\Transactions - All):
Source Cat = ""
Target Cat = "Card"
Source Type = ""
Target Type = "Our DCI Cards"
Source Acc Type = "Inc Suspense"
Target Acc Type = "CH Current/Credits" or another appropriate account type which is used as current cardholder account (for example, Cl Deposit)

3. New Message Code for "ATM Service Fee" Trans Type (using the [Msg Types] button in OpenWay\Full\Configuration Setup\Transaction Types\Transactions - All):
Channel = "Diners Club"
Name = "ATM Service Fee"
Code = "DfP--01-"
Category = "Advice"
Is Authorization = "Fin"
Trans Type = "ATM Service Fee"

4. Add corresponding Misc- services for Transaction Type "ATM Service Fee" to all DCI card service packages.

CARDS-57477 / I1804121212

Clients who use the Diners Club interface should add the following message types (OpenWay\Full\Configuration Setup\Transaction Types\Message Types - All) for the Diners Club channel:
1. Name "ATM Adj"
Code "Dpr--01-"
Category "Adjustment"
Trans Type "ATM"
2. Name "Cash Adj"
Code "Dpr--12-"
Category "Adjustment"
Trans Type "Cash"
3. Name "Credit Adj"
Code "Dpr--20-"
Category "Adjustment"
Trans Type "Credit"
4. Name "Retail Adj"
Code "Dpr--00-"
Category "Adjustment"

Dispute assistant

CARDS-52619

The "Dispute Assistant" menu has been renamed to "Dispute Assistant R1 OBSOLETE". The "Dispute Assistant CM"/"CM Dispute Assistant" menu has been renamed to "Dispute Assistant R2".
Upgrade Note:
The "OpenWay\CM Dispute Assistant" menu branch has been renamed to "OpenWay\Dispute Assistant R2" and the "OpenWay\Dispute Assistant" menu branch has been renamed to "OpenWay\Dispute Assistant R1 OBSOLETE". This menu branch is only provided to customers with the corresponding license. 
This impacts user access grants for this menu - please review access to the corresponding menu branches in the "OpenWay\Full\DB Administrator Utilities\Users & Grants\User Groups and Users - Edit" form and provide access to this menu branch, if necessary. If you have this license, but do not see the menu branch in the system after upgrade, please contact Customer Support.

CARDS-55547

DA R2. Fixed function to check Fraud Counter. Now this is performed only for Issuing contracts.
Upgrade Note:
Fixed function to check Fraud Counter. Now it's performed only for Issuing contracts.

CARDS-57501 / I1804124081

Changed the condition to detect advices (notifications) on dispute documents sent by the payment system on behalf of a client. Now this condition in DA R2 is based on the value of the SENT_BY_TGT=Y; tag set by a particular inward channel module.
Upgrade Note:
Clients who use VISA VCR interface must check that their WAY4Cards version includes CARDS-56736.

CARDS-54729

Modified VISA RA configuration and interchange tariffs for Bulgaria according to VISA bulletin on 22 July 2017.
Upgrade Note:
The VISA_RELEASE parameter must be set to "17.3". The RA configuration must be imported from the VISA_RA_CFG_REL_17_Q4_EU_CC.txt file according to "Configuring WAY4 Parameters to Calculate Visa RA" manual. The Fee Prediction tariffs must be imported from the config\fp\VISA\BGR\TRFDMN_2016-02-16_18.xml file.
