High availability

DBK-2410

WAY4 Cards upgrade in High Availability solutions no longer requires recreation of a secondary node. The new upgrade procedure for HA solutions is supported only if the current version is 03.44. Upgrade from version 03.43 to 03.45 should be done the old way.
Upgrade Note:
Upgrade documentation has been changed.
For the new upgrade workflow, please consult the appropriate solution's High Availability Operation manual.
"Start upgrade" and "Complete upgrade" actions should be executed in upgrade wizard instead of HA-Console.

CARDS-51739

Fixed typo in code of HA.DEFERRED_DOC_APPLY and HA.DEFERRED_DOC_APPLY_DELAY global parameters.
Upgrade Note:
The global parameters HA.DEFFERED_DOC_APPLY and HA.DEFFERED_DOC_APPLY_DELAY  must be renamed to HA.DEFERRED_DOC_APPLY and HA.DEFERRED_DOC_APPLY_DELAY, respectively.
Updated Manuals: [core\Global_Parameters.pdf] [ultimate_ha\distributed processing\Distributed_Processing_setup.pdf]

DBK-2624

"Upgrade the Online1 Node"  procedure now requires using Forced switch, as described in section "Emergency Mode" for HA-Switch Solution.
Upgrade Note:
Upgrade process for online nodes of a full HA-Switch solution has changed.
Please check HA-Switch Operation manual, section "Upgrading the Online1 Node", step 9.
Updated Manuals: [ultimate_ha\ha_switch\HA_Switch_operation.pdf]

Host2Host interface

CARDS-55465

Fixed menu item "OpenWay\WAY4 UFX Interchange\File Management\UFX Reset Outward File Counter". Changed counter name.
Upgrade Note:
Check the menu item "OpenWay\WAY4 UFX Interchange\File Management\UFX Reset Outward File Counter" and menu items that used it as a template.

CARDS-57023

Added the ability to convert incoming payments to notifications for selected channels only in the UFX Documents Import pipe in "H2H" mode.
Upgrade Note:
Added a new pipe parameter, FF_SRC_CH_LIST that makes it possible to convert payment messages to notifications for desired channels only (DocFile/DocList/Doc/Originator/Product/Channel aggregate).  Values for the FF_SRC_CH_LIST pipe parameter are: "ALL", "NONE" or a comma-separated list of message channel codes. The default value is "W,V". 
Note that the FAST_FUNDS=Y parameter in the AddInfo field is no longer analysed; payment financial messages are converted to notifications only according to the values of the FF_CODES_MAP and FF_SRC_CH_LIST pipe parameters.
Updated Manuals: [core_banking_interface\core_banking_interface\user_manuals\CBS_Interface_UFX.pdf]

CARDS-56852 / I1802068851

Added the ability to convert incoming "fast funds" payments to notifications in UFX Import pipe in "H2H" mode.
Upgrade Note:
Added a new pipe parameter, FF_CODES_MAP which makes it possible to convert "fast funds" financial messages to notifications. If an incoming message contains the parameter FAST_FUNDS=Y in the AddInfo field, a message code will be substituted according to the FF_CODES_MAP parameter. FF_CODES_MAP has the following format: <OldMessageCode1>:<NewMessageCode1>,<RequestCategory1>;....<OldMessageCodeN>:<NewMessageCodeN>,<RequestCategoryN>; or the "N" value, which turns off message code substitution. The default value is "DpP--2X-:NpP--2S-,P;DpR--2X-:NpP--2S-,R;". To restore previous behaviour, the  "FF_CODES_MAP" pipe parameter value must be set to "N".
Updated Manuals: [core_banking_interface\core_banking_interface\user_manuals\CBS_Interface_UFX.pdf]

Instalment management

CARDS-51411

Added the ability to process instalment daily interest accrual. To enable the feature, instalment fee codes that need daily interest accrual should be specified in the INST_DAILY_INTEREST_CODES global parameter (can be redefined in the financial institution), and invoice events to make financial transfers should be configured.
Upgrade Note:
In previous behaviour, the procedure instl.DAILY_INTEREST_FC called from the custom procedure cust_eod_before was used in accrual of instalment loan interest. Now the procedure is called from the standard INSTL package. It is necessary to exclude calls of  instl.DAILY_INTEREST_FC from the custom procedure and configure the global parameter INST_DAILY_INTEREST_CODES with a list of "Fee Code" codes from the form for configuring "Invoice Events" responsible for daily accrual of interest.
Updated Manuals: [instalment_management\WAY4_Instalments.pdf]

CARDS-52124

Instalments with "Monthly Interest" configuration have been simplified. The "Next Working Day" and "Previous Working Day" values are converted into a single value, "Split Interest". The split invoice effective date will no longer be shifted. At the end of the month, the dates of transfers generated by fee invoice opening will depend on the contract's Accounting Scheme EOM configuration.
Upgrade Note:
An Instalment Scheme's "Next Working Day" and "Previous Working Day" Monthly Interest field values  are converted into a single value, "Split Interest". An instalment's end of month interest transfer dates will depend on the Accounting Scheme's end of month configuration.
Updated Manuals: [instalment_management\WAY4_Instalments.pdf]

CARDS-57907

Added a new interest calculation scheme to configure an instalment scheme: "Interest with USE_MONTH_WEIGHT = B". In this configuration, interest for the first instalment portion is calculated for the whole month regardless of a number of days left to the end of the month. In case of early repayment, no advance interest is taken.
Upgrade Note:
Previously, the "Interest with USE_MONTH_WEIGHT=N" and "Interest with USE_MONTH_WEIGHT=Y" instalment interest calculation schemes could be combined with the "USE_MONTH_WEIGHT=B" configuration on Account Scheme and Financial Institution levels.
Now when an interest calculation scheme with the specified USE_MONTH_WEIGHT mode is selected on Instalment Scheme level, the USE_MONTH_WEIGHT tag in Account Scheme or Financial Institution is not checked at all. If the required behaviour of the USE_MONTH_WEIGHT parameter must be taken from Account Scheme or Financial Institution for the whole product including both Instalment and Revolving parts, the "Interest" calculation scheme must be used in the Instalment Scheme.

CARDS-51965

Instalment fee code is now taken from an Instalment Scheme even if the fee rate is passed in document tags. Previous system behaviour was to use "FEE" as a fee code value regardless of Instalment Scheme settings.
Upgrade Note:
Changed the procedure for generating fee invoice records for instalment plan fees when the fee percentage or amount is passed in document tags. Earlier these records were created with the "FEE" debt code (this value corresponds to the Invoice Events - Fee Code setting). Now the debt code is taken from instalment scheme fee parameters depending on the Calc Scheme.
If an Instalment Scheme contains several fees with the same Calc Scheme, debt code will be taken from the first one. If no fees are configured in the Instalment Scheme, or debt code is not specified for the corresponding fee, the "FEE" value will be used as earlier.
Updated Manuals: [instalment_management\WAY4_Instalments.pdf]

CARDS-52686

Fixed changing of the "Is Ready" contract attribute when performing manual instalment actions using DB Manager.
Upgrade Note:
Forms to fill in instalment actions parameters have been changed to use the local_constants table instead of the appl_info table. 
If customized forms were used for instalment management they should be changed the same way.
Updated Manuals: [instalment_management\WAY4_Instalments.pdf]

CARDS-56542

Corrected the "E2.CB" bertlv tag format containing an instalment type in authorisation response.
Upgrade Note:
Issuers of Instalment cards for which instalment plan simulation mode is used during authorisation request should note that the "E2.CB" bertlv tag value in 112 field of authorisation response has been corrected: the value in the standard implementation changed to "T". If cust_auth_parse procedure is used to fill in E2.CB tag, change the procedure and configure the "T" tag type.

Issuing

CARDS-55073

Disabled the SET_CREDIT_LIMIT_MODE global parameter.
Upgrade Note:
Issuers are highly recommended to check for the presence of the SET_CREDIT_LIMIT_MODE global parameter in the "Additional Global Parameters" form. If the global parameter is not specified or is set to the default value SET_NEW, no changes are required. If the global parameter has the "ADD" value, issuers should take into account that the system behaviour will be the same as with the default value. Changing the credit limit using the [Credit Limit] button in the form for editing a contract (card or account) sets a new value equal to the value specified. If other behaviour is expected, the issuer must contact Customer Support.
Updated Manuals: [core\Global_Parameters.pdf] [help system - acquiring\main_lng.chm and issuing\main_lng.chm] [help system - acquiring\main_lng.chm and issuing\main_lng.chm] [issuing\user_manuals\Issuing_Module.pdf] [product_management\Products_and_Subtypes.pdf]

Issuing authorisation

CARDS-55790

Added device name (WSP_DEVNAME), device ID (WSP_DEVID) and last four digits of mobile phone number (WSP_L4DIG) saving in the database as token parameters on MDES / VTS enrolment.
Upgrade Note:
3 parameters must be created for existing MDES/VDEP/MIR(tokenization)"Identification Schemes" (OpenWay\Authentication Module\Identification Types -> [Parms]:

1) 
Name = Mobile Number Last 4 digits
Code = WSP_L4DIG
Is Global = No
Is Mandatory = No
Parm Type = String

2) 
Name = Device ID
Code = WSP_DEVID
Is Global = No
Is Mandatory = No
Parm Type = String

3) 
Name = Device Name
Code = WSP_DEVNAME
Is Global = No
Is Mandatory = No
Parm Type = String
	
and changes to the scheme must be approved by clicking on the [Approve] button.

CARDS-51820 / I1612121917

"No Check" Auth scenario has been removed from forms as obsolete. The additional global parameter ENABLE_NO_CHECK is no longer supported.
Upgrade Note:
The additional global parameter ENABLE_NO_CHECK is no longer supported. It is not possible to create new products/contract with Auth scenario=No Check (existing contracts with Auth Scenario=No Check will be processed as See Main).
Updated Manuals: [core\Global_Parameters.pdf] [product_management\Products_and_Subtypes.pdf]

CARDS-55431 / I1710259099

Fixed issue. Now by default the authorisation process does not apply deferred tasks and the Secondary->Primary Synchronisation process does not create deferred tasks. If you use High Availability solutions, set HA.DEFERRED_DOC_APPLY=Y global parameter to restore the old behaviour and make sure that Object Task Scheduler is always running.
Upgrade Note:
Now by default the authorisation process does not apply deferred tasks and the Secondary->Primary Synchronisation process does not create deferred tasks. If you use High Availability solutions, set HA.DEFERRED_DOC_APPLY=Y global parameter to restore the old behaviour and make sure that Object Task Scheduler is always running.
Updated Manuals: [core\Global_Parameters.pdf]

JCB interface

CARDS-51481

JCB ISO Outward (variable): added the "EXT_CURR_EXP" parameter for changing the currency exponent on transaction export.
Upgrade Note:
JCB ISO Outward (variable): added the "EXT_CURR_EXP" parameter for changing the currency exponent on transaction export. Parameter format: EXT_CURR_EXP = <3_digit_currency><1_digit_exponent_to_be_used>. This parameter can be used if the currency exponent in WAY4 differs from the JCB currency exponent.
For example EXT_CURR_EXP = 7040 (use 0 exponent for VND currency).

CARDS-53336

JCB: Added message codes ("RjP-----","RJP-----","RmP-----","RmR-----") for reject processing.
Upgrade Note:
If the new JCB ISO format is used, the following Message Types must be added (OpenWay\Full\Configuration Setup\Transaction Types\Message Types - All):
1.
Channel=JCB
Name=Rejected Item Fin
Code=RmP-----
Category=Advice
Is Authorization=Fin
Trans Type=Rejected Item Fin
2.
Channel=JCB
Name=Rejected Fixing
Code=RmR-----
Category=Advice
Is Authorization=Fin
Trans Type=Rejected Fixing
Msg Details=OUT_ST=C;
3.
Channel=JCB
Name=Rejected Item
Code=RjP-----
Category=Advice
Is Authorization=Fin
Trans Type=Rejected Item
4.
Channel=JCB
Name=Rejected File
Code=RJP-----
Category=Advice
Is Authorization=Fin
Trans Type=Rejected File

CARDS-56155

Changed JCB BIN Table Import pipe. Supported loading of new values from the "Card Product" field. Information about a consumer/commercial is stored in the "bin_table.product_category" database field in MasterCard notation ("1"-consumer, "2"-commercial, "4"-other). Also, the bin_table.licensed_product_id database field is filled with a 3-symbol product code (see the PDSE3001 field in the BIG manual for the list of possible values).
Upgrade Note:
Loading of new values from the "Card Product" field has been supported in the JCB BIN Table Import pipe. Information about consumer/commercial is stored in the "bin_table.product_category" database field in MasterCard notation ("1"-consumer, "2"-commercial, "4"-other). Also, the "bin_table.licensed_product_id" database field is filled with a 3-symbol product code (see PDSE3001 field in the BIG manual for the list of possible values).  licensed_product_id is generated according to "Card Product" and "Card Grade" from an incoming IIN file. Two new pipe parameters have been added to generate licensed_product_id
- "MAP_PROD_TO_NAME" = "<product1>=<name_start1>;<product2>=<name_start2>;...<productn>=<name_startn>;", where <productx> - "Card Product" field from incoming IIN file and <name_startn> - first letter of the licensed_product_id. Default value "MAP_PROD_TO_NAME"="01=C;02=D;03=P;04=A;05=X;06=Y;"
- "MAP_GRADE_PROD_NAME" = "<grade1>=<name_end1>;<grade2>=<name_end2>;...<graden>=<name_end1>n", where <graden> - "Card Grade" field from incoming IIN file and <name_startn> - last 2 letters of the licensed_product_id. Default value "MAP_GRADE_PROD_NAME"="S=ST;G=GD;P=PL;R=PR;D=GR;E=EN;M=SP;U=UL;O=AL;"
No additional manual action is required.

MasterCard interface

CARDS-48154

Supported resubmitting a MasterCard DCC First Presentment without DCC if the acquirer gets a First Chargeback for the full amount with Reason Code 4846.
Upgrade Note:
Acquirers that use the MasterCard interface can use the new button [-->1Prs w/o DCC] in the "Doc - Brief" form to resubmit a DCC First Presentment without DCC.

Acquirers that use the MasterCard interface and Dispute Assistant v2 should set up a new activity and change the strategy according to the manual.

CARDS-54612

Enhanced calculation for "Number Of Issued Chip Cards", "of which are only Contact", "of which are Contact and Contactless", "of which are only Contactless", "of which are micro tags", "Number Of Active Cards (at least one transaction)", "Number Of Active Cards (at least one Contactless transaction)", "Number of Accounts", and "Number of Active Accounts" fields in the "Card Issuance" section of the "Visa Statistics Issuing Business" report.
Now only contracts/accounts with valid statuses are included in calculations of the values listed above. Contract status history can be taken into account. 

For the "Accounts and Cards" section of the"MC Statistics Issuing Business" report:
Enhanced calculation for the "Accounts at beginning of quarter" (Open/Blocked/Total), "Accounts at end of quarter" (Open/Blocked/Total), "Cards at beginning of quarter" (Open/Blocked/Total), and "Cards at end of quarter" (Open/Blocked/Total) fields. Now the values listed above are calculated based on contract/account status validity where contract status history can be taken into account.
Renamed the "Of which are MasterCard contactless" field to "Of which are MasterCard contactless enabled".
Corrected calculation for "Total MasterCard contactless Cards issued". Now all valid cards enabled to perform contactless transactions are calculated; previously only active cards were calculated.
Upgrade Note:
Only the new calculation algorithm is available for the fields of the "Card Issuance" section of the "Visa Statistics Issuing Business" report and the "Accounting and Cards" section of the "MC Statistics Issuing Business" report.
Old behaviour is not supported.
Current values for the aforementioned sections can differ from the previous ones since an additional condition for cards/accounts to have proper statuses has been added.
To use historical values of contract statuses (values for reporting dates), create a standard contract "CONTR_STATUS" classifier. Otherwise the current contract status value will be used.
Updated Manuals: [mastercard_statistical_reports\quarterly_mastercard_reporting\MC_Statistical_Reports.pdf] [visa_statistical_reports\quarterly_operating_certificates\VISA_Statistical_Reports.pdf]

CARDS-55628

Fixed the customized fields processing for MasterCard CDF Export process. If a customized field in the ADD_FIELDS_XX pipe parameters had [null] value, non-customized value was used for export. Now standard value is used only when there is no customized field in the ADD_FIELDS_XX pipe parameters. Otherwise, a customized value is used even if it has [null] value.
Upgrade Note:
The customized fields processing has been fixed for MasterCard CDF Export process. If a customized field in the ADD_FIELDS_XX pipe parameters had [null] value, non-customized value was used for export. Now standard value is used only when there is no customized field in the ADD_FIELDS_XX pipe parameters. Otherwise, a customized value is used even if it has [null] value. Please review ADD_FIELDS_XX pipe parameters to check if [null] value ("<CustomField>=;") is used to export the non-customized fields.

CARDS-56438

Added mapping Ethiopia country code 230 to 231. Included the country Myanmar in "MC: Asia Pacific (C)" region. MasterCard Fee Prediction.
Upgrade Note:
Clients who use the MasterCard interface and Fee Prediction in particular should manually include the country Myanmar in "MC: Asia Pacific (C)" region (OpenWay\Full\Configuration Setup\Main Tables\Country Table, [Direct Areas] button).

CARDS-56616

Supported database currencies overrides for the MasterCard CDF interface.
Upgrade Note:
If the currency code or currency exponent in the CURRENCY table differs from MasterCard CDF format, currency override must be set up. Refer to the "Redefining Currency Parameters" chapter of the "Currency Conversion" manual for more information.

CARDS-56671

Added the ability to skip export of unchanged corporations for the MasterCard CDF Export interface.
Upgrade Note:
To skip export of the "CorporateEntity" aggregate without any embedded records, the new EXPORT_EMPTY_CORPORATION=N pipe parameter must be set. The new parameter works only when the ORG_REC_CHOICE=U pipe parameter is also set.

CARDS-56436 / I1611016818

Fixed CAB condition processing for IRD calculation. Previously CABs were loaded by the MPE Import pipe in SIC Groups with classifier code MC_CAB. Now the MPE Import pipe doesn't load/update SIC Groups with classifier code MC_CAB and the IRD Calculation process gets CAB directly from the MPE_IP0075T1 table.
To see the MCC-CAB relation, use the menu items "OpenWay\MasterCard\MC. IRD Configuration\MC MCC CAB Groups" or "OpenWay\MasterCard Fee Prediction\MC MCC CAB Groups".
Upgrade Note:
Clients who use the MasterCard interface should manually delete all SIC Groups with the MC_CAB classifier (OpenWay\Full\Configuration Setup\Main Tables\SIC Groups). This is not mandatory, but now SIC Groups with the "MC_CAB" classifier will be not up-to-date. Use the menu item "OpenWay\MasterCard\MC. IRD Configuration\MC MCC CAB Groups" to see the up-to-date relation between MCCs and CABs.

CARDS-52360

MasterCard MCBS Import: Supported new format according to Global Operations Bulletin No. 2 - 1 February 2017.
Upgrade Note:
To load old format files, set the pipe parameter LINE_LENGTH=500.

MasterCard MCBS Import: Supported new format according to Global Operations Bulletin No. 2 - 1 February 2017.

CARDS-53033

MasterCard Services: Added services according to Release 17.Q3 article AN 1005.
Upgrade Note:
Acquirers in Asia Pacific region: Use Copy Configuration to synchronize MasterCard service packs from file \home\db\datax\config\MC_IRD_CFG_SP_CC.txt.

(MasterCard Services: Added services according to Release 17.Q3 article AN 1005)

CARDS-53040

MasterCard Services: Added services according to Release 17.Q3 article AN 1004.
Upgrade Note:
Acquirers in Europe region that participate in the Meal Voucher program must use Copy Configuration to synchronize MasterCard service packs from file \home\db\datax\config\MC_IRD_CFG_SP_CC.txt.

(MasterCard Services: Added services according to Release 17.Q3 article AN 1004.)

CARDS-53808

Areas: "South Sudan" (code SSD) is included in "MC: Middle East, Africa (E)" area.
Upgrade Note:
"South Sudan" (code SSD) must be manually included in "MC: Middle East, Africa (E)" area.

CARDS-55723

Supported multiple Tariff Segments loading by MPE Import. Affected pipes: com.openwaygroup.pipe.mc.mpe_import.jar.
Upgrade Note:
This change affects customers that use Fee Prediction and load tariffs from an MPE file. Multiple Tariff Segments loading has been supported. Customers are recommended to test Interchange Tariff loading from MPE files in their configuration.

CARDS-55960

Switched the MasterCard CDF Export pipe to CDF3 Schema Version 17.01.00.00.
Upgrade Note:
The MasterCard CDF Export pipe has been switched to CDF3 Schema Version 17.01.00.00.

CARDS-55999

Supported new DE22.7 value "7" ("Credential-on-file") processing.
Upgrade Note:
New DE22.7 value "7" ("Credential-on-file") processing has been supported. Additional The global parameter MC_RELEASE=18.Q3 must be set to export this new value to IPM file.

CARDS-56370

Changed MasterCard IRD SA configuration according to the article AN 1103.
Upgrade Note:
For acquirers from Asia Pacific region and who load IRD definitions from MPE file: use Copy Configuration to synchronize MasterCard IRD Configuration from the file \home\db\datax\config\MC_IRD_CFG_CFG_CC.txt.

CARDS-56371

Added new Interbank Reason Code "7827 EDP Adjustment Amount" according to MasterCard release 18.Q2 article AN 1097.
Upgrade Note:
Clients who use the MasterCard interface should manually add the new reason code in "Interbank Reason Codes" (OpenWay\Full\Configuration Setup\Transaction Types\Interbank Reason Codes) as described:
Channel is "MasterCard (IPM)", Chain Type is "Original", Dispute Trans Class is "Inward Fee Collection", Code is "7827", Name is "7827 EDP Adjustment Amount", Is Active is "Yes".

CARDS-56378

Changed MasterCard services according to article AN 1064.
Upgrade Note:
Acquirers in Europe, MEA, LAC regions: Use Copy Configuration to synchronize MasterCard service packs from file \home\db\datax\config\MC_IRD_CFG_SP_CC.txt.

CARDS-56499

Changed MasterCard services according to article AN 1056. Added an additional Service Pack: "STD-STD MC SPC - ATM Product Forbidden".
Upgrade Note:
Acquirers in all regions: Use Copy Configuration to synchronize MasterCard Service Packs from the file \home\db\datax\config\MC_IRD_CFG_SP_CC.txt.

CARDS-56567

Supported import of IP0048T1 and IP0050T1 tables from MasterCard MPE file.
Upgrade Note:
The IP0048T1 and IP0050T1 tables can be imported for custom needs. To import the IP0048T1 and IP0050T1 tables, the new ADD_TABLES pipe parameter should be set to the value "IP0048T1,IP0050T1" in the com.openwaygroup.pipe.mc.mpe_import.jar pipe.

CARDS-56650

Changed MasterCard IRDs SA, IRD 43 (for Europe acquirers only), and IRD 79 (for Europe acquirers only) configuration according to Article AN 1103 dated 06.02.2018.
Upgrade Note:
For acquirers from Asia Pacific and Europe region who load IRD definitions from the MPE file: use Copy Configuration to synchronize MasterCard IRD Configuration from the file "\home\db\datax\config\MC_IRD_CFG_CFG_CC.txt".

CARDS-56652

Modified messages for MasterCard reject errors 2402, 8581 and 8677 in Standard Handbook according to Article AN 1103 dated 06.02.2018.
Upgrade Note:
For acquirers from Asia Pacific region who load IRD definitions from the MPE file: use Copy Configuration to synchronize MasterCard IRD Configuration from the file "\home\db\datax\config\MC_IRD_CFG_CFG_CC.txt".

CARDS-56815

Added a new currency for Mauritania, OUGUIYA with code MRU/929 according to article AN 1488.
Upgrade Note:
1. Banks, especially issuers and acquirers that support DCC, should manually add a new currency to the Currency Table: Full Name OUGUIYA, Name MRU, Code 929 and Exponent 2 (OpenWay\Full\Configuration Setup\Main Tables\Currency  Table). Full Name for the old currency with Name MRO and Code 478 should be changed from "OUGUIYA" to "OUGUIYA (old)".
2. Banks, especially acquirers that support DCC, also should set the new currency for Mauritania in the Country Table (OpenWay\Full\Configuration Setup\Main Tables\Country Table) from the April Release date.
Updated Manuals: [ips_releases\mastercard\20XX_XX_MC_Requirements.pdf]

CARDS-56981

Rolled back the changes made by article AN 1103 on 06.02.2018 for MasterCard IRD 79 (only for Europe Acquirers) configuration according to the article AN 1103 on 27.02.2018.
Upgrade Note:
For acquirers from Europe region and who load IRD definitions from MPE file: use Copy Configuration to synchronize MasterCard IRD Configuration from the file \home\db\datax\config\MC_IRD_CFG_CFG_CC.txt.
Updated Manuals: [ips_releases\mastercard\20XX_XX_MC_Requirements.pdf]

Money transfers

CARDS-53816

B2B and G2B money transfers license validation has been implemented for the following transaction application codes: 
FD,GD,MD,OG,C02,C03,C04,C05,C06,C09,C55,C56,C57.
Upgrade Note:
To allow the system to process B2B (FD) money transfer transactions (application codes: FD,GD,MD,OG,C02,C03,C04,C05,C06,C09,C55,C56,C57), the appropriate license option must be configured. Please contact Customer Support.

CARDS-54224

B2B and G2B money transfers license validation has been implemented for the following transaction application codes: 
FD,GD,MD,OG,C02,C03,C04,C05,C06,C09,C55,C56,C57.
Upgrade Note:
To allow the system to process B2B (FD) money transfer transactions (application codes: FD,GD,MD,OG,C02,C03,C04,C05,C06,C09,C55,C56,C57), the appropriate license option must be configured. Please contact Customer Support.

CARDS-54212

Implemented specific card debit transfers license validation for the following transaction application codes: C07, C52, AA, PP.
Upgrade Note:
For money transfers to non-card accounts to work correctly, (AFT transactions with the codes C07, C52, PP, AA), license options must be configured. Contact Customer Support for additional information.

CARDS-54891

Changed VISA OCT reversal processing. OCT reversals with Target Channel "VISA SMS" are rejected with Return Code "12" and Posting Status "Under Workflow". OCT reversals with Target Channel "VISA" are not sent in the online phase and should be sent in clearing.
Upgrade Note:
In unforeseen situations (sending online reversals of OCT transactions to the VISA channel) a document is assigned the Under Workflow status - for manual analysis.
After reconciliation, documents with this status must be analysed and a decision taken on whether to post or reverse a document.
Updated Manuals: [transaction_management\Documents.pdf]

NSPK interface

CARDS-55861

Added a new DEFAULT_USAGE pipe parameter to define the bin_table.usage field for NSPK (MIR, JCB, AMEX, UPI) ranges and VISA/MC ranges not corresponding to the appropriate original IPS bin range. NSPK MPE Import.
Upgrade Note:
NSPK MPE Import: a new DEFAULT_USAGE pipe parameter has been added to define the bin_table.usage field for NSPK (MIR, JCB, AMEX, UPI) ranges and VISA/MC ranges not corresponding to the appropriate original IPS bin range. It is recommended to set DEFAULT_USAGE=H to avoid problems with P2P transactions from MIR cards to VISA/MC cards.

CARDS-50351

CH Payment Trans Type: Changed subtypes for "Our MIR Cards" and "MIR Cards". Now the "Fee Algorithm Options" field contains "SIC=6536;PTID_C06=6012;ACQ_ONLINE=Y;".
Upgrade Note:
CH Payment subtypes for "Our MIR Cards" and "MIR Cards" must be checked. The "Fee Algorithm Options" field must contain "SIC=6536;PTID_C06=6012;ACQ_ONLINE=Y;".

CARDS-56735

Added the ability to run several NSPK Export processes in parallel.
Upgrade Note:
Added the ability to use a sequence generated by DB file numbering, which allows several NSPK Export processes to be run simultaneously.

CARDS-53502

[MIR REL] 2017.2 B-05. NSPK Outward Processing (pipe): EMV tag 84 is filled with the "EMV_AID" document tag value if tag 84 is absent in addendum_doc chip data.
Upgrade Note:
If the "Affiliated BASEII Outward Processing" pipe is used for Host2Host interchange, the "EMV_AID" tag must be added to the pipe's "TAGS_TC50_<Processing BIN>" parameter to support [MIR REL] 2017.2 B-05.
Updated Manuals: [ips_releases\20XX_XX_NSPK_Requirements.pdf] [UFX_H2H_Interchange.pdf (NDA Specification for vendors)]

CARDS-55802

[MIR REL] 2018.1 B-20: NSPK MPE Import. Supported import of new file field BILCURRENCY_CODE. This field is stored in the CH_BILL_CURR tag in bin_table. To override this value, a new pipe parameter, CHANGE_CURR = "YYYXXX" can be used, where "YYY" is the currency code from the file and "XXX" is the currency code to store in the database.
Upgrade Note:
[MIR REL] 2018.1 B-20: NSPK MPE Import. Supported import of new file field BILCURRENCY_CODE. This field is stored in the CH_BILL_CURR tag in bin_table. To override this value, a new pipe parameter CHANGE_CURR = "YYYXXX" can be used, where "YYY" is the currency code from the file and "XXX" is the currency code to store in the database, for example CHANGE_CURR = "643810".

CARDS-55901

Supported new ODPT DE22.6 (Pos Entry Mode subfield) "10" value for incoming clearing messages according to B-16 NSPK Release article. Also changed processing for DE22.6="82" value on import. NSPK_RELEASE=18.1 additional global parameter must be set for new processing.
Upgrade Note:
A new ODPT DE22.6 (Pos Entry Mode subfield) "10" value for incoming clearing messages has been supported according to B-16 NSPK Release article. Also changed processing for DE22.6="82" value on import. NSPK_RELEASE=18.1 additional global parameter must be set for new processing.

CARDS-55904

Changed processing for DE22.5="4" value according to B-16 NSPK 18.1 release article for import files.  NSPK_RELEASE=18.1 additional global parameter must be set for new processing.
Upgrade Note:
Processing for DE22.5="4" value has been changed according to B-16 NSPK 18.1 release article for import files. NSPK_RELEASE=18.1 additional global parameter must be set for new processing.

CARDS-55987

Supported new [1240-220] adjustment message according to B-18 NSPK 18.1 release article. "EXT_CASE_ID" document tag will contain DE72 (dispute case id in NSPK) value.
Upgrade Note:
A new [1240-220] adjustment message has been supported according to B-18 NSPK 18.1 release article. These messages are imported to the database like adjustment (partial reverse) messages. Important: For correct processing of settlement documents received in [1644-685] (financial position) messages for [1240-220] adjustment messages, the optional DE26 reconciliation category must be selected in the NSPK questionnaire!

Notifications

CARDS-53300

For number variables (like %TRANS_AMOUNT%, %SUM(...)%) by default, if the format is not declared in the variable, use the formatting style (OpenWay\Full\Configuration Setup\Client Classifiers\Formatting Styles) with the "default" code.
Upgrade Note:
The "Formatting Styles" handbook (OpenWay\Full\Configuration Setup\Client Classifiers\Formatting Styles) must have a record with "Formatting Type"=Numbers, "Style Code"=default, and with the "Pattern" and "Decimal Separator" fields filled in. If this record is missing or incompletely filled in, it must be added or completed.
Updated Manuals: [product_management\Client_Messages.pdf]

CARDS-54717

Changed the result of a value returned by the %TRANS_REASON_DETAILS% variable. Now it returns the whole text from the doc.reason_details field instead of text from doc.add_info.
Upgrade Note:
In case the previous %TRANS_REASON_DETAILS% variable behaviour should be kept, it is recommended to find a setup that uses the variable and change %TRANS_REASON_DETAILS% to %DOC_TAGS% and %TRANS_REASON_DETAILS:tag% to %DOC_TAGS:tag%.
Check Scripts:
The check scripts below can be used to find message templates:
CARDS-54717_SMS_template_reason_details_01.sql
CARDS-54717_SMS_template_reason_details_02.sql
CARDS-54717_SMS_template_reason_details_03.sql
CARDS-54717_SMS_template_reason_details_04.sql
Updated Manuals: [notifications\transaction_notifications\Transaction_Notifications.pdf]

POS management

CARDS-52931

Now we store local transaction date time received from "Device H2H" to Document transaction Date.
Upgrade Note:
Now we store local transaction date time received from "Device H2H" to Document transaction Date.
Impact on: Member with "Device H2H" interface 
Old behavior: Document transaction date had local date time generated by host system.

Product inspector

CARDS-51966

The "OpenWay\Product Inspector\Test Data Clearing\" menu group has been renamed to "OpenWay\Product Inspector\Test Data Maintenance\".
Added a new menu item, "OpenWay\Product Inspector\Test Data Maintenance\Gather Tables Statistics" for gathering table (UT_TEST, UT_TEST_MSG, TEST_SCHEME, TEST_STEP) statistics.
Upgrade Note:
The "OpenWay\Product Inspector\Test Data Clearing\" menu group has been renamed to "OpenWay\Product Inspector\Test Data Maintenance\". 
Check and update links from custom menu items to the changed standard menu group.
Updated Manuals: [product_inspector\WAY4_Product_Inspector_Manual.pdf]

CARDS-53123

Check of RC and document status for the "set credit limit" Product Inspector step has been added.
Upgrade Note:
Now the system always checks the response code value and status of the credit limit document generated by the Product Inspector step. 
It is recommended:
- to fix the reasons for an incorrect response code and document status for a previously generated standard Product Inspector script.
- to indicate the new successful Product Inspector script and corresponding log as the standard ones.
Note: standard scripts and logs only need to be changed if a credit limit was set with an error.

CARDS-51348 / I1611305656

Product Inspector test script import has been modified when in the file being imported there are test scripts with codes that already exist: a UI dialog is displayed to confirm the script update. If script update is chosen, all the existing test steps will be deleted and the new one rewritten. This dialog window appears only if the pipe's SILENT mode parameter is switched off.
Upgrade Note:
Test script import has been modified. When the file being imported contains scripts with the same codes as those already in the database, and the user confirmed update, the old behaviour was to merge data: script steps from the file being imported whose numbers matched those already in the database were rewritten, and all other steps in the database (if any) remained unchanged. The new behaviour allows users to repeat confirmation of the need to update the script and old steps are totally deleted before writing new data from the file.
Updated Manuals: [product_inspector\WAY4_Product_Inspector_Manual.pdf]

CARDS-52474 / I1703160402

Product Inspector test script import has been modified when in the file being imported there are test scripts with the same codes that already exist in the destination WAY4Cards system. 
Previously, all test script steps already present in the destination database were deleted, which led to links being lost in comparing script results with the standard ones. This behaviour cannot be restored.
In the first step of the import procedure, all the existing test steps in the database are marked with the new status "Obsolete". In the second step, the system checks if the step number exists in the file being imported. If not, the step in the database is kept with the "Obsolete" status, otherwise the step gets a status and inherits other parameters from the file being imported. When a Product Inspector script is run, a step with the "Obsolete" status behaves the same way as a step with the "Skip" status.
Upgrade Note:
Product Inspector test script import has been modified when in the file being imported there are test scripts with the same codes that already exist in the destination WAY4Cards system. In the first step of the import procedure, all the existing test steps in the database are marked with the new status "Obsolete" (earlier steps were deleted). In the second step, the system checks if the step exists in the file being imported. If not, the step in the database is kept with the "Obsolete" status, otherwise the step gets a status and inherits other parameters from the file being imported. When a Product Inspector script is run, steps with the "Obsolete" status are processed the same way as  steps with the "Skip" status.
If a step with the "Obsolete" status isn't necessary, it is recommended to delete it from the Product Inspector script.
Updated Manuals: [product_inspector\WAY4_Product_Inspector_Manual.pdf]

Product management

CARDS-53017

For Transaction Types (TRANS_TYPE table) added Trans_Code unique check:
- in "Transaction Types" and "Transactions - All" forms with the button Actions... -> Check All
- in Message Dictionary generation with the menu OpenWay\Full\Configuration Setup\Main Tables\Generate Message Dictionary.
Upgrade Note:
Added an automatic check of the uniqueness of the value in a transaction type's Trans Code field when generating a transaction dictionary. Generation fails for records with a code that is not unique. Customer Support provides an additional test script for checking the configuration in advance. If records that are not unique are found, they must be corrected so that their codes are unique. Please contact Customer Support in the event of difficulties.
Updated Manuals: [core\Common_References_Books.pdf] [transaction_management\Documents.pdf]

CARDS-51878

Upgrade Note:
Contract Type settings will be validated on upgrade due to data changes in the "IPS Products" handbook. Process log and messages should be checked for reported errors and warnings after Contract Types validation, and the configuration should be corrected to eliminate these errors. Contact Customer Support for instructions on correcting errors.

CARDS-52152

The "Attachment" value has been removed from the "For contracts" list of available values for Service Packages. Additional Service Packages should be used for ATTACHMENT services.
Upgrade Note:
On system upgrade, the value For Contracts = "Attachment" in Service Package settings will automatically be replaced with For Contracts = "Additional". System behaviour is not affected.
Updated Manuals: [product_management\Service_Packages.pdf]

CARDS-52141 / I1702196631

Fixed amount calculation for standing orders with the BY_BATCH tag; now zero amount orders are not recalculated based on account balance.
Upgrade Note:
Behaviour of standing orders with BY_BATCH tag has changed. Orders with "Order Type" different than "Debit Amount" and "Credit Amount" will not generate any transfers. Earlier these orders generated transfers based on account balance ignoring batch processing.
Configuration should be checked and if such orders are used, reconfiguration should be made. Either the BY_BATCH tag should be removed from the order or the Order Type should be changed to "Debit Amount" or "Credit Amount" depending on business requirements.

Reversal management

CARDS-52675

Fixed changing of the "Is Ready" contract attribute when performing manual reversal management actions using DB Manager.
Upgrade Note:
Forms to fill in reversal management actions parameters have been changed to use the tvf_visualisation table instead of the appl_info table. 
If customized forms were used for reversal management they should be changed the same way.
Updated Manuals: [reversal_management\Reversal_Management.pdf]

CARDS-58556 / I1807084877

Added a check that CDU was performed for the contract involved in the backdated processing actions.
Upgrade Note:
Now if CDU for a contract has not been finished yet and the intelligent backdated processing is called for this contract (manual storno, previous cycle transaction conversion to instalment, etc.), the corresponding error is returned to ensure data consistency.
To finish CDU for this particular contract in the described situation and then to apply the Intelligent Backdated Processing action, the global parameter FORCE_CDU=Y must be set.

Risk management

CARDS-52022

Fixed incorrect processing of usage limiters with the SingleSliding period type when the limiter's period was not defined for a particular contract with an application or manually. Without this additional determination, the limiter is not analyzed.
Upgrade Note:
Fixed incorrect processing of usage limiters with the SingleSliding period type when the limiter's period was not defined for a particular contract. 
It is necessary to run the following query to check if this problem ever occurred:

select count(*) from usage_templ where limit_renew_type='s' and amnd_state = 'A';

If this query returns a non-zero value, contact Customer Support for further instructions.

SOA

UFX-278

Upgrade Note:
WAY4Gate, TS SOA UFX and various UFX export pipes now validate certain database table fields to have correct value (one of the enumerated values supported by WAY4Cards). This applies to the following fields: standing_order.is_active, acnt_contract.production_status, acnt_contract.check_usage.
If a custom value is encountered in any of these fields, an error will be raised.

Statistical Reports

CARDS-56949

Added a new parameter P_IF_ACTIVE_STMT (varchar2(1), the default value is "Y") for the "XLS_Visa_Statistics_Issuing_Business" report. The parameter defines how to calculate the "Number of Statements Mailed" value - by valid cards (=Y) or by all account contracts (=N).
Changed the P_REPORT_TYPE parameter processing to support writing SQL statements in it.
Upgrade Note:
Syntax for defining the P_REPORT_TYPE parameter value has been changed. For example: P_REPORT_TYPE="c.report_type = 'C'" instead of "'C'".
The parameter can be used for SQL query to select contracts with the statements mailed.
Updated Manuals: [visa_statistical_reports\quarterly_operating_certificates\VISA_Statistical_Reports.pdf]

CARDS-57645

Added a new parameter P_IF_ACTIVE_STMT (varchar2(1), the default value is "Y") for the "XLS_Visa_Statistics_Issuing_Business" report. The parameter defines how to calculate the "Number of Statements Mailed" value - by valid cards (=Y) or by all account contracts (=N).
Changed the P_REPORT_TYPE parameter processing to support writing SQL statements in it.
Upgrade Note:
Syntax for defining the P_REPORT_TYPE parameter value has been changed. For example: P_REPORT_TYPE="c.report_type = 'C'" instead of "'C'".
The parameter can be used for SQL query to select contracts with the statements mailed.

CARDS-56601

Corrected the logic for checking contract groups for a case when an acquiring MEMBER_ID changed during the reporting period. Now transactions are split into two groups by MEMBER_ID. This may downgrade performance of statistics collecting.
Upgrade Note:
Corrected the logic of statistics gathering for a case when an acquiring MEMBER_ID changed during the reporting period. Recommended to check performance of gathering statistics on database with data volumes like production database.

CARDS-56746

Deleted report form 'Trial Balance.rdf' as obsolete.
Upgrade Note:
Deleted report form 'Trial Balance.rdf' as obsolete. Use new versions of Trial Balance report.

CARDS-57085

Enhanced determination of the IPS Member Identifier (MEMBER_ID stat attribute) for acquiring contracts (statistical contract groups for acquiring contracts): now "Payment Scheme Identification" (OpenWay\Full\Statistics\Dictionaries\Payment Scheme Identification) can be configured to specify the correct MEMBER_ID.
Upgrade Note:
Enhanced determination of the IPS Member Identifier (MEMBER_ID stat attribute) while statistics gathering. The old behaviour is not supported.
Updated Manuals: [amex_statistical_reports\AMEX_Statistical_Reports.pdf] [mastercard_statistical_reports\quarterly_mastercard_reporting\MC_Statistical_Reports.pdf] [visa_statistical_reports\quarterly_operating_certificates\VISA_Statistical_Reports.pdf]

CARDS-57566

Supported the ability to configure additional groups in the SIC_GROUP table to arrange data groups in the "Billing by Industry for ..." sections.
Upgrade Note:
In the "XLS_AMEX_Statistics_Issuing_Business" report, the new parameter P_CLASSIFIER_TYPE can be used to form the Industry split fields. It specifies the classifier for a group (trans_group.trans_sic -> sic.code -> sic_group_tree -> sic_group.name).

CARDS-57625

Enhanced logic for 'Cards at end of quarter' field in report "XLS_MC_Statistics_Issuing_Business" - exclude blocked cards.
Upgrade Note:
Changed logic for counting blocked cards for 'Cards at end of quarter'  in "XLS_MC_Statistics_Issuing_Business". Old behavior is not supported.

CARDS-57690

Enhanced contract cache in gathering statistics for performance reasons.
Upgrade Note:
Recommended to check performance of gathering statistics on database with data volumes like production database.

CARDS-57970

Added a new parameter P_PAYMENT_SCHEME (varchar2(255), default value is "W") for the "XLS_NSPK_Statistics_Acquiring_Business" and "XLS_NSPK_Statistics_Acquiring_Devices" reports.
The parameter defines payment schemes which should be present in the report.
Upgrade Note:
The default payment scheme MP_PS_MEMBER.PAYMENT_SCHEME for which the "XLS_NSPK_Statistics_Acquiring_Business" and "XLS_NSPK_Statistics_Acquiring_Devices" reports are generated has been changed. To return to the old report behaviour, specify all payment schemes MP_PS_MEMBER.PAYMENT_SCHEME for which the report was generated earlier in the P_PAYMENT_SCHEME parameter.
Updated Manuals: [mir_statistical_reports\MIR_Statistical_Reports.pdf]

CARDS-58382

Added a new parameter P_ADDRESS_LINE for the "XLS_Visa_Statistics_Acquiring_Business" report (varchar2(255), default value is "to_char(c.billing_contract) || ad.address_line_1") for customising calculation of merchant outlets.
Upgrade Note:
To return the old report behaviour, set the P_ADDRESS_LINE parameter to "ad.address_line_1". In this case, for two merchants who have the same address, the number of merchant outlets is calculated as 1.
Updated Manuals: [visa_statistical_reports\quarterly_operating_certificates\VISA_Statistical_Reports.pdf]

CARDS-58383

Changed logic for 'New Cards Obtained During the Quarter' 
 field in 'XLS_MC_Statistics_Issuing_Business'
Upgrade Note:
Changed logic for 'New Cards Obtained During the Quarter' 
 field in 'XLS_MC_Statistics_Issuing_Business' - exclude condition for card date expire. The old behaviour is not supported.

CARDS-58129 / I1805161998

Added a new parameter P_CACHE_MTR (varchar2(1), default value is = "Y") for the "XLS_Visa_Statistics_Issuing_Business.rdf" report. The parameter makes it possible to use temporary tables to cache useful data to improve performance in the "Card Issuance" report section.
Upgrade Note:
Recommended to check performance of the "XLS_Visa_Statistics_Issuing_Business" report in database with amounts of data comparable to production database.

CARDS-58079 / I1805163324

Corrected parameter name P_TRN_BALANCE_TRASFER -> P_TRN_BALANCE_TRANSFER in the XLS_MC_Statistics_Issuing_Business report.
Defined the default value for parameter P_TRN_BALANCE_TRANSFER = "Balance Transfers".
Changed the default value for parameter P_TRN_PAYMENT from "CH Payment" to "Payments".
Upgrade Note:
Changed logic for 'Balance Transfers' and 'Payments' field in the report XLS_MC_Statistics_Issuing_Business. To return the old behavior, you must:
- change value of parameter P_TRN_PAYMENT to "CH Payment"
- value for the new parameter P_TRN_BALANCE_TRANSFER should be  identical to the out-of-date P_TRN_BALANCE_TRASFER.
Updated Manuals: [mastercard_statistical_reports\quarterly_mastercard_reporting\MC_Statistical_Reports.pdf]

CARDS-58073 / I1805174949

Changed counting of contracts that are shown in HDR section of the "XLS_MC_Statistics_Issuing_Business" report:
-Breakout of EMV-compliant Chip-enabled Cards 
-Of which are MasterCard contactless enabled 
-Total MasterCard contactless Cards issued 
-Total MasterCard contactless enabled Phones issued 
-Total MasterCard contactless enabled alternative form factors.
Now only valid and blocked contracts as of the end of the billing period are counted (previously only valid contracts were counted).
Upgrade Note:
Changed logic for counting cards (use of card status) in the "XLS_MC_Statistics_Issuing_Business" report. Old behaviour is no longer supported.

CARDS-58245 / I1805174949

In report "XLS_MC_Statistics_Issuing_Business" 
added number formatting for section "Transactions Feature Details"
for "Cards at beginning of quarter" exclude blocked cards, as for "Cards at end of quarter"
Upgrade Note:
Changed logic for counting blocked cards for "Cards at beginning of quarter" in "XLS_MC_Statistics_Issuing_Business". Old behavior is not supported.

Tariff management

CARDS-51721

A new Tariff Role, "Conversion" has been supported to define FX Rate markup. These tariffs are used in multi-currency acquiring Products to support an acquirer conversion margin over the bank's internal or external FX rates and merchant reimbursement in a currency other than the transaction settlement currency.
Upgrade Note:
During the upgrade process, the global parameter USE_FX_TARIFF_ROLE=N; will be set if FX Rate markup (FX_TARIFF) configurations configured with tariffs set in Services are present in the system. After upgrade and after the corresponding updates to external systems exporting rate values for their subsequent import to WAY4 Cards, the procedure for changing tariff role settings must be run using the new menu item OpenWay\Full\DB Administrator Utilities\Special OpenWay Utilities\Tariff Switch FX Tariff Role. 
The procedure can be run in the following modes:
 - "Check only" - check only, data will not be updated.
 - "Check and Update" - all checks and changes to the data of active tariffs set in Services and tariff types (tariff_group) are made, and the USE_FX_TARIFF_ROLE parameter will be given the "Y" value as a result.
Updated Manuals: [tags description] [tariff_management\Tariff_Management.pdf]

CARDS-51486

Additional validation for global tariff data input has been added. When "Start Date" is not specified, the ability to set the tariff from the current banking date will be validated. When it is prohibited, the error message "Tariff Start Date Missing" will be returned.
Upgrade Note:
When importing global tariffs with an empty start date through the Tariff Import and Tariff Domains pipes, the error "Global Tariff cannot be applied from current date" will be returned. To import a global tariff with an empty start date and approve it with the current banking date, "ANY_DATE" must be set for the pipes' DATE_CHECK_MODE parameter.

Transaction management

CARDS-52529

Enhanced inheritance of document tags, transaction conditions and attributes to a financial presentment from an authorization document. In addition to inheritance for documents from our devices, attributes are inherited for our issuing documents and sponsor for acquirer documents. Sponsor document inheritance can be turned off by using the COND_INH_FOR_AFF global parameter where "Y" allows attribute inheritance and "N" disables it. The document tag with same values can also be used.
Upgrade Note:
In addition to inheritance for documents from our devices, "Transaction Condition", "Transaction Condition Attributes"  and "Additional Information tags" are inherited for our issuing documents and sponsor for acquirer documents. If sponsor documents should not inherit these attributes, the COND_INH_FOR_AFF global parameter should be set to "N" (do not inherit). The parameter's default value is "Y" (inherit attributes). The document tag COND_INH_FOR_AFF with the same values can also be used.
It is recommended to verify financial document processing results for the following cases:
1. Issuer:
- single/multiple financial document matched with authorizations for transactions with own cards card on own devices.
- single/multiple financial document matched with authorizations for transactions with own cards on foreign devices.
- single/multiple financial document matched with authorizations for transactions with own cards on affiliated host devices.
2. Acquirer:
- financial document linked to pre-authorization (by the PREAUTH_ID tag in the doc.add_info field) performed with foreign card on own device. 
- financial document linked to pre-authorization (by the PREAUTH_ID tag in the doc.add_info field) performed with affiliated card on own device. 
3. Sponsor for acquirer:
- financial document matched with the transit authorization performed with foreign card on affiliated host devices. 
- financial document matched with the transit authorization performed with affiliated card on affiliated host devices. 
4. Sponsor for issuer:
- financial document matched with the transit authorization performed with affiliated card on foreign host devices. 
- financial document matched with the transit authorization performed with affiliated card on affiliated host devices.
Updated Manuals: [core\Global_Parameters.pdf] [tags description] [transaction_management\Documents.pdf]

CARDS-51960

Country Table: Revised record for Madagascar. Code (3 bytes) must be "MDG", Code (2 bytes) must be "MG", Code (Numeric) must be "450", Curr Name must be "MALAGASY ARIARY", Curr Code must be "MGA", N Curr Code must be "969". No impact on transaction processing.
Upgrade Note:
Open form "Country Table" (menu item "OpenWay\Full\Configuration Setup\Main Tables\Country Table") and check that the record for Madagascar has the following values: Code (3 bytes) must be "MDG", Code (2 bytes) must be "MG", Code (Numeric) must be "450", Curr Name must be "MALAGASY ARIARY", Curr Code must be "MGA", N Curr Code must be "969".

CARDS-52803

A new global parameter AUTH_AMOUNT_DIFF_PCNT_RETAIL has been added. The new parameter is used for all transactions except those with hotel, car rental or airline MCC codes, for which the existing parameter AUTH_AMOUNT_DIFF_PCNT is used. This parameter can set the maximum difference between authorization and financial presentment amounts as a percentage. If the difference is below this value, the whole blocked amount will be unblocked, otherwise only the financial amount will be unblocked.
Upgrade Note:
Starting with version 03.44, the algorithm for unblocking authorization amounts during financial document processing has been changed. A new global parameter AUTH_AMOUNT_DIFF_PCNT_RETAIL has been added that sets the maximum difference between authorization and financial presentment amounts as a percentage. If the difference is exceeds this value, when processing a financial document, the corresponding error message will be generated and the difference between the authorization amount and financial presentment amount will be blocked.
The parameter is used for all transactions, with the exception of transactions with several financial documents for one authorization (for example in the case of car rental, hotel reservations). The global parameter AUTH_AMOUNT_DIFF_PCNT is used for these exceptions.
The aforementioned behaviour impacts document processing in issuer systems. To restore previous system behaviour when the whole authorization amount was blocked, set the global parameter AUTH_AMOUNT_DIFF_PCNT_RETAIL a value allowing a 100% difference between authorization and financial presentment amounts.
Updated Manuals: [core\Global_Parameters.pdf]

CARDS-53548

Card Expire information will not be inherited from an authorization if it is already filled in the financial document.
Upgrade Note:
Card Expire information will not be inherited from an authorization/pre-authorization/transit authorization document if it is already filled in a financial document. This behaviour is required, for example, for tokenization transaction processing. Interfaces using expire date information from a financial document may be impacted. An interface should be changed to get the card expire date from authorization/pre-authorization/transit authorization document to support previous system behaviour.

CARDS-58520

Eliminated attempts to fill BIN record reference on document accept and other card related checks for non-card contracts. The target contract's contract category is now checked instead of the transaction type's contract category.
Upgrade Note:
AUTH_TYPE and PAN document tags are no longer filled for mVisa payments. If the AUTH_TYPE tag was used to identify mVisa payments in product settings (e.g. services or usages), other distinguishing characteristic should be chosen (e.g. the BAI tag) and corresponding settings should be changed.

CARDS-54159 / I1610077363,I1702062338

Enhanced the "Lost Authorizations" form to show authorizations with the "Inactive" posting status that remain active due to partial financial clearing. The currently blocked amount is now shown as a separate column.
Upgrade Note:
Changed the "Lost Authorizations" form data source. The form is now based on the ACTIVE_AUTH_DOC view. If custom forms based on "Lost Authorizations" were used, consider reimplementing them using the new view that shows active authorizations with a posting status other than "Posted".
Updated Manuals: [core\Special_Contract_Utilities.pdf]

CARDS-54454

Upgrade Note:
To support payment system requirements for VISA Fast Funds and MasterCard MoneySend, and to make payments to MIR payment system cards from Russian state institutions, WAY4 can be configured for fast transfer of funds. The use of these settings is determined by the global parameters VISA_FAST_FUNDS, MC_FAST_FUNDS, and MIR_FAST_FUNDS with the "Y" value in the form OpenWay\Full\Configuration Setup\Main Tables\Additional Global Parameters. 
The mechanism for processing fast transfers has changed. 
Now when a document is imported from a payment system clearing file, as before, a document in WAY4 is generated with the transaction type Notif Prs Credit Item. Further, if the original financial document generated online from an authorization is found when the clearing document is processed by Document Processing, the Notif Prs Credit Item clearing document will be successfully processed with the response code "Successfully completed". 
If the original financial document is not found when processing the clearing document, processing of Notif Prs Credit Item will fail. The warning "Presentment not found for fast funds notification, converting to presentment" will be generated and the clearing document's transaction type will be changed to CH Payment. The next time Document Processing is run to process a clearing document, the updated parameters will be used. 
Issuers offering their cardholders this service are highly recommended to test this functionality online and in clearing. 
In addition, the following checks are required: 
1. Execute the following query and contact Customer Support if the query returns a non-empty result: 
select * from trans_type where amnd_state = 'A' and chain_type = 'X' and prev_trans_type is not null; 
2. Check Our EuroCard/MasterCard and Our Cirrus/Maestro card Service Package settings for trigger conditions in the Service for CH Payment transactions
"DOC_TAG=PTID;DOC_TAG_VALUE=C07,C52,C53,C54,C55,C56,C57,C67;", explicitly identifying express transfer transactions. 
3. Check the settings of menu items for importing VISA and MasterCard clearing information for the presence of the  USE_PAYMENT_TRANSACTION = N parameter. The USE_PAYMENT_TRANSACTION = N parameter is not compatible with  VISA Fast Funds and MasterCard MoneySend, and for payments by Russian state institutions to MIR payment system cards. 
If USE_PAYMENT_TRANSACTION = N is used, contact Customer Support.

CARDS-55740

Increased the length of the fields DOC.REASON_CODE, DSP_REASON.CODE, REASON_CODE.CODE, REASON_ACTION.TGT_REASON_CODE, DISPUTE_TYPE.INW_REASON_CODE, DISPUTE_TYPE.REASON_CODE, DISPUTE_ITEM.INW_REASON_CODE, DISPUTE_ITEM.REASON_CODE, CM_CASE_DOC.REASON_CODE from 4 to 32 symbols.
Upgrade Note:
This change was made to support VISA Claim Resolution requirements. Long values for custom Reason Codes can only be used for VCR purposes. All custom interfaces that might export/import VISA dispute documents should support long Reason Code values.
The corresponding views are also impacted and they should be synchronised.

UnionPay interface

CARDS-53270

UPI Audit Trailer Import. Supported creating settlement documents for Fee Collection/ Funds Disbursements (FCP file).
Upgrade Note:
1. If message codes S2III1ZF, S2III2ZF, S2IAI1ZF, S2IAI2ZF are configured for the UPI channel (menu item "OpenWay\Full\Configuration Setup\Transaction Types\Message Types - All"), the bank should delete them.
2. Add the new transaction type "Fee Collection and Funds Disbursement Total" (menu item "OpenWay\Full\Configuration Setup\Transaction Types\Transactions - All").
3. Add new message codes S1--I--F, S2I-I1ZF, S2I-I2ZF, S2O-I2ZF
Contact Customer Support for details.

UnionPay Interface: Added the OUT_ST=Y; tag to the "CH Payment" and "CH Payment Rev" message types.
Upgrade Note:
Manually add the "OUT_ST=Y;" tag in the "Msg Details" field of the "Message Types - All" form (OpenWay\Full\Configuration Setup\Transaction Types\Message Types - All).

CARDS-51706 / I1611079238

Union Pay Inward Processing: Fixed Settlement S2 level amounts. Union Pay Audit Trailer Import: Added Settlement S2 level for Reimbursement Fees. Manual Action: adding message types for S2 level Reimbursement Fees.
Upgrade Note:
New message types must be added (Full/Configuration Setup/Transaction Types/Message Types - All): 
Acq Reimb Fee Detail Online (Code S2-AF---0, Trans type "Acq Reimb Fee Detail"),
Acq Reimb Fee Detail Batch (Code S2-AF---1, Trans type "Acq Reimb Fee Detail"),
Acq Reimb Fee Detail Total Dispute and manual (Code S2-AF---2, Trans type "Acq Reimb Fee Detail"),
Iss Reimb Fee Detail Online (Code S2-IF---0, Trans type "Iss Reimb Fee Detail"),
Iss Reimb Fee Detail Batch (Code S2-IF---1, Trans type "Iss Reimb Fee Detail"),
Iss Reimb Fee Detail Total Dispute and manual (Code S2-IF---2.Trans type "Iss Reimb Fee Detail").

CARDS-54735

Replaced "CUP Inward Processing.dll" with a new java pipe, "com.openwaygroup.pipe.cup.inward_processing.jar". Removed the pipe parameters CHANNEL, CHANGE_CURR_IN, and EXT_CURR_EXP. Supported loading of Intra-currency Settlement Block File.
Upgrade Note:
For WAY4Cards version from 03.46.20:
The client must check the menu item that is used to run Union Pay Outward Processing and change it according to the new corresponding standard menu item (OpenWay\UPI\UPI. Daily Procedures\UPI. Inward Processing\UPI Inward Processing). If the menu item used the parameters CHANGE_CURR_IN and/or EXT_CURR_EXP, currency/currency exponent overrides must be configured in the database according to the WAY4 "Currency Conversion" document, section "Redefining Currency for clearing documents".
For WAY4Cards version from 03.44.30:
Loading of Intra-currency Settlement Files has been supported. Contact Customer Support for the installation manual.

VISA interface

CARDS-52013

A new parameter (FI) has been added for package opt_classify functions (used for statistics reports).
The CLASSIFY_DWD_CARD_CATEGORY() and PACKAGED_MAPPING() parameters will be used by regression tests.
Upgrade Note:
opt_classify has been changed and should be merged if previously customised.

CARDS-56146

Enhanced determination of the IPS Member Identifier (Member_ID) for account contracts (statistical contract groups for account contracts). Now Member_ID is calculated as Member_ID of the card contracts subordinate to the account contract while before Member_ID was calculated based on the interchange routing settings.
Supported an optional IPS Member Identifier set up for reporting purposes:
- The ability to define Acquiring/Issuing Member ID by IPS.
- The ability to aggregate reporting data that belong to different financial institutions under the same Member ID.
- The ability to report financial institution data with the different Member IDs by Issuing BINs.
Added the new menu item OpenWay\Full\Statistics\Dictionaries\Payment Scheme Identification.
For more details, please refer to the OW_HOME\manuals\language\MasterCard_statistical_reports\Quarterly_MasterCard_Reporting\MC_Statistical_Reports.pdf,
 OW_HOME\manuals\language\VISA_statistical_reports\Quarterly_Operating_Certificates\VISA_Statistical_Reports.pdf,
 OW_HOME\manuals\language\AMEX_statistical_reports\AMEX_statistical_reports.pdf.
Upgrade Note:
Determination of the IPS Member Identifier (Member_ID) for account contracts (statistical contract groups for account contracts) has been corrected to avoid inconsistencies in data. Now Member_ID is calculated as Member_ID of the card contracts that are subordinate to the account contract while before Member_ID was calculated based on the interchange routing settings. 
Previous system behaviour is no longer supported. For more details, please refer to the following documentation: OW_HOME\manuals\language\MasterCard_statistical_reports\Quarterly_MasterCard_Reporting\MC_Statistical_Reports.pdf, 
 OW_HOME\manuals\language\VISA_statistical_reports\Quarterly_Operating_Certificates\VISA_Statistical_Reports.pdf, 
 OW_HOME\manuals\language\AMEX_statistical_reports\AMEX_statistical_reports.pdf manuals.
Updated Manuals: [amex_statistical_reports\AMEX_Statistical_Reports.pdf] [Datamart\manuals\language\Datamart_User_Manual.pdf] [mastercard_statistical_reports\quarterly_mastercard_reporting\MC_Statistical_Reports.pdf] [mir_statistical_reports\MIR_Statistical_Reports.pdf] [visa_statistical_reports\quarterly_operating_certificates\VISA_Statistical_Reports.pdf]

CARDS-52928 / I1612082576

VISA BASEII Outward Processing (pipe): changed the logic for filling the "Reimbursement Attribute" field (TCx5 TCR 0 pos 168). Now the default value of the REIMB_ATTR_FROM_SERVICE parameter is "Y" instead of "N". If the REIMB_ATTR_FROM_SERVICE parameter is set to "Y", the "Reimbursement Attribute" field (TCx5 TCR 0 pos 168) will be filled with doc.TARGET_FEE_CODE field, if doc.TARGET_FEE_CODE is null, this field will be filled automatically by the pipe itself. Please review VISA services settings or if Fee Prediction is used, set up WAY4 according to the "VISA_RA_Configuration" manual. If the REIMB_ATTR_FROM_SERVICE parameter is set to "N", the "Reimbursement Attribute" field (TCx5 TCR 0 pos 168) is always calculated by the pipe itself. If the latter behaviour is needed, the parameter REIMB_ATTR_FROM_SERVICE = "N" should be set in the pipe.
Upgrade Note:
VISA BASEII Outward Processing (pipe): changed the logic for filling the "Reimbursement Attribute" field (TCx5 TCR 0 pos 168). Now the default value of the REIMB_ATTR_FROM_SERVICE parameter is "Y" instead of "N". If the REIMB_ATTR_FROM_SERVICE parameter is set to "Y", the "Reimbursement Attribute" field (TCx5 TCR 0 pos 168) will be filled with doc.TARGET_FEE_CODE field, if doc.TARGET_FEE_CODE is null, this field will be filled automatically by the pipe itself. Please review VISA services settings or if Fee Prediction is used, set up WAY4 according to the "VISA_RA_Configuration" manual. If the REIMB_ATTR_FROM_SERVICE parameter is set to "N", the "Reimbursement Attribute" field (TCx5 TCR 0 pos 168) is always calculated by the pipe itself. If the latter behaviour is needed, the parameter REIMB_ATTR_FROM_SERVICE = "N" should be set in the pipe.
Updated Manuals: [visa_interface\VISA_Interface.pdf]

The menu item "Re-classify Card Products with DWD_CARD_CATEGORY" used for statistics  reports now supports product mapping for "DEFERRED_DEBIT" and "CHARGE" card category values.
Upgrade Note:
opt_classify has been changed and should be merged if previously customised.

CARDS-52489

The default value of the P_CEMEA parameter in the "Visa_Statistics_Acquiring_Business" report has been changed, the new value is "Y".

In generating a report for CEMEA region, set the P_CEMEA parameter to "Y" or use the default value.
In generating a report for EUROPE region, set the P_CEMEA parameter to "N".

CARDS-55114

Modified the XLS_Visa_Statistics_Issuing_Business.rdf report. Now "Number of Statements Mailed" and "Number of Statements Mailed with Finance Charges" are gathered only for card categories with the parent value of card programme = "CREDIT" (DWD_CARD_CATEGORY classifier values with the "Parent value"="CREDIT") and multiplied on billing cycles number.

Added new parameters:
- P_FILTER_11
- P_FILTER_12
Upgrade Note:
Old behavior for "Number of Statements Mailed" and "Number of Statements Mailed with Finance Charges" in 'XLS_Visa_Statistics_Issuing_Business' report not supported.
Updated Manuals: [visa_statistical_reports\quarterly_operating_certificates\VISA_Statistical_Reports.pdf]

CARDS-57350

Fixed processing VCR Dispute response financial reversal in "VISA SMS Inward Processing pipe."
Upgrade Note:
To process a VCR Dispute response financial reversal by the VISA SMS Inward Processing pipe, new message_codes must be set up in the "OpenWay\Full\Configuration Setup\Transaction Types\Message Types - All" menu item, common settings: "Channel" - "VISA SMS", Category - "Reversal", Is Authorization - "FIN"
1) Name = "ATM 2Prs Rev", Code = "0220_5_SMSR", Trans Type = "ATM 2Prs"
2) Name = "Retail SMS 2Prs Rev", Code = "0220_5_SMS05R", Trans Type = "Retail 2Prs"
3) Name = "CH Payment 2Prs Rev", Code = "0220_5_SMS062R", Trans Type = "CH Payment 2Prs"
4) Name = "CH Debit 2Prs Rev", Code = "0220_5_SMS051R", Trans Type = "CH Debit 2Prs"

CARDS-52171 / I1702213736:B: Visa Croatia: wrong region defined between EEA card & Croatia merchant (ICFEE-164)

VISA Country Table. Now the direct area for Croatia is VISA: European Economic Area Sub-region. Manual Action! No impact on transaction processing.
Upgrade Note:
Open the "Country Table" form (menu item "OpenWay\Full\Configuration Setup\Main Tables\Country Table") and set Croatia Direct Area "VISA: European Economic Area Sub-region" instead of "VISA: Visa Europe (3)".

CARDS-56487 / I1710090102

Upgrade Note:

CARDS-55432 / I1710136911

Fixed temporary behaviour of the VISA SMS Outward pipe, when DE65 (SRN) was inherited for 2Prs from 1Prs (this could be necessary for initial NSPK connection). Now DE65 (SRN) for 2Prs is inherited from Chbk by default. For legacy behaviour, the new SRN_FROM_PRS = Y pipe parameter must be set.
Upgrade Note:
Temporary behaviour of the VISA SMS Outward pipe, when DE65 (SRN) was inherited for 2Prs from 1Prs, has been fixed (this could be necessary for initial NSPK connection). Now DE65 (SRN) is inherited for 2Prs from Chbk by default. For legacy behaviour, the new SRN_FROM_PRS = Y pipe parameter must be set.
