CARDS-51662

[VISA REL] Apr17-341 2.2 : Added new Commercial Product ID 'X' to the default value of the 'COMMERCIAL_PRODUCT_ID' pipe parameter.
Upgrade Note:
[VISA REL] Apr17-341 2.2 : The default value of the 'COMMERCIAL_PRODUCT_ID' pipe (VISA BIN Table Import) parameter has been extended. BIN range with the new commercial product ID 'X' will be marked as a commercial category. If a custom value of the 'COMMERCIAL_PRODUCT_ID' pipe parameter is used, it is necessary to add the new commercial product ID (code 'X') to the value.

CARDS-52234

VISA Fee Prediction: Added Fee Program Areas for Visa Gold purchase and credit voucher transactions for Japan issuers.
Upgrade Note:
Visa will implement changes to interregional and AP regional fee structures that apply to Visa Gold transactions issued from Japan. Acquirers must support the changes to the fee programs that will be assessed on Visa Gold purchase and credit voucher transactions for Japan issuers. According to this release requirement acquirers must configure Fee Program Areas in the Standard Handbook manually: Handbook Type is FEE_PREDICTION__FEE_PROGRAM_AREA, for Filter1 values "1","B","C","E","F" Name must be "Interregional" and Code must be "JPN". Furthermore, acquirers in the AP region must add an extra record in the Standard Handbook: Handbook Type is FEE_PREDICTION__FEE_PROGRAM_AREA, for Filter1 value "A" Name must be "Intra-AP" and Code must be "JPN".
Updated Manuals: [visa_interface\20XX_XX_VISA_Requirements.pdf]

CARDS-54107

VISA Fee Collection/Funds Transfer Reason Codes. Changed description for reason code 0150 to "Recovered card handling fees or rewards and ATM BI acquiring direct fee returns". Also revised all Fee Collection/Funds Transfer Reason Codes.
Upgrade Note:
Changed name for VISA reason code V150 to "Recovered card handling fees or rewards and ATM BI acquiring direct fee returns" (menu item OpenWay\Full\Configuration Setup\Transaction Types\Interbank Reason Codes). Contact Customer Support for the Copy Configuration file with the full list of revised VISA Fee Collection/Funds Transfer Reason Codes.
Updated Manuals: [visa_interface\20XX_XX_VISA_Requirements.pdf]

CARDS-55951

Added the ability to process (import and export) VCR status advices via the UFX H2H interface.
Upgrade Note:
Added the ability to export and to import advices for "outgoing" transactions (for example VISA VCR advices for originator of transaction) via the UFX H2H Interface ("IC Documents Import" and "IC Documents Export" pipes with MODE=H2H pipe parameter set).

To avoid duplicates, exported records are marked with the "H2H_SENT=Y;" document tag. The recommended additional condition for the FILTER pipe parameter to export such transactions is "doc.source_channel = <Aff channel> and doc.target_channel = 'V' and doc.outward_status = 'C' and doc.fx_settl_date beetwen (<date1>,<date2>)". For correct export of advices for "outgoing" transactions, additional settings of the current menu items used for H2H document export (IC Documents Export pipe) are required:

If a menu item has FILE_SENDER and FILE_RECEIVER pipe parameters explicitly set as a constant value (not as an sql expression) then the FILTER pipe parameter of the existing menu item should be modified as specified above.

If FILE_SENDER and FILE_RECEIVER parameters are not set (the default values are DOC.SEND_MEMBER_ID and DOC.TARGET_MEMBER_ID respectively) or they are set as another sql expression it is recommended to create a separate menu item with FILE_SENDER=DOC.REC_MEMBER_ID and FILE_RECEIVER=DOC.SOURCE_MEMBER_ID parameters. The FILTER pipe parameter described above should be also added to the pipe in the new menu item.

Note that the proposed settings are recommended and are subject to testing on a particular WAY4 system configuration. Contact Customer Support if any obstacles are encountered during the testing.

No additional settings are needed for the "IC Documents Import" pipe to import advices for "outgoing" transactions.
Updated Manuals: [UFX_H2H_Interchange.pdf (NDA Specification for vendors)]

CARDS-56111

Added a new currency with Full Name "DOBRA", Name "STN", Code "930" and Exponent "2". The old currency DOBRA has been renamed to "DOBRA (old)". Changed currency codes for the country "Sao Tome And Principe".
Upgrade Note:
Clients should manually change Full Name of currency with Full Name "DOBRA", Name "STD", Code "678" to "DOBRA (old)" (OpenWay\Full\Configuration Setup\Main Tables\Currency Table).
Clients should manually add a new currency with Full Name "DOBRA", Name "STN", Code "930" and Exponent "2" (OpenWay\Full\Configuration Setup\Main Tables\Currency Table).
Clients should manually change "Curr Code", "N Curr Code" for the country "Sao Tome And Principe" to "STN", "930" on the date of VISA April 2018 Release implementation (OpenWay\Full\Configuration Setup\Main Tables\Country Table).
Updated Manuals: [visa_interface\20XX_XX_VISA_Requirements.pdf]

CARDS-56126

Added new SICs 3834, 3835, 3836 according to VISA Release Apr18-783 Global Mandatory Changes to Merchant Category Codes.
Upgrade Note:
Clients should manually add the following SICs (MCCs):
1. "3834 Baymont Inn & Suites" with Code 3834 and Group Code "H"
2. "3835 Dolce" with Code 3835 and Group Code "H"
3. "3836 Hawthorne Suites by Wyndham" with Code 3836 and Group Code "H"
To do so, use the menu item "OpenWay\Full\Configuration Setup\Main Tables\SIC Codes".
Also, these SICs must be added to Direct Group "Hotel/Motel (Lodging)".
To do so, use the [Direct Groups] button in the "SIC Codes" form (OpenWay\Full\Configuration Setup\Main Tables\SIC Codes).
After adding, click on the [Normalize] button in the form for each of these SICs.
Updated Manuals: [visa_interface\20XX_XX_VISA_Requirements.pdf]

CARDS-57005

Changed SIC (MCC) 3835 name from "3835 Dolce" to "3835 Dolce Hotels and Resorts".
Upgrade Note:
Clients should manually change name of SIC (MCC) 3835 to "3835 Dolce Hotels and Resorts".
To do so, use the menu item "OpenWay\Full\Configuration Setup\Main Tables\SIC Codes".
Updated Manuals: [visa_interface\20XX_XX_VISA_Requirements.pdf]

CARDS-58023

Restored currency BOLIVAR FUERTE for Venezuela.
Upgrade Note:
Clients should check that the currency for Venezuela (OpenWay\Full\Configuration Setup\Main Tables\Country Table) is BOLIVAR FUERTE (VEF/937).

CARDS-56502 / I1710317086

Changed the VISA_FAST_FUNDS additional global parameter default value from the existing value "Y" to a new value "A". If VISA_FAST_FUNDS is set to "A", all original credit transactions will be converted into notifications regardless of the Fast Funds Indicator value. For all other transactions, the processing logic remains unchanged. The changes affect the VISA Base II Inward Processing and Affiliated Base II Inward Processing pipes. Please see CUN for required additional actions.
Upgrade Note:
A new default value ("A") has been added for the existing global parameter VISA_FAST_FUNDS. If VISA_FAST_FUNDS="A", all Original Credit Transactions being loaded will be converted to NotifItem, regardless of the Fast Funds Indicator value. For other documents, processing logic remains the same as VISA_FAST_FUNDS="Y". To restore the pipe's previous behaviour, the VISA_FAST_FUNDS parameter value must be set to "Y". It's recommended to have VISA_FAST_FUNDS="A" if Fast Funds authoirization request messages are processed as Financial Credit.

WAY4 manager

WM-3093

New option SHOW_ERROR_STACK_TRACE has been supported in OW_WORK\DB.ini. It allows error stack traces to be shown/hidden from Clerk users.
Upgrade Note:
SHOW_ERROR_STACK_TRACE can have the 'yes' or 'no' value. The default value is 'no'. The option disables error stack trace visibility for Clerks: 
- error traces will be visible to Clerks only if the option is precisely set to 'yes' 
- traces are available to Admin roles regardless of the key. 
Setting SHOW_ERROR_STACK_TRACE to 'yes' means switching to the old system behaviour: traces are available for a user of any role.

Web services

CARDS-51664 / I1604135487

New menu branches have been added: OpenWay\Web Services and OpenWay\Way4Web. The "WS Users & Grants" menu branch has been moved from OpenWay\System\DB Administrator Utilities to these new menu branches; the linked menu OpenWay\Full\DB Administrator Utilities\WS Users & Grants has been removed. For more details, see the section "Client Upgrade Notes on Impact changes".
Upgrade Note:
The "WS Users & Grants" menu branch has been moved from OpenWay\System\DB Administrator Utilities to the new menu groups OpenWay\Web Services and OpenWay\Way4Web. The link OpenWay\Full\DB Administrator Utilities\WS Users & Grants has been removed. If a custom menu item with a link to the items that have been moved or deleted is used, it must be replaced with a new one. If you have a Web Services or WAY4Web license and the OpenWay\Web Services or OpenWay\Way4Web menu do not appear after upgrade, please contact OpenWay support.

Upgrade Notes on Impact Changes Grouped by Releases

Important! These changes may affect your data, please read carefully!

Change types:

  • Added New Feature
  • Changed Feature
  • Fixed Bug
  • New Task
  • Sub-task
  • Support of Payment System Release Requirements
  • Standard Configuration Update
  • Backporting
  • Information Note

Cards

  • 03.45.30.83
    • [CARDS-57890]
      • Added in the "XLS_Visa_Statistics_Acquiring_Business" report for Europe (P_CEMEA=N):
- New report section "Cross Border Acquiring Data".
- New report parameters:
1) P_SHOW_CROSS_BORDER (varchar2(1), default value is "Y"). The parameter turns on/off the new section "Cross Border Acquiring Data".
2) P_ACQ_OWN_COUNTRY (varchar2(3), default value is null). The parameter defines the merchant's homeland(3-symbol country code, like 'RUS', 'JPN' and etc) to determine cross border transactions in the "Cross Border Acquiring Data" section.
      Updated Manuals: [visa_statistical_reports\quarterly_operating_certificates\VISA_Statistical_Reports.pdf]
    • [CARDS-58552]
      • In report Cardholder_Contract_Statement increased dimension from 10 to 30 numbers for amount fields.
    • [I1801102213]/[CARDS-58568]
      • Modified transaction attributes for chip transactions in Bulgaria.
    • [I1807169810, I1807149196, I1807169369, I1807169291, I1807169328]/[CARDS-58526]
      • Fixed "ORA-01031: insufficient privileges" error when importing a MPE file with IP0105T1 data by the "MPE Import" pipe.
    • [CARDS-58291]
      • Added a new fee descriptor and fee prediction tariff for Romania.
    • [CARDS-58573]
      • Modified fee predictions tariffs for Switzerland.
    • [I1806190054]/[CARDS-58441]
      • Modified domestic commercial interchange tariffs in Latvia according to VISA bulletin on 30 November 2017.
    • [I1806190070]/[CARDS-58446]
      • Modified domestic commercial interchange tariffs in Lithuania according to VISA bulletin on 30 November 2017.
    • [I1806190086 (ICFEE-313)]/[CARDS-58434]
      • Modified domestic commercial interchange tariffs and fee descriptors in Estonia according to VISA bulletin on 30 November 2017.
    • [I1807113981 (ICFEE-316)]/[CARDS-58599]
      • Changed Fee Program Areas for Fee Prediction functionality according to VISA manual "VISA Intra-Europe Consumer cards IC in Turkey & Israel update 1 April 2018".
    • [CARDS-58520]
      • Eliminated attempts to fill BIN record reference on document accept and other card related checks for non-card contracts. The target contract's contract category is now checked instead of the transaction type's contract category.
      Upgrade Note:
      AUTH_TYPE and PAN document tags are no longer filled for mVisa payments. If the AUTH_TYPE tag was used to identify mVisa payments in product settings (e.g. services or usages), other distinguishing characteristic should be chosen (e.g. the BAI tag) and corresponding settings should be changed.
    • [I1807084877]/[CARDS-58556]
      • Added a check that CDU was performed for the contract involved in the backdated processing actions.
      Upgrade Note:
      Now if CDU for a contract has not been finished yet and the intelligent backdated processing is called for this contract (manual storno, previous cycle transaction conversion to instalment, etc.), the corresponding error is returned to ensure data consistency.
To finish CDU for this particular contract in the described situation and then to apply the Intelligent Backdated Processing action, the global parameter FORCE_CDU=Y must be set.
  • 03.45.30.82
    • [CARDS-56678]
      • Changed data for the "Doc #" field of GL Account Report. Now this field is the document's identifier based on which a GL entry is generated.
    • [CARDS-58382]
      • Added a new parameter P_ADDRESS_LINE for the "XLS_Visa_Statistics_Acquiring_Business" report (varchar2(255), default value is "to_char(c.billing_contract) || ad.address_line_1") for customising calculation of merchant outlets.
      Upgrade Note:
      To return the old report behaviour, set the P_ADDRESS_LINE parameter to "ad.address_line_1". In this case, for two merchants who have the same address, the number of merchant outlets is calculated as 1.
      Updated Manuals: [visa_statistical_reports\quarterly_operating_certificates\VISA_Statistical_Reports.pdf]
    • [CARDS-58383]
      • Changed logic for 'New Cards Obtained During the Quarter' 
 field in 'XLS_MC_Statistics_Issuing_Business'
      Upgrade Note:
      Changed logic for 'New Cards Obtained During the Quarter' 
 field in 'XLS_MC_Statistics_Issuing_Business' - exclude condition for card date expire. The old behaviour is not supported.
    • [CARDS-58393]
      • Modified timeline criteria for the NONAUTHND_MRCH and AUTHENTICTD_SEC fee descriptors in Europe-Brazil.
    • [I1806190567, I1806201990, I1806191767, I1806202149, I1806203481]/[CARDS-58233]
      • Fixed issue when "NSPK Inward Processing" pipe stops working with error "Incorrect adjustment message: must be Credit for Debit transactions!"
    • [CARDS-57311]
      • Changed the licenses list for EMV card production.
      Updated Manuals: Data preparation and card personalization | Requirements
    • [I1805161998]/[CARDS-58129]
      • Added a new parameter P_CACHE_MTR (varchar2(1), default value is = "Y") for the "XLS_Visa_Statistics_Issuing_Business.rdf" report. The parameter makes it possible to use temporary tables to cache useful data to improve performance in the "Card Issuance" report section.
      Upgrade Note:
      Recommended to check performance of the "XLS_Visa_Statistics_Issuing_Business" report in database with amounts of data comparable to production database.
    • [I1805174949]/[CARDS-58245]
      • In report "XLS_MC_Statistics_Issuing_Business" 
added number formatting for section "Transactions Feature Details"
for "Cards at beginning of quarter" exclude blocked cards, as for "Cards at end of quarter"
      Upgrade Note:
      Changed logic for counting blocked cards for "Cards at beginning of quarter" in "XLS_MC_Statistics_Issuing_Business". Old behavior is not supported.
    • [NET-140]/[CARDS-57867]
      • Changed the algorithm for creating client/contract address lists and logic for transliterating addresses so that addresses are no longer shown multiple times in WAY4 Web screens and in DB Manager/WAY4 Manager forms. See Client Upgrade Notes for additional information.
      Upgrade Note:
      The algorithm for defining a language for transliterating client or contract addresses has been changed so that addresses are no longer shown multiple times in WAY4 Web address screens and in the "Customer Service Screen" form in DB Manager/WAY4 Manager. 
Previously, to transliterate an address to English, WAY4 used a language specified for the client in case client address was used for the address_type by default (Default Address="Client Base Address" in "ROOT\OpenWay\Full\Configuration Setup\Client Classifiers\Address Types") and there was no address with such address type in the CLIENT_ADDRESS table, 
or in case there was no CLIENT_ADDRESS at all (address was specified only in Client record) . 
The new behaviour is supported by additional global parameter USE_SYSTEM_ADDR_LANG with the "Y" value (default). 
Now WAY4 does not take client language into account, and in the aforementioned case uses the default system language from Global Constants. If language is not set for client or contract address, or it is set to English, or officer language is not defined, no transliteration for this address is performed.
The behaviour can be switched to use client language with additional global parameter USE_SYSTEM_ADDR_LANG set to "N" in case client address was used for the address_type by default and there was no address with such address type in the CLIENT_ADDRESS table, 
or in case there is no CLIENT_ADDRESS at all.

Now the client address list does not contain address specified in client record. The behaviour can be switched to the previous behaviour using additional global parameter USE_CL_BASE_ADDR with the "Y" value.

Logic for transliterating addresses has been fixed:
1. If "Date To" of one address record equals to "Date From" of another address record with the same address type, WAY4 shows the latest created address record.
2. If the activation period of one address record overlaps the activation period of another address record with the same address type, WAY4 shows the address with fewer activation period.
  • 03.45.30.79
    • [CARDS-58080]
      • Changed Frequency display value from "Single" to "Unique" for Case Event Type. Added "Single" value (see CARDS-45657 for details).
    • [CARDS-58108]
      • Fixed DOC.add_info data inheritance for Second Presentment from First Presentment if the data is absent in the Chargeback. Affected pipe: com.openwaygroup.pipe.dci.outwards_processing.jar.
    • [I1805163324]/[CARDS-58079]
      • Corrected parameter name P_TRN_BALANCE_TRASFER -> P_TRN_BALANCE_TRANSFER in the XLS_MC_Statistics_Issuing_Business report.
Defined the default value for parameter P_TRN_BALANCE_TRANSFER = "Balance Transfers".
Changed the default value for parameter P_TRN_PAYMENT from "CH Payment" to "Payments".
      Upgrade Note:
      Changed logic for 'Balance Transfers' and 'Payments' field in the report XLS_MC_Statistics_Issuing_Business. To return the old behavior, you must:
- change value of parameter P_TRN_PAYMENT to "CH Payment"
- value for the new parameter P_TRN_BALANCE_TRANSFER should be  identical to the out-of-date P_TRN_BALANCE_TRASFER.
      Updated Manuals: [mastercard_statistical_reports\quarterly_mastercard_reporting\MC_Statistical_Reports.pdf]
    • [I1805174949]/[CARDS-58073]
      • Changed counting of contracts that are shown in HDR section of the "XLS_MC_Statistics_Issuing_Business" report:
-Breakout of EMV-compliant Chip-enabled Cards 
-Of which are MasterCard contactless enabled 
-Total MasterCard contactless Cards issued 
-Total MasterCard contactless enabled Phones issued 
-Total MasterCard contactless enabled alternative form factors.
Now only valid and blocked contracts as of the end of the billing period are counted (previously only valid contracts were counted).
      Upgrade Note:
      Changed logic for counting cards (use of card status) in the "XLS_MC_Statistics_Issuing_Business" report. Old behaviour is no longer supported.
    • [CARDS-57998]
      • Implemented Visa 2.7 Oct18-126 Global Mandate for Credit Voucher and Merchandise Return Authorization Messages. Added the ability to send credit transactions online to issuer for Visa cards.
      Updated Manuals: [transaction_management\Documents.pdf] [visa_interface\20XX_XX_VISA_Requirements.pdf]
    • [CARDS-58023]
      • Restored currency BOLIVAR FUERTE for Venezuela.
      Upgrade Note:
      Clients should check that the currency for Venezuela (OpenWay\Full\Configuration Setup\Main Tables\Country Table) is BOLIVAR FUERTE (VEF/937).
    • [I1805286208]/[CARDS-58046]
      • Modified Fee Prediction tariffs for Luxembourg according to the VISA Bulletin on 24.05.2018.
    • [CARDS-57625]
      • Enhanced logic for 'Cards at end of quarter' field in report "XLS_MC_Statistics_Issuing_Business" - exclude blocked cards.
      Upgrade Note:
      Changed logic for counting blocked cards for 'Cards at end of quarter'  in "XLS_MC_Statistics_Issuing_Business". Old behavior is not supported.
  • 03.45.30.78
    • [CARDS-56949]
      • Added a new parameter P_IF_ACTIVE_STMT (varchar2(1), the default value is "Y") for the "XLS_Visa_Statistics_Issuing_Business" report. The parameter defines how to calculate the "Number of Statements Mailed" value - by valid cards (=Y) or by all account contracts (=N).
Changed the P_REPORT_TYPE parameter processing to support writing SQL statements in it.
      Upgrade Note:
      Syntax for defining the P_REPORT_TYPE parameter value has been changed. For example: P_REPORT_TYPE="c.report_type = 'C'" instead of "'C'".
The parameter can be used for SQL query to select contracts with the statements mailed.
      Updated Manuals: [visa_statistical_reports\quarterly_operating_certificates\VISA_Statistical_Reports.pdf]
    • [CARDS-57856]
      • Prohibited autoreversals for all VISA and VISA NSPK OCT operations. Can be redefined by the AUTO_REV_ALWD tag in the bin_table.bin_details field (OpenWay\Full\Configuration Setup\Routing\BIN Table).
    • [CARDS-57946]
      • Fixed an issue when the "Retr/Resp" button in the form "ROOT\OpenWay\Full\Documents Input & Update\Doc - General Form\All Docs --> [DOC - Brief]" could open an empty document.
    • [CARDS-57949]
      • Added collection initialization before personal data erasure to avoid fatal error on first process launch.
    • [CARDS-57970]
      • Added a new parameter P_PAYMENT_SCHEME (varchar2(255), default value is "W") for the "XLS_NSPK_Statistics_Acquiring_Business" and "XLS_NSPK_Statistics_Acquiring_Devices" reports.
The parameter defines payment schemes which should be present in the report.
      Upgrade Note:
      The default payment scheme MP_PS_MEMBER.PAYMENT_SCHEME for which the "XLS_NSPK_Statistics_Acquiring_Business" and "XLS_NSPK_Statistics_Acquiring_Devices" reports are generated has been changed. To return to the old report behaviour, specify all payment schemes MP_PS_MEMBER.PAYMENT_SCHEME for which the report was generated earlier in the P_PAYMENT_SCHEME parameter.
      Updated Manuals: [mir_statistical_reports\MIR_Statistical_Reports.pdf]
    • [CARDS-57999]
      • Supported data inheritance for a Second Presentment from the First Presentment if the data is absent in the Chargeback. Affected pipe: com.openwaygroup.pipe.dci.outwards_processing.jar.
    • [I1411267508]/[CARDS-57858]
      • Fixed an issue causing the error "003-No Source contract found" during Intra-currency Settlement Acquirer files import. Affected pipe: com.openwaygroup.pipe.cup.inward_processing.jar.
    • [I1710103681]/[CARDS-58005]
      • Fixed "ORA-01000: maximum open cursors exceeded" error. Added grants for CM_CASE_FILE and CM_CASE_OBJ tables. Affected pipe: com.openwaygroup.pipe.mc.mastercom_import.jar.
    • [I1801178161]/[CARDS-57872]
      • Fixed the issue when currency conversion cross rate was not used for creation of the MasterCard 2nd Presentment.
    • [I1804098117]/[CARDS-57874]
      • Modified the transaction condition for the BG_CORP/PUR_CHIP fee descriptor for Bulgaria.
    • [I1805159709]/[CARDS-57878]
      • Fixed an issue with deadlocks that appear when several incoming files are loaded by the cb_gate_balance_load pipe simultaneously.
    • [I1805174949]/[CARDS-57853]
      • Fixed calculation algorithm for the following values in the"MC Statistics Issuing Business" report:
- Breakout of EMV-compliant Chip-enabled Cards
- Of which are MasterCard contactless enabled
- Total MasterCard contactless Cards issued
- Total MasterCard contactless enabled Phones issued
- Total MasterCard contactless enabled alternative form factors.
Now a contract is counted if it is valid at the end of the report period. Previously, the validity of the contract was checked at the beginning of the period.
    • [I1804178470]/[CARDS-57919]
      • Modified Fee Prediction tariffs for low-value consumer domestic transactions in Italy according to VISA Business news on 5 Apr 2018.
    • [CARDS-57907]
      • Added a new interest calculation scheme to configure an instalment scheme: "Interest with USE_MONTH_WEIGHT = B". In this configuration, interest for the first instalment portion is calculated for the whole month regardless of a number of days left to the end of the month. In case of early repayment, no advance interest is taken.
      Upgrade Note:
      Previously, the "Interest with USE_MONTH_WEIGHT=N" and "Interest with USE_MONTH_WEIGHT=Y" instalment interest calculation schemes could be combined with the "USE_MONTH_WEIGHT=B" configuration on Account Scheme and Financial Institution levels.
Now when an interest calculation scheme with the specified USE_MONTH_WEIGHT mode is selected on Instalment Scheme level, the USE_MONTH_WEIGHT tag in Account Scheme or Financial Institution is not checked at all. If the required behaviour of the USE_MONTH_WEIGHT parameter must be taken from Account Scheme or Financial Institution for the whole product including both Instalment and Revolving parts, the "Interest" calculation scheme must be used in the Instalment Scheme.
  • 03.45.30.77
    • [CARDS-50884]
      • Fixed an issue with recognition of the parameter EXCLUDE_PRODUCT_ID in VISA BIN Table Import. Pipe affected :
com.openwaygroup.pipe.visa.bin_table_import.jar
    • [CARDS-50922]
      • Fixed VISA BIN Table record update when the same record is loaded several times by the "com.openwaygroup.pipe.visa.bin_table_import.jar" pipe. The "Card Organisation" field is set to the default value "V" for acquirer BINs.
    • [CARDS-57836]
      • Added currency VENEZUELA BOLIVAR SOBERANO to the currency table.
    • [I1804119098]/[CARDS-57800]
      • Added a check that the CODE field has been filled in for Case Parameters, Activity Reasons, Strategy Step, and Strategy. It is now mandatory to fill in the field. Also fixed the Duplicate Strategy procedure.
      Upgrade Note:
      The CODE field in the menu item "Case Management\Configuration Setup\Domain Configuration" must be filled in for the following objects: Case Parameters, Activity Reasons, Strategy, and Strategy Step. 
If the CODE field is not filled in, it is not possible to approve a strategy that was obtained by using the "Duplicate" action to copy an existing strategy.

To find objects with an empty CODE field, run check script .
      Check Scripts:
      <OWS Home>\db\scripts\oracle\check\checkdata\cards\CARDS-58609_CM_conf_check.sql
      Updated Manuals: [case_management\Case_Management_Configuration.pdf]
  • 03.45.30.76
    • [CARDS-57740]
      • Enhanced standard personal data clearing process. Added obfuscation of personal data in the "Contract" and "Card Info" tables.
    • [CARDS-54612]
      • Enhanced calculation for "Number Of Issued Chip Cards", "of which are only Contact", "of which are Contact and Contactless", "of which are only Contactless", "of which are micro tags", "Number Of Active Cards (at least one transaction)", "Number Of Active Cards (at least one Contactless transaction)", "Number of Accounts", and "Number of Active Accounts" fields in the "Card Issuance" section of the "Visa Statistics Issuing Business" report.
Now only contracts/accounts with valid statuses are included in calculations of the values listed above. Contract status history can be taken into account. 

For the "Accounts and Cards" section of the"MC Statistics Issuing Business" report:
Enhanced calculation for the "Accounts at beginning of quarter" (Open/Blocked/Total), "Accounts at end of quarter" (Open/Blocked/Total), "Cards at beginning of quarter" (Open/Blocked/Total), and "Cards at end of quarter" (Open/Blocked/Total) fields. Now the values listed above are calculated based on contract/account status validity where contract status history can be taken into account.
Renamed the "Of which are MasterCard contactless" field to "Of which are MasterCard contactless enabled".
Corrected calculation for "Total MasterCard contactless Cards issued". Now all valid cards enabled to perform contactless transactions are calculated; previously only active cards were calculated.
      Upgrade Note:
      Only the new calculation algorithm is available for the fields of the "Card Issuance" section of the "Visa Statistics Issuing Business" report and the "Accounting and Cards" section of the "MC Statistics Issuing Business" report.
Old behaviour is not supported.
Current values for the aforementioned sections can differ from the previous ones since an additional condition for cards/accounts to have proper statuses has been added.
To use historical values of contract statuses (values for reporting dates), create a standard contract "CONTR_STATUS" classifier. Otherwise the current contract status value will be used.
      Updated Manuals: [mastercard_statistical_reports\quarterly_mastercard_reporting\MC_Statistical_Reports.pdf] [visa_statistical_reports\quarterly_operating_certificates\VISA_Statistical_Reports.pdf]
    • [CARDS-57636]
      • Added an additional check to verify the DE22.SF5 field when transactions are exported. If the DE22.SF5 field contains a value that is not supported by NSPK, the transaction is suspended.
    • [CARDS-57640]
      • Corrected 'Number Of Active Cards' for XLS_Visa_Statistics_Issuing_Business report.
    • [CARDS-57646]
      • Fixed loading outward Fee Collections/Funds Disbursements. Affected pipes: com.openwaygroup.pipe.dci.inward_processing.jar.
      Upgrade Note:
      Clients who use the Diners Club Interface must add the following new message codes (OpenWay\Full\Configuration Setup\Transaction Types\Message Types - All):
1. 
Channel = "Diners Club"
Name = "Fee Collection Out"
Code = "FFPO-1Z-"
Category = "Advice"
Is Authorization = "Fin"
Trans Type = "Fee Collection Out"
Msg Details = "OUT_ST=C;"

2.
Channel = "Diners Club"
Name = "Funds Disb Out"
Code = "FFPO-2Z-"
Category = "Advice"
Is Authorization = "Fin"
Trans Type = "Funds Disb Out"
Msg Details = "OUT_ST=C;"
    • [CARDS-57690]
      • Enhanced contract cache in gathering statistics for performance reasons.
      Upgrade Note:
      Recommended to check performance of gathering statistics on database with data volumes like production database.
  • 03.45.30.74
    • [CARDS-57532]
      • Fixed PDE3605 processing in JCB ISO Inward Processing and JCB ISO Outward Processing pipes. Fixed error when JCB ISO Inward Processing stops working on parsing unknown/incorrect subfields that are not used in processing.
    • [CARDS-57566]
      • Supported the ability to configure additional groups in the SIC_GROUP table to arrange data groups in the "Billing by Industry for ..." sections.
      Upgrade Note:
      In the "XLS_AMEX_Statistics_Issuing_Business" report, the new parameter P_CLASSIFIER_TYPE can be used to form the Industry split fields. It specifies the classifier for a group (trans_group.trans_sic -> sic.code -> sic_group_tree -> sic_group.name).
    • [CARDS-57573]
      • Fixed "Mandatory field 30 of reference message (mtid 1240) is absent" error when exporting "Retrieval Request" message by "JCB ISO Outward Processing" pipe.

      For acquirers who load IRD definitions from MPE file: use Copy Configuration to synchronise the MasterCard IRD Configuration from the file \home\db\datax\config\MC_IRD_CFG_CFG_CC.txt.
    • [I1804181620]/[CARDS-57587]
      • Modified priority of the commercial sector specific fee descriptor in Romania.
    • [PRIOR-79]/[CARDS-57583]
      • Fixed error when "IC Document Export" pipe does not export some messages if "NUM_DOCS_PER_FILE"  and "INCREMENTAL_EXPORT"=Y pipe parameters are set and two messages, which corresponds to one document, are splitted between outgoing files.
    • [CARDS-57451]
      • Implemented Visa 2.4 Apr18-731 Global Mandate for Credit Voucher and Merchandise Return Authorization Messages. Credit Visa transactions will processed as online.
    • [I1804124081]/[CARDS-57501]
      • Changed the condition to detect advices (notifications) on dispute documents sent by the payment system on behalf of a client. Now this condition in DA R2 is based on the value of the SENT_BY_TGT=Y; tag set by a particular inward channel module.
      Upgrade Note:
      Clients who use VISA VCR interface must check that their WAY4Cards version includes CARDS-56736.
  • 03.45.30.73
    • [CARDS-56746]
      • Deleted report form 'Trial Balance.rdf' as obsolete.
      Upgrade Note:
      Deleted report form 'Trial Balance.rdf' as obsolete. Use new versions of Trial Balance report.
    • [CARDS-57275]
      • Changed amout format in report ATM Dispense from NNNGNNNGNNNGNN0D00 to NNNGNNNGNNNGNN0DNN
    • [CARDS-57425]

      • Fixed processing VCR Dispute response financial reversal in "VISA SMS Inward Processing pipe."
      Upgrade Note:
      To process a VCR Dispute response financial reversal by the VISA SMS Inward Processing pipe, new message_codes must be set up in the "OpenWay\Full\Configuration Setup\Transaction Types\Message Types - All" menu item, common settings: "Channel" - "VISA SMS", Category - "Reversal", Is Authorization - "FIN"
1) Name = "ATM 2Prs Rev", Code = "0220_5_SMSR", Trans Type = "ATM 2Prs"
2) Name = "Retail SMS 2Prs Rev", Code = "0220_5_SMS05R", Trans Type = "Retail 2Prs"

    • [CARDS-57249]
      • Improved entry description in the "Merchant Standing Order Entry Details" report. Entry description is now taken from the record of the approved Service that was current at the time of transaction so that later Service updates won't corrupt the entry description.
      Upgrade Note:
      The entry description in the "Merchant Standing Order Entry Details" report is now taken from the description of the approved Service that current when the transaction was posted. The change also also affects base amount entries that were previously described by "Base Amount". If custom logic is used with "Base Amount" as a constant to search for a transaction's base amount in a report, errors may occur. To maintain correct behaviour, instead of the "Base Amount" entry description, use the "Base" value in the Entry Type field. The old behaviour is not supported.
  • 03.45.30.69
    • [CARDS-57200]
      • Fixed WAY4 Manager form syntax error in the following forms: "SIOM Active List","SIOM Chain", "SIOM Doc", "SIOM Inactive List", "SIOM List".
    • [CARDS-57242]
      • Fixed issue when PDS 0375 was cut when importing 1644-685 settlement message by the "NSPK Inward Processing" pipe.
    • [I1803267894]/[CARDS-57234]
      • Fixed an incorrect date format in test scripts exported from WAY4 Manager. The "yyyy-MM-dd HH:mm:ss" hardcoded format is now used in the "test_script_export" pipe for date fields.
    • [CARDS-55951]
      • Added the ability to process (import and export) VCR status advices via the UFX H2H interface.
      Upgrade Note:
      Added the ability to export and to import advices for "outgoing" transactions (for example VISA VCR advices for originator of transaction) via the UFX H2H Interface ("IC Documents Import" and "IC Documents Export" pipes with MODE=H2H pipe parameter set).

To avoid duplicates, exported records are marked with the "H2H_SENT=Y;" document tag. The recommended additional condition for the FILTER pipe parameter to export such transactions is "doc.source_channel = <Aff channel> and doc.target_channel = 'V' and doc.outward_status = 'C' and doc.fx_settl_date beetwen (<date1>,<date2>)". For correct export of advices for "outgoing" transactions, additional settings of the current menu items used for H2H document export (IC Documents Export pipe) are required:

If a menu item has FILE_SENDER and FILE_RECEIVER pipe parameters explicitly set as a constant value (not as an sql expression) then the FILTER pipe parameter of the existing menu item should be modified as specified above.

If FILE_SENDER and FILE_RECEIVER parameters are not set (the default values are DOC.SEND_MEMBER_ID and DOC.TARGET_MEMBER_ID respectively) or they are set as another sql expression it is recommended to create a separate menu item with FILE_SENDER=DOC.REC_MEMBER_ID and FILE_RECEIVER=DOC.SOURCE_MEMBER_ID parameters. The FILTER pipe parameter described above should be also added to the pipe in the new menu item.

Note that the proposed settings are recommended and are subject to testing on a particular WAY4 system configuration. Contact Customer Support if any obstacles are encountered during the testing.

No additional settings are needed for the "IC Documents Import" pipe to import advices for "outgoing" transactions.
      Updated Manuals: [UFX_H2H_Interchange.pdf (NDA Specification for vendors)]

  • 03.45.30.64
    • [CARDS-55668]
      • Implemented the ability to generate mVisa static QR codes in the DB Manager "OpenWay\QR Payments\QR Merchant Schemes" form, [Make QR] button.
    • [CARDS-56959]
      • Supported 3 logging modes for the CS_DECISION_LOG table. Default behaviour has been changed.
      Upgrade Note:
      Changes have been made that impact configurations using Decisions.

To check for the existence of such a configuration, use the standard form: OpenWay\Full\Configuration Setup\Common Handbooks\Decision.
If it is not empty, pay careful attention to the information below.

By default, logging of changes for all Decisions to the CS_DECISION_LOG table is disabled. This does cause any changes in processing, as this log is not used in processing. The current value of a Decision is always recalculated on the fly at the time it is asked.

Previously, logging of changes in Decisions was always deferred, using Object Task Scheduler, which sometimes resulted in a large queue of tasks for recalculating and logging the values of Decisions, although the CS_DECISION_LOG may not have been not used anywhere.

Disabling logging does not concern Decisions that are used in Datamart export. These decisions are always logged, regardless of any parameters. Only two log mode are possible for these Decisions: Deferred or Immediate (default).

Three log modes are now supported in WAY4:
1. SKIP - Don't log anything. Used by default for all Decisions, except those exported into Datamart.
2. DEFERRED - Deferred logging in CS_DECISION_LOG using Object Task Scheduler. This logging mode corresponds to the system's previous behaviour. Make sure that Object Task Scheduler is run regularly before enabling deferred log mode.
3. IMMEDIATE - Immediately recalculation and saving in CS_DECISION_LOG when a linked Classifier changes. This is used as the default mode for Decisions exported to Datamart. This mode is not recommended for Decisions that can be used for large contract trees, since a change in the value of a classifier in a hierarchy's top contract may cause immediate recalculation of dependent Decisions for all contracts in the hierarchy.

Log mode can be changed with the global parameter DECISION_LOG_MODE.
For the same behaviour for all Decisions (except those exported to Datamart), one of the aforementioned values should be used: SKIP or DEFERRED or IMMEDIATE.

To check logging mode for each Decision separately, use the value DECISION_LOG_MODE=CHECK_<Default Mode>, where Default Mode is a value: SKIP, DEFERRED, or IMMEDIATE. If the LOG_MODE tag is not set in a specific Decision, default mode will be used.

To set log mode for a Decision, use the LOG_MODE tag in the "Add Info" field. The mode in a specific decision is only checked when the global parameter has the value CHECK_<Default mode> and for Decisions used for export to Datamart.

If the CS_DECISION_LOG table is used in exports or custom processes, log mode should be changed according to these recommendations.
  • 03.45.30.63
    • [CARDS-57023]
      • Added the ability to convert incoming payments to notifications for selected channels only in the UFX Documents Import pipe in "H2H" mode.
      Upgrade Note:
      Added a new pipe parameter, FF_SRC_CH_LIST that makes it possible to convert payment messages to notifications for desired channels only (DocFile/DocList/Doc/Originator/Product/Channel aggregate).  Values for the FF_SRC_CH_LIST pipe parameter are: "ALL", "NONE" or a comma-separated list of message channel codes. The default value is "W,V". 
Note that the FAST_FUNDS=Y parameter in the AddInfo field is no longer analysed; payment financial messages are converted to notifications only according to the values of the FF_CODES_MAP and FF_SRC_CH_LIST pipe parameters.
      Updated Manuals: [core_banking_interface\core_banking_interface\user_manuals\CBS_Interface_UFX.pdf]

  • 03.45.30.61
    • [I1802068851]/[CARDS-56852]
      • Added the ability to convert incoming "fast funds" payments to notifications in UFX Import pipe in "H2H" mode.
      Upgrade Note:
      Added a new pipe parameter, FF_CODES_MAP which makes it possible to convert "fast funds" financial messages to notifications. If an incoming message contains the parameter FAST_FUNDS=Y in the AddInfo field, a message code will be substituted according to the FF_CODES_MAP parameter. FF_CODES_MAP has the following format: <OldMessageCode1>:<NewMessageCode1>,<RequestCategory1>;....<OldMessageCodeN>:<NewMessageCodeN>,<RequestCategoryN>; or the "N" value, which turns off message code substitution. The default value is "DpP--2X-:NpP--2S-,P;DpR--2X-:NpP--2S-,R;". To restore previous behaviour, the  "FF_CODES_MAP" pipe parameter value must be set to "N".
      Updated Manuals: [core_banking_interface\core_banking_interface\user_manuals\CBS_Interface_UFX.pdf]
  • 03.45.30.60

    • [I1801165374]/[CARDS-56538]
      • Corrected behaviour for DCI Clearing Import and DCI Inward Processing. Now ATM Service Fee transactions are processed as special Misc transactions. Previously they were processed as general ATM transactions.
      Upgrade Note:
      Clients who use the DCI Issuing Interface must manually add: 
1. New Trans Type (OpenWay\Full\Configuration Setup\Transaction Types\Transactions - All) with the following parameters:
Service Class = "Misc"
Source = ""
Target = "Card"
Name = "ATM Service Fee"
DR\CR = "Debit"
Chain Type = "Original"
Is Authorized = "Never"
Is Required = "Yes"
Category = "Individual"
RBS Code = "A1F"
RBS Rev Code = "a1f"
Dispute Class = "ATM Dispute"
Trans Type IDT = "0719F"

2. New SubType for "ATM Service Fee" Trans Type (using the [SubTypes] button in OpenWay\Full\Configuration Setup\Transaction Types\Transactions - All):
Source Cat = ""
Target Cat = "Card"
Source Type = ""
Target Type = "Our DCI Cards"
Source Acc Type = "Inc Suspense"
Target Acc Type = "CH Current/Credits" or another appropriate account type which is used as current cardholder account (for example, Cl Deposit)

3. New Message Code for "ATM Service Fee" Trans Type (using the [Msg Types] button in OpenWay\Full\Configuration Setup\Transaction Types\Transactions - All):
Channel = "Diners Club"
Name = "ATM Service Fee"
Code = "DfP--01-"
Category = "Advice"
Is Authorization = "Fin"
Trans Type = "ATM Service Fee"

4. Add corresponding Misc- services for Transaction Type "ATM Service Fee" to all DCI card service packages.

    • [CARDS-56567]
      • Supported import of IP0048T1 and IP0050T1 tables from MasterCard MPE file.
      Upgrade Note:
      The IP0048T1 and IP0050T1 tables can be imported for custom needs. To import the IP0048T1 and IP0050T1 tables, the new ADD_TABLES pipe parameter should be set to the value "IP0048T1,IP0050T1" in the com.openwaygroup.pipe.mc.mpe_import.jar pipe.
  • 03.45.30.53
    • [I1801126779]/[CARDS-56583]
      • Modified Minimum fee in VISA Slovakia Manual Cash tariff.
    • [CARDS-56542]
      • Corrected the "E2.CB" bertlv tag format containing an instalment type in authorisation response.
      Upgrade Note:
      Issuers of Instalment cards for which instalment plan simulation mode is used during authorisation request should note that the "E2.CB" bertlv tag value in 112 field of authorisation response has been corrected: the value in the standard implementation changed to "T". If cust_auth_parse procedure is used to fill in E2.CB tag, change the procedure and configure the "T" tag type.
    • [DBK-3208]
      • Changed the pipe com.openwaygroup.pipe.write_audit_log_file.jar output to syslog (rfc5424) format.
      Upgrade Note:
      If data are exported from the sy_audit_log table (for more information, see the document "WAY4 Audit Log Export") to an external monitoring system, ensure the external monitoring system is ready to receive logs in syslog format.
Check for this pipe in the process log. Process name is PIPE: Audit Log Writing(com.openwaygroup.pipe.write_audit_log_file.jar).
      Check Scripts:
      Check script for this change is: CHECK_v1_DBK-3208_write_audit_log_file.sql  Script returns either "passed" (no action required) or "warning" if any action required.
  • 03.45.30.52
    • [I1708224441]/[CARDS-54611]
      • Added a new parameter, "P_USE_LOCAL_CONSTANTS", to "Cardholder_Account_Statement", "Merchant Standing Orders Details", and "Merchant Billing Level Standing Orders Details" reports. The length is varchar2(3). The default value is "Y". This is an internal technical parameter for DB Manager/WAY4 Manager/WAY4 Web client.

Added a new parameter, "P_READ_LOCAL_CONSTANTS", to "Cardholder_Account_Statement", "Cardholder_Contract_Statement", "Merchant Contract Statement", "Merchant Standing Orders Details", "Merchant Standing Order Entry Details", and "Merchant Billing Level Standing Orders Details" reports. The length is varchar2(1). The default value is "Y". The parameter makes it possible to change the ability to read report parameter values from the LOCAL_CONSTANTS table .

The "P_USE_LOCAL_CONSTANTS" and "P_READ_LOCAL_CONSTANTS" parameters work as a pair. Only if both parameters are "Y" and the "P_CONNID" parameter is not null, report parameter values will be read from the LOCAL_CONSTANTS table.
      Updated Manuals: [acquiring\user_manuals\Merchant_Statements.pdf] [issuing\user_manuals\Cardholder_Statements.pdf]
    • [I1711090861]/[CARDS-56412]

    • [CARDS-55981]

    • [CARDS-55987]
      • Supported new [1240-220] adjustment message according to B-18 NSPK 18.1 release article. "EXT_CASE_ID" document tag will contain DE72 (dispute case id in NSPK) value.
      Upgrade Note:
      A new [1240-220] adjustment message has been supported according to B-18 NSPK 18.1 release article. These messages are imported to the database like adjustment (partial reverse) messages. Important: For correct processing of settlement documents received in [1644-685] (financial position) messages for [1240-220] adjustment messages, the optional DE26 reconciliation category must be selected in the NSPK questionnaire!
    • [CARDS-56300]
      • Added the ability to edit the doc.add_info field when creating an adjustment document.
    • [CARDS-56499]
      • Changed MasterCard services according to article AN 1056. Added an additional Service Pack: "STD-STD MC SPC - ATM Product Forbidden".
      Upgrade Note:
      Acquirers in all regions: Use Copy Configuration to synchronize MasterCard Service Packs from the file \home\db\datax\config\MC_IRD_CFG_SP_CC.txt.
    • [I1710317086]/[CARDS-56502]
      • Changed the VISA_FAST_FUNDS additional global parameter default value from the existing value "Y" to a new value "A". If VISA_FAST_FUNDS is set to "A", all original credit transactions will be converted into notifications regardless of the Fast Funds Indicator value. For all other transactions, the processing logic remains unchanged. The changes affect the VISA Base II Inward Processing and Affiliated Base II Inward Processing pipes. Please see CUN for required additional actions.
      Upgrade Note:
      A new default value ("A") has been added for the existing global parameter VISA_FAST_FUNDS. If VISA_FAST_FUNDS="A", all Original Credit Transactions being loaded will be converted to NotifItem, regardless of the Fast Funds Indicator value. For other documents, processing logic remains the same as VISA_FAST_FUNDS="Y". To restore the pipe's previous behaviour, the VISA_FAST_FUNDS parameter value must be set to "Y". It's recommended to have VISA_FAST_FUNDS="A" if Fast Funds authoirization request messages are processed as Financial Credit.
    • [CARDS-55901]
      • Supported new ODPT DE22.6 (Pos Entry Mode subfield) "10" value for incoming clearing messages according to B-16 NSPK Release article. Also changed processing for DE22.6="82" value on import. NSPK_RELEASE=18.1 additional global parameter must be set for new processing.
      Upgrade Note:
      A new ODPT DE22.6 (Pos Entry Mode subfield) "10" value for incoming clearing messages has been supported according to B-16 NSPK Release article. Also changed processing for DE22.6="82" value on import. NSPK_RELEASE=18.1 additional global parameter must be set for new processing.
    • [CARDS-55904]
      • Changed processing for DE22.5="4" value according to B-16 NSPK 18.1 release article for import files.  NSPK_RELEASE=18.1 additional global parameter must be set for new processing.
      Upgrade Note:
      Processing for DE22.5="4" value has been changed according to B-16 NSPK 18.1 release article for import files. NSPK_RELEASE=18.1 additional global parameter must be set for new processing.

    • [CARDS-56126]
      • Added new SICs 3834, 3835, 3836 according to VISA Release Apr18-783 Global Mandatory Changes to Merchant Category Codes.
      Upgrade Note:
      Clients should manually add the following SICs (MCCs):
1. "3834 Baymont Inn & Suites" with Code 3834 and Group Code "H"
2. "3835 Dolce" with Code 3835 and Group Code "H"
3. "3836 Hawthorne Suites by Wyndham" with Code 3836 and Group Code "H"
To do so, use the menu item "OpenWay\Full\Configuration Setup\Main Tables\SIC Codes".
Also, these SICs must be added to Direct Group "Hotel/Motel (Lodging)".
To do so, use the [Direct Groups] button in the "SIC Codes" form (OpenWay\Full\Configuration Setup\Main Tables\SIC Codes).
After adding, click on the [Normalize] button in the form for each of these SICs.
      Updated Manuals: [visa_interface\20XX_XX_VISA_Requirements.pdf]
    • [CARDS-56155]
      • Changed JCB BIN Table Import pipe. Supported loading of new values from the "Card Product" field. Information about a consumer/commercial is stored in the "bin_table.product_category" database field in MasterCard notation ("1"-consumer, "2"-commercial, "4"-other). Also, the bin_table.licensed_product_id database field is filled with a 3-symbol product code (see the PDSE3001 field in the BIG manual for the list of possible values).
      Upgrade Note:
      Loading of new values from the "Card Product" field has been supported in the JCB BIN Table Import pipe. Information about consumer/commercial is stored in the "bin_table.product_category" database field in MasterCard notation ("1"-consumer, "2"-commercial, "4"-other). Also, the "bin_table.licensed_product_id" database field is filled with a 3-symbol product code (see PDSE3001 field in the BIG manual for the list of possible values).  licensed_product_id is generated according to "Card Product" and "Card Grade" from an incoming IIN file. Two new pipe parameters have been added to generate licensed_product_id
- "MAP_PROD_TO_NAME" = "<product1>=<name_start1>;<product2>=<name_start2>;...<productn>=<name_startn>;", where <productx> - "Card Product" field from incoming IIN file and <name_startn> - first letter of the licensed_product_id. Default value "MAP_PROD_TO_NAME"="01=C;02=D;03=P;04=A;05=X;06=Y;"
- "MAP_GRADE_PROD_NAME" = "<grade1>=<name_end1>;<grade2>=<name_end2>;...<graden>=<name_end1>n", where <graden> - "Card Grade" field from incoming IIN file and <name_startn> - last 2 letters of the licensed_product_id. Default value "MAP_GRADE_PROD_NAME"="S=ST;G=GD;P=PL;R=PR;D=GR;E=EN;M=SP;U=UL;O=AL;"
No additional manual action is required.
    • [CARDS-56156]
      • Supported new ATM Access Fee functionality in JCB clearing inward and outward pipes pursuant to JCB April 2018 release.

Channel is "MasterCard (IPM)", Chain Type is "Original", Dispute Trans Class is "Inward Fee Collection", Code is "7827", Name is "7827 EDP Adjustment Amount", Is Active is "Yes".

    • [I1611016818]/[CARDS-56436]
      • Fixed CAB condition processing for IRD calculation. Previously CABs were loaded by the MPE Import pipe in SIC Groups with classifier code MC_CAB. Now the MPE Import pipe doesn't load/update SIC Groups with classifier code MC_CAB and the IRD Calculation process gets CAB directly from the MPE_IP0075T1 table.
To see the MCC-CAB relation, use the menu items "OpenWay\MasterCard\MC. IRD Configuration\MC MCC CAB Groups" or "OpenWay\MasterCard Fee Prediction\MC MCC CAB Groups".
      Upgrade Note:
      Clients who use the MasterCard interface should manually delete all SIC Groups with the MC_CAB classifier (OpenWay\Full\Configuration Setup\Main Tables\SIC Groups). This is not mandatory, but now SIC Groups with the "MC_CAB" classifier will be not up-to-date. Use the menu item "OpenWay\MasterCard\MC. IRD Configuration\MC MCC CAB Groups" to see the up-to-date relation between MCCs and CABs.
  • 03.45.30.48
    • [CARDS-55861]
      • Added a new DEFAULT_USAGE pipe parameter to define the bin_table.usage field for NSPK (MIR, JCB, AMEX, UPI) ranges and VISA/MC ranges not corresponding to the appropriate original IPS bin range. NSPK MPE Import.
      Upgrade Note:
      NSPK MPE Import: a new DEFAULT_USAGE pipe parameter has been added to define the bin_table.usage field for NSPK (MIR, JCB, AMEX, UPI) ranges and VISA/MC ranges not corresponding to the appropriate original IPS bin range. It is recommended to set DEFAULT_USAGE=H to avoid problems with P2P transactions from MIR cards to VISA/MC cards.

      • Corrected splitting by currency in the XLS_AMEX_Statistics_Issuing_Business.rdf report in accordance with AMEX specification requirements. If the P_FX_CUR parameter is left empty, the "Billings by Industry", "Account Balances", and "Interest Rates" sections are grouped by card contract currency whereas before they were grouped by settlement currency.

    • [I1706200311, I1709199952]/[CARDS-54930]
      • Corrected IPM Outward Processing behaviour: to avoid rejects for 2nd Presentments and Arbitration Chargebacks when previous incoming message contains incorrect fields, fields and PDS from the original document (1st presentment) are used for inheritance when generating an outgoing message.
    • [I1712227712]/[CARDS-56335]

    • [CARDS-56146]
      • Enhanced determination of the IPS Member Identifier (Member_ID) for account contracts (statistical contract groups for account contracts). Now Member_ID is calculated as Member_ID of the card contracts subordinate to the account contract while before Member_ID was calculated based on the interchange routing settings.
Supported an optional IPS Member Identifier set up for reporting purposes:
- The ability to define Acquiring/Issuing Member ID by IPS.
- The ability to aggregate reporting data that belong to different financial institutions under the same Member ID.
- The ability to report financial institution data with the different Member IDs by Issuing BINs.
Added the new menu item OpenWay\Full\Statistics\Dictionaries\Payment Scheme Identification.
For more details, please refer to the OW_HOME\manuals\language\MasterCard_statistical_reports\Quarterly_MasterCard_Reporting\MC_Statistical_Reports.pdf,
 OW_HOME\manuals\language\VISA_statistical_reports\Quarterly_Operating_Certificates\VISA_Statistical_Reports.pdf,
 OW_HOME\manuals\language\AMEX_statistical_reports\AMEX_statistical_reports.pdf.
      Upgrade Note:
      Determination of the IPS Member Identifier (Member_ID) for account contracts (statistical contract groups for account contracts) has been corrected to avoid inconsistencies in data. Now Member_ID is calculated as Member_ID of the card contracts that are subordinate to the account contract while before Member_ID was calculated based on the interchange routing settings. 
Previous system behaviour is no longer supported. For more details, please refer to the following documentation: OW_HOME\manuals\language\MasterCard_statistical_reports\Quarterly_MasterCard_Reporting\MC_Statistical_Reports.pdf, 
 OW_HOME\manuals\language\VISA_statistical_reports\Quarterly_Operating_Certificates\VISA_Statistical_Reports.pdf, 
 OW_HOME\manuals\language\AMEX_statistical_reports\AMEX_statistical_reports.pdf manuals.
      Updated Manuals: [amex_statistical_reports\AMEX_Statistical_Reports.pdf] [Datamart\manuals\language\Datamart_User_Manual.pdf] [mastercard_statistical_reports\quarterly_mastercard_reporting\MC_Statistical_Reports.pdf] [mir_statistical_reports\MIR_Statistical_Reports.pdf] [visa_statistical_reports\quarterly_operating_certificates\VISA_Statistical_Reports.pdf]

  • 03.45.30.43
    • [CARDS-55639]
      • Added a new parameter, CONVERT_ACQ_BIN_CH. The parameter can be set for a financial institution or globally.
The parameter redefines the value of field N 32 (Acquiring Institution ID) of an ISO message received through a channel for interaction with an external system.
The value of the CONVERT_ACQ_BIN_CH parameter is set as a list of channels for which routing is defined according to the OUR_MEMBER_ID field of the BIN_TABLE table.
If the parameter is not set, routing is performed according to the value of the CONVERT_ACQ_BIN global parameter.
      Updated Manuals: [core\Global_Parameters.pdf] [tags description]
    • [CARDS-52705]
      • Restored Scheduler Standard Menu Items. They are now put in "OpenWay\WAY4 Scheduler - Cards\Standard Menu Items".
    • [CARDS-55968]
      • VISA VCF Export 
1) Modified period ID calculation: if the PERIOD_ID_FORMAT pipe parameter is set to "L", current period ID equals the last day of the previous period for all record types. 
2) Added the new pipe parameter DISABLE_CHECK_CLIENT with the default value "N". If this parameter is set to "Y", verify that duplicate T4 Cardholder records are disabled.
    • [CARDS-55073]
      • Disabled the SET_CREDIT_LIMIT_MODE global parameter.
      Upgrade Note:
      Issuers are highly recommended to check for the presence of the SET_CREDIT_LIMIT_MODE global parameter in the "Additional Global Parameters" form. If the global parameter is not specified or is set to the default value SET_NEW, no changes are required. If the global parameter has the "ADD" value, issuers should take into account that the system behaviour will be the same as with the default value. Changing the credit limit using the [Credit Limit] button in the form for editing a contract (card or account) sets a new value equal to the value specified. If other behaviour is expected, the issuer must contact Customer Support.
      Updated Manuals: [core\Global_Parameters.pdf] [help system - acquiring\main_lng.chm and issuing\main_lng.chm] [help system - acquiring\main_lng.chm and issuing\main_lng.chm] [issuing\user_manuals\Issuing_Module.pdf] [product_management\Products_and_Subtypes.pdf]
    • [CARDS-56090]
      • Added a new parameter DISABLE_CHECK_CLIENT for the VISA VCF Export pipe. Valid values are "Y" and "N" (default). If this parameter is set to "Y", verification of T4 Cardholder records duplication is disabled.
    • [DBK-3021]
      • Migrated DB Manager to a new PowerBuilder version.
      Upgrade Note:
      1) File format of DB Manager forms (forms\*.srd) has changed. Forms synchronized or saved in WAY4 Cards version 03.46.30.00 (or later) can't be used in previous WAY4 Cards versions. 
2) DDDW libraries (dbm\dddw\*.pbl) format has changed. Custom DDDW libraries should be migrated to the new version of PowerBuilder during upgrade to WAY4Cards version 03.46.30.00 (or later). Please contact your Upgrade Manager for details.

      • Supported new DE22.7 value "7" ("Credential-on-file") processing.

      New DE22.7 value "7" ("Credential-on-file") processing has been supported. Additional The global parameter MC_RELEASE=18.Q3 must be set to export this new value to IPM file.
    • [CARDS-55802]
      • [MIR REL] 2018.1 B-20: NSPK MPE Import. Supported import of new file field BILCURRENCY_CODE. This field is stored in the CH_BILL_CURR tag in bin_table. To override this value, a new pipe parameter, CHANGE_CURR = "YYYXXX" can be used, where "YYY" is the currency code from the file and "XXX" is the currency code to store in the database.
      Upgrade Note:
      [MIR REL] 2018.1 B-20: NSPK MPE Import. Supported import of new file field BILCURRENCY_CODE. This field is stored in the CH_BILL_CURR tag in bin_table. To override this value, a new pipe parameter CHANGE_CURR = "YYYXXX" can be used, where "YYY" is the currency code from the file and "XXX" is the currency code to store in the database, for example CHANGE_CURR = "643810".
    • [CARDS-55999]
      • Supported new DE22.7 value "7" ("Credential-on-file") processing.
      Upgrade Note:
      New DE22.7 value "7" ("Credential-on-file") processing has been supported. Additional The global parameter MC_RELEASE=18.Q3 must be set to export this new value to IPM file.

    • [CARDS-55807]
      • VISA Acquirer Capture Import: supported import of Multiple Clearing Sequence Number and Multiple Clearing Count into the CLR_SEQ_NUM and CLR_SEQ_COUNT tags.
    • [CARDS-55790]
      • Added device name (WSP_DEVNAME), device ID (WSP_DEVID) and last four digits of mobile phone number (WSP_L4DIG) saving in the database as token parameters on MDES / VTS enrolment.
      Upgrade Note:
      3 parameters must be created for existing MDES/VDEP/MIR(tokenization)"Identification Schemes" (OpenWay\Authentication Module\Identification Types -> [Parms]:

1) 
Name = Mobile Number Last 4 digits
Code = WSP_L4DIG
Is Global = No
Is Mandatory = No
Parm Type = String

2) 
Name = Device ID
Code = WSP_DEVID
Is Global = No
Is Mandatory = No
Parm Type = String

3) 
Name = Device Name
Code = WSP_DEVNAME
Is Global = No
Is Mandatory = No
Parm Type = String
	
and changes to the scheme must be approved by clicking on the [Approve] button.
    • [CARDS-55880]
      • Changed behaviour. Now Customer Profile Handbook checks that the filtering item code exists. An error message will be returned if this code does not exist in the filtering handbook.
      Upgrade Note:
      Customer Profile Handbook checks that the filtering item code exists. An error message will be returned if this code does not exist in the filtering handbook. The old behaviour in which the entire handbook without filtering was retrieved can be restored by setting the value of the additional global parameter CP_HANDBOOK_FILTER to "WEAK".
      Updated Manuals: [core\Global_Parameters.pdf]
  • 03.45.30.38
    • [CARDS-55810]
      • Added a new button, [Chain Log], to the "Stored Messages" form (menu: \OpenWay\Full\Online Monitoring\Logical Channels & SAF) The button opens a form showing ComsLog records related to the corresponding document chain.
    • [CARDS-55723]
      • Supported multiple Tariff Segments loading by MPE Import. Affected pipes: com.openwaygroup.pipe.mc.mpe_import.jar.
      Upgrade Note:
      This change affects customers that use Fee Prediction and load tariffs from an MPE file. Multiple Tariff Segments loading has been supported. Customers are recommended to test Interchange Tariff loading from MPE files in their configuration.
  • 03.45.30.37
    • [CARDS-55742]
      • Fixed "ORA-06502" error when "USE_EXT_FILE_COUNTER" IC Document Export pipe parameter has the "Y" value.
    • [CARDS-54729]
      • Modified VISA RA configuration and interchange tariffs for Bulgaria according to VISA bulletin on 22 July 2017.
      Upgrade Note:
      The VISA_RELEASE parameter must be set to "17.3". The RA configuration must be imported from the VISA_RA_CFG_REL_17_Q4_EU_CC.txt file according to "Configuring WAY4 Parameters to Calculate Visa RA" manual. The Fee Prediction tariffs must be imported from the config\fp\VISA\BGR\TRFDMN_2016-02-16_18.xml file.
    • [CARDS-55734]
      • Modified the interchange tariffs for Belgium according to MasterCard announcement 1151 on October 17, 2017.
    • [CARDS-55727]
      • Deleted some obsolete objects to prevent undesirable use of unsupported functionality. This has been done for future compatibility with the new Contract Parameter approach.
      Upgrade Note:
      For future compatibility with the new approach for the contract parameter handbook, some obsolete objects have been deleted to prevent their undesirable use:
Deleted Menu Items:
- OpenWay\WAY4 Data Warehouse Interface\Configuration Setup\Contract Parameters
- OpenWay\WAY4 Data Warehouse Interface\Runtime\Contract Parm Value Update

Deleted Forms:
- Contract Parameter - Export
- Contract Parameter - Export - Value

Deleted pl/sql procedures and functions:
- scdp.RUN_RENEW_TRF_LINK
- trf_export.RENEW_TARIFF_LINK
- trf_export.VALIDATE_CONTR_PARM

Deleted view:
- CONTR_PARM_VALUE

The Product Inspector option LOG_MODE=CONTR_PARM_EXPORT is no longer supported.

According to CMS Statistics, no one used these objects.
      Updated Manuals: [product_inspector\WAY4_Product_Inspector_Manual.pdf]
    • [I1710259099]/[CARDS-55431]
      • Fixed issue. Now by default the authorisation process does not apply deferred tasks and the Secondary->Primary Synchronisation process does not create deferred tasks. If you use High Availability solutions, set HA.DEFERRED_DOC_APPLY=Y global parameter to restore the old behaviour and make sure that Object Task Scheduler is always running.
      Upgrade Note:
      Now by default the authorisation process does not apply deferred tasks and the Secondary->Primary Synchronisation process does not create deferred tasks. If you use High Availability solutions, set HA.DEFERRED_DOC_APPLY=Y global parameter to restore the old behaviour and make sure that Object Task Scheduler is always running.
      Updated Manuals: [core\Global_Parameters.pdf]
    • [CARDS-55740]
      • Increased the length of the fields DOC.REASON_CODE, DSP_REASON.CODE, REASON_CODE.CODE, REASON_ACTION.TGT_REASON_CODE, DISPUTE_TYPE.INW_REASON_CODE, DISPUTE_TYPE.REASON_CODE, DISPUTE_ITEM.INW_REASON_CODE, DISPUTE_ITEM.REASON_CODE, CM_CASE_DOC.REASON_CODE from 4 to 32 symbols.
      Upgrade Note:
      This change was made to support VISA Claim Resolution requirements. Long values for custom Reason Codes can only be used for VCR purposes. All custom interfaces that might export/import VISA dispute documents should support long Reason Code values.
The corresponding views are also impacted and they should be synchronised.
  • 03.45.30.35
    • [CARDS-54551]
      • A new parameter "P_LIAB_TOP_SQL" has been added to the "Cardholder_Contract_Statement.rdf" report. The length is varchar2(4096). The default value for this parameter is "select a.id from client c, acnt_contract a where c.amnd_state = 'A' and a.client__id = c.id and a.amnd_state = 'A' and a.liab_contract is null and a.acnt_contract__oid is null". The new parameter allows the report to be run in batch mode together with the P_LIAB_CAT_LIST parameter.
      Updated Manuals: [issuing\user_manuals\Cardholder_Statements.pdf]
    • [CARDS-55418]
      • DCI IPSE Export: Fixed filling of "SIC Code" and "Merchant Specific Code" fields in TRA file. Now if SIC code has a value between 3000 and 3999, it is put in the "Merchant Specific Code" field, otherwise in the "SIC Code" field.
    • [CARDS-55614]
      • MasterCard CDF Export: fixed processing of the "CustomIdentifierType" field defined in the ADD_FIELDS_FINANCIAL_TRANSACTION_5000 pipe parameter. The "CustomIdentifierType" field was erroneously filled with the "CustomIdentifier" custom tag value instead of the "CustomIdentifierType" custom tag value.
Also fixed "CustomIdentifier" field processing - it is cut if length is greater than allowed by the format.
    • [CARDS-55628]
      • Fixed the customized fields processing for MasterCard CDF Export process. If a customized field in the ADD_FIELDS_XX pipe parameters had [null] value, non-customized value was used for export. Now standard value is used only when there is no customized field in the ADD_FIELDS_XX pipe parameters. Otherwise, a customized value is used even if it has [null] value.
      Upgrade Note:
      The customized fields processing has been fixed for MasterCard CDF Export process. If a customized field in the ADD_FIELDS_XX pipe parameters had [null] value, non-customized value was used for export. Now standard value is used only when there is no customized field in the ADD_FIELDS_XX pipe parameters. Otherwise, a customized value is used even if it has [null] value. Please review ADD_FIELDS_XX pipe parameters to check if [null] value ("<CustomField>=;") is used to export the non-customized fields.
    • [I1709148207]/[CARDS-55495]
      • Modified the XLS_Visa_Statistics_Issuing_Business report - supported a new section, "Co-Brand / Affinity Program Data". This block is hidden by default and can be shown by the parameter P_ATTR_PS_COBRAND_PROGRAM.
Added new parameters:
P_ATTR_PS_COBRAND_PROGRAM
P_ATTR_BIN
P_COBRAND_TRANS_TYPES
Added the COBRAND_PROGRAM configuration group PS_COBRAND_PROGRAM and new BIN statistic attributes
      Updated Manuals: [visa_statistical_reports\quarterly_operating_certificates\VISA_Statistical_Reports.pdf]
  • 03.45.30.34
    • [CARDS-54959]
      • Supported FROM_AUTH=FEE_AMOUNT mode for custom fees. Other values of the FROM_AUTH tag are not supported. If the blocked Fee Amount currency differs from the posting Fee Amount currency, conversion is made according to custom fee Service rules.
      Updated Manuals: [product_management\Service_Packages.pdf]
    • [CARDS-54956]
      • Fixed an issue occurring on the Product Inspector WAY4 Manager screen when the "Application" button is pressed.
    • [CARDS-55114]
      • Modified the XLS_Visa_Statistics_Issuing_Business.rdf report. Now "Number of Statements Mailed" and "Number of Statements Mailed with Finance Charges" are gathered only for card categories with the parent value of card programme = "CREDIT" (DWD_CARD_CATEGORY classifier values with the "Parent value"="CREDIT") and multiplied on billing cycles number.

Added new parameters:
- P_FILTER_11
- P_FILTER_12
      Upgrade Note:
      Old behavior for "Number of Statements Mailed" and "Number of Statements Mailed with Finance Charges" in 'XLS_Visa_Statistics_Issuing_Business' report not supported.

    • [CARDS-55162]
      • Fixed duplicated line item document rows (if multiple macrotransactions were created) in statement reports.
    • [CARDS-55387]
      • Restored processing of cases when a reversal transaction message is received before the authorization request. Added limit on the period for stopping attempts to search for reversals preceding the corresponding request. By default the search is performed within 24 hours. This period can be redefined with the global parameter UNM_AUTH_REV_FLASHBACK_DAYS.
    • [CARDS-55433]
      • Changed the behaviour of the BAL file fields marked as "Information provided on the statement date only" in the DCI IPSE manual that are now exported only if the "Record Type" field value is "B".
    • [CARDS-55443]
      • Corrected generation of the chain identifier for an instalment plan converted from a transaction in previous cycles if another plan was created and closed for the same transaction.
    • [CARDS-55459]
      • Corrected the "Event Message Text" form to avoid [Dictionary] button error.
    • [CARDS-55471]
      • Added a new parameter to the "XLS_AMEX_Statistics_Acquiring_Business" report:
P_GROUP_CHANNELS, varchar2(255), the default value is " 'X','Y','x','y' ".
The parameter is used for transaction filtering in the "Discount Business Summary" and "POS Billing Detail By Industry" sections.

    • [CARDS-55501]
      • Fixed an issue when ABU messages were wrongly selected and sent to IPS online by Transaction Switch DBFileUpdate.
    • [CARDS-55510]
      • NSPK Inward Processing: fixed incorrect processing of settlement incoming messages for financial advices as "Iss Ichng Detail Loyalty For Cardholder CR Inc". Now such messages without the DE-026 field are loaded as "Iss Ichng Detail CH Payment Inc" type.
    • [CARDS-55534]
      • XLS_Visa_Statistics_Issuing_Business: fixed amount balance available calculation algorithm in the "Prepaid cards" section, line "Balance available/remaining at end of quarter". Now: if there are several Prepaid cards related to the same accounting contract in a main-sub hierarchy, its account balance will be included in the report only once. Before: it used to be multiplied by the number of cards.

      • DCI IPSE Export: Fixed "Transaction Amount" field filling in TRA file (added sign).
    • [CARDS-55569]
      • Fixed issue in the XLS_Visa_Statistics_Issuing_Business report. Now the value "Of which are only Contact" in the "Card Issuance" block is calculated as "Number of issued Chip cards" minus "Of which are only Contactless" and "Of which are Contact and Contactless".

      Upgrade Note:
      Now by default the authorisation process does not apply deferred tasks and the Secondary->Primary Synchronisation process does not create deferred tasks. If you use High Availability solutions, set HA.DEFERRED_DOC_APPLY=Y global parameter to restore the old behaviour and make sure that Object Task Scheduler is always running.

    • [CARDS-54236]
      • Added installation and configuration manuals (issuing and acquiring modules) for the MIR Loyalty Program.
      Updated Manuals: [nspk_interface\mir_loyalty\acquiring\MIR_ACQ_Loyalty_Support.pdf] [nspk_interface\mir_loyalty\issuing\MIR_ISS_Loyalty_Support.pdf]
    • [CARDS-54636]
      • Implemented  loading of historical data. Three new parameters have been added to the pipes com.openwaygroup.pipe.dci.clearing_import.jar and
com.openwaygroup.pipe.dci.inward_processing:
- HISTORY_MODE=Y/N (the default value is "N") - pipe's mode of operation.  If HISTORY_MODE=Y, data from an incoming file are loaded without addendums and with outward status="History" .
- HIST_ARN_LIST - ARN filter (list of ARN with commas as delimiters) for historical documents. The parameter only works if HISTORY_MODE=Y.  If the ARN of a processed document is included in this list, the document is downloaded. If HIST_ARN_LIST is empty and HISTORY_MODE =Y, all documents from the incoming file are downloaded as historical documents.
- HISTORY_POSTING=Y/N (the default value is "N"). If HISTORY_POSTING=Y, an attempt to post a downloadable document is made.
    • [CARDS-54996]
      • Added the new pipe parameter TEST_MODE=Y (valid values: "Y"/"N"(default)) to enable the test mode for debugging uploaded data in VCF Export.
    • [CARDS-55435]
      • Modified IRD configuration according to DAILY MPE files from 14.10.17 to 04.11.17.
    • [CARDS-55466]
      • Added IPS MCX (Multicaixa). Added "MCX" channels with the "N" character and "Our MCX Cards" with the "n" character.
    • [CARDS-55512]
      • Set the default parameter FILL_TID=Y for the AMEX GNS Outward pipe.
      Upgrade Note:
      Now the default pipe parameter is FILL_TID=Y.
Check the menu items "OpenWay\AMEX GNS\AMEX. Daily Procedures\AMEX. Outward Processing\AMEX GNS Outward Processing" and "OpenWay\AMEX GNS\AMEX. Daily Procedures\AMEX. Outward Processing\AMEX GNS OnUS Outward Processing" and the menu items inherited from them.

      Fixed function to check Fraud Counter. Now it's performed only for Issuing contracts.
    • [I1710136911]/[CARDS-55432]
      • Fixed temporary behaviour of the VISA SMS Outward pipe, when DE65 (SRN) was inherited for 2Prs from 1Prs (this could be necessary for initial NSPK connection). Now DE65 (SRN) for 2Prs is inherited from Chbk by default. For legacy behaviour, the new SRN_FROM_PRS = Y pipe parameter must be set.
      Upgrade Note:
      Temporary behaviour of the VISA SMS Outward pipe, when DE65 (SRN) was inherited for 2Prs from 1Prs, has been fixed (this could be necessary for initial NSPK connection). Now DE65 (SRN) is inherited for 2Prs from Chbk by default. For legacy behaviour, the new SRN_FROM_PRS = Y pipe parameter must be set.
    • [DBK-3021]
      • Migrated DB Manager to a new PowerBuilder version.
      Upgrade Note:
      1) File format of DB Manager forms (forms\*.srd) has changed. Forms synchronized or saved in WAY4 Cards version 03.46.30.00 (or later) can't be used in previous WAY4 Cards versions. 
2) DDDW libraries (dbm\dddw\*.pbl) format has changed. Custom DDDW libraries should be migrated to the new version of PowerBuilder during upgrade to WAY4Cards version 03.46.30.00 (or later). Please contact your Upgrade Manager for details.

    • [CARDS-54735]
      • Replaced "CUP Inward Processing.dll" with a new java pipe, "com.openwaygroup.pipe.cup.inward_processing.jar". Removed the pipe parameters CHANNEL, CHANGE_CURR_IN, and EXT_CURR_EXP. Supported loading of Intra-currency Settlement Block File.
      Upgrade Note:
      For WAY4Cards version from 03.46.20:
The client must check the menu item that is used to run Union Pay Outward Processing and change it according to the new corresponding standard menu item (OpenWay\UPI\UPI. Daily Procedures\UPI. Inward Processing\UPI Inward Processing). If the menu item used the parameters CHANGE_CURR_IN and/or EXT_CURR_EXP, currency/currency exponent overrides must be configured in the database according to the WAY4 "Currency Conversion" document, section "Redefining Currency for clearing documents".
For WAY4Cards version from 03.44.30:
Loading of Intra-currency Settlement Files has been supported. Contact Customer Support for the installation manual.

    • [DBK-3167]

      To fix configuration problems, run the OW_HOME\db\scripts\oracle\tools\synchseq.sql script after running "Configuration Import Screen\Data\Import Merged Data". It is only necessary to run the script if the configuration was imported to WAY4 versions between 03.45.30.00 and 03.45.30.32.
  • 03.45.30.27
    • [CARDS-54662]
      • Added a new parameter, "P_USE_LOCAL_CONSTANTS", to "Cardholder_Account_Statement", "Merchant Standing Orders Details", and "Merchant Billing Level Standing Orders Details" reports. The length is varchar2(3). The default value is "Y". This is an internal technical parameter for DB Manager/WAY4 Manager/WAY4 Web client.

Added a new parameter, "P_READ_LOCAL_CONSTANTS", to "Cardholder_Account_Statement", "Cardholder_Contract_Statement", "Merchant Contract Statement", "Merchant Standing Orders Details", "Merchant Standing Order Entry Details", and "Merchant Billing Level Standing Orders Details" reports. The length is varchar2(1). The default value is "Y". The parameter makes it possible to change the ability to read report parameter values from the LOCAL_CONSTANTS table .

The "P_USE_LOCAL_CONSTANTS" and "P_READ_LOCAL_CONSTANTS" parameters work as a pair. Only if both parameters are "Y" and the "P_CONNID" parameter is not null, report parameter values will be read from the LOCAL_CONSTANTS table.
      Updated Manuals: [acquiring\user_manuals\Merchant_Statements.pdf] [issuing\user_manuals\Cardholder_Statements.pdf]
    • [CARDS-54450]
      • Fixed ORA-01747 error during "empty" Assignment menu subitem execution in Scheduler.

      • CUP Audit Trailer Import. added the ability to disable creation of  settlement documents for Fee Collections (FCP file) by setting the third position of the LOAD_STL parameter to "N".
