    • [I1710025092, I1710056161]/[CARDS-55020]
      • NSPK MPE Import: fixed performance issue when loading bin ranges for VISA (binv files).
Changed default value for the "SEARCH_AS_SUB" pipe parameter from "N" to "Y". It allows new detailed VISA BIN token ranges to be imported more correctly. To restore old behaviour, the "SEARCH_AS_SUB"="N" pipe parameter must be set.

      • MasterCard CDF Export: Added the ability to customize the CorporateProduct field for the AccountInformation_4300Type aggregate.

      • MasterCard CDF Export: Added the ability to customize the PostedCurrencyConversionDate field for the FinancialTransaction_5000Type and the PostedCurrencyConversionDateJulian field for the FinancialAdjustmentRecord_5900Type aggregates.
    • [CARDS-55060]
      • MasterCard CDF Export: Added the ability to customize the PostalCode field for the HierarchyAddress_4410Type aggregate.
    • [CARDS-55069]
      • VISA VCF Export: added pipe parameter PERIOD_ID_FORMAT. Valid values: F, L.
F (default value) - period ID is calculated from the beginning of the current billing period. L - period ID is calculated from the end of the previous billing period.
    • [CARDS-55041]
      • Included liability contracts in the contract hierarchy that is analysed to determine if a reversal can be accepted from a different terminal than that which sent the original request.
      Upgrade Note:
      A check of liability contracts has been added to the algorithm for determining if a reversal be processed for a request from a different terminal than that which sent the original request.
Contact Customer Support for additional information.

    • [CARDS-54891]
      • Changed VISA OCT reversal processing. OCT reversals with Target Channel "VISA SMS" are rejected with Return Code "12" and Posting Status "Under Workflow". OCT reversals with Target Channel "VISA" are not sent in the online phase and should be sent in clearing.
      Upgrade Note:
      In unforeseen situations (sending online reversals of OCT transactions to the VISA channel) a document is assigned the Under Workflow status - for manual analysis.
After reconciliation, documents with this status must be analysed and a decision taken on whether to post or reverse a document.
      Updated Manuals: [transaction_management\Documents.pdf]

    • [WM-3093]
      • New option SHOW_ERROR_STACK_TRACE has been supported in OW_WORK\DB.ini. It allows error stack traces to be shown/hidden from Clerk users.
      Upgrade Note:
      SHOW_ERROR_STACK_TRACE can have the 'yes' or 'no' value. The default value is 'no'. The option disables error stack trace visibility for Clerks: 
- error traces will be visible to Clerks only if the option is precisely set to 'yes' 
- traces are available to Admin roles regardless of the key. 
Setting SHOW_ERROR_STACK_TRACE to 'yes' means switching to the old system behaviour: traces are available for a user of any role.
  • 03.45.30.20
    • [CARDS-54714]
      • The Fee Prediction configuration has been added to support VISA Jordan Domestic IRF.
    • [CARDS-54711]
      • The "Add Info" field has been added to the W4M "Reply Doc" form opened by the buttons "Doc-Brief ->Cbk/Rpr" and "Doc-Brief ->Pt Cbk/Rpr", and to the W4M "Reversal Doc" form, opened by the buttons "Doc-Brief ->Reverse".
    • [CARDS-54737]
      • Fixed Old PAN and Old Expiration Date in VAU Initial Data Load.
    • [CARDS-54454]
      • Upgrade Note:
      To support payment system requirements for VISA Fast Funds and MasterCard MoneySend, and to make payments to MIR payment system cards from Russian state institutions, WAY4 can be configured for fast transfer of funds. The use of these settings is determined by the global parameters VISA_FAST_FUNDS, MC_FAST_FUNDS, and MIR_FAST_FUNDS with the "Y" value in the form OpenWay\Full\Configuration Setup\Main Tables\Additional Global Parameters. 
The mechanism for processing fast transfers has changed. 
Now when a document is imported from a payment system clearing file, as before, a document in WAY4 is generated with the transaction type Notif Prs Credit Item. Further, if the original financial document generated online from an authorization is found when the clearing document is processed by Document Processing, the Notif Prs Credit Item clearing document will be successfully processed with the response code "Successfully completed". 
If the original financial document is not found when processing the clearing document, processing of Notif Prs Credit Item will fail. The warning "Presentment not found for fast funds notification, converting to presentment" will be generated and the clearing document's transaction type will be changed to CH Payment. The next time Document Processing is run to process a clearing document, the updated parameters will be used. 
Issuers offering their cardholders this service are highly recommended to test this functionality online and in clearing. 
In addition, the following checks are required: 
1. Execute the following query and contact Customer Support if the query returns a non-empty result: 
select * from trans_type where amnd_state = 'A' and chain_type = 'X' and prev_trans_type is not null; 
2. Check Our EuroCard/MasterCard and Our Cirrus/Maestro card Service Package settings for trigger conditions in the Service for CH Payment transactions
"DOC_TAG=PTID;DOC_TAG_VALUE=C07,C52,C53,C54,C55,C56,C57,C67;", explicitly identifying express transfer transactions. 
3. Check the settings of menu items for importing VISA and MasterCard clearing information for the presence of the  USE_PAYMENT_TRANSACTION = N parameter. The USE_PAYMENT_TRANSACTION = N parameter is not compatible with  VISA Fast Funds and MasterCard MoneySend, and for payments by Russian state institutions to MIR payment system cards. 
If USE_PAYMENT_TRANSACTION = N is used, contact Customer Support.
    • [CARDS-54752]
      • DCI IPSE Export: Added customization point for "Last Billing Date" field in Accounts File.
    • [CARDS-54754]
      • DCI IPSE Export: Added customization point for "Expiration Date" field in Accounts File.
    • [CARDS-54769]
      • DCI IPSE Export: Added customization point for "Last Purchase Date", "Last Payment Date", and "Last Payment Amount" fields in Balance File.
  • 03.45.30.16
    • [CARDS-52181]
      • The DCC_CONTRACT tag is checked during Nostro contract approve; it should be the same for Main and Sub Nostro contracts. When searching for the DCC_CONTRACT tag in Nostro contracts, the tag is first searched for in the Sub Nostro contract, then in the Main Nostro contract, and then on the Nostro Account Scheme. Earlier, the DCC_CONTRACT tag value in the Main Nostro contract was not considered.
      Upgrade Note:
      Clients using Dynamic Currency Conversion (DCC) or Multi Currency Pricing (MCP/MCA) products must perform a check using CHECK_v1_CARDS-52181_dcc_contract_numbers.sql script validating the settings of DCC_CONTRACT tags in NOSTRO contracts. If the check returns a non-empty number of strings, a detailed check must be performed and the results of both checks must be sent to Customer Support.
      Updated Manuals: [dcc\DCC_Setup.pdf]

    • [I1705170227]/[CARDS-53896]
      • New parameters have been added to the "XLS_AMEX_Statistics_Acquiring_Business" report: 
- P_ATTR_VALUE_ISONUS. The default value is "rpr.on_us_channel(cg.group_channel)" to customize the "is_on_us" flag. 
- P_CHAIN_TYPE_FILTER_1 and P_CHAIN_TYPE_FILTER_2 have been added for filtering transactions. The default value for P_CHAIN_TYPE_FILTER_1 is "trans.chain_type in ('U')"; for P_CHAIN_TYPE_FILTER_2 it is "1=2".
- P_HIDE_REPOST. The default value is "Y". Used to hide reversal and repost operations.
- P_FX_RATE. The default value is empty.
- P_FX_DATE. The default value is empty.
- P_FX_CURR. The default value is empty.

New sections have been added to the "XLS_AMEX_Statistics_Acquiring_Business" report: 
- Discount Business Summary
- POS Billing Detail By Industry
      Updated Manuals: [amex_statistical_reports\AMEX_Statistical_Reports.pdf]
    • [CARDS-53781]
      • In the Case_Management_Configuration.pdf document, a chapter has been added that contains information about global parameters, including the CM_<DomainCat>_AUTOCREATE_USER parameter. Information about this parameter has also been added to the Global_Parameters.pdf document.
      Updated Manuals: [case_management\Case_Management_Configuration.pdf]
    • [CARDS-54089]
      • Global ICC Key Pools have been supported in the PIN Management module.
      Upgrade Note:
      Prior to this change all cryptographic keys for the following modules:
- authorization
- acquiring
- card production
- 3DSecure
were stored in one DB table - PM_KEYS. A significant volume of all the table's records was taken up by keys with the 'Pre-Generated' RSA ICC Key type (relevant when the "ICC Pregeneration" feature is used, described in the document "OW_HOME\manuals\english\Data_preparation_and_card_personalisation\EMV_smart_cards\EMV_Card_Production_Setup.pdf" manual) which are used solely for card production.

In order to reduce the impact of card production processes on other WAY4 system modules, 'Pre-Generated' RSA ICC Keys have been moved to a separate table (PM_PREGENED_KEYS).

After upgrading the production system, check the following:
1) The number of  'Pre-Generated' RSA ICC Keys in the new table is sufficient for the planned volume of card production in the nearest cycle (to do so, use the updated form available from the menu item OpenWay\EMV Smart Cards\Card Production\RSA ICC keys PRE-generation\RSA ICC keys PRE-generation)
2) Oracle indexes for the PM_KEYS table are up to date (a signification change in the number of table records may lead to index degradation).
      Updated Manuals: [data_preparation_and_card_personalisation\emv_smart_cards\EMV_Card_Production_Setup.pdf]
    • [CARDS-54090]
      • Support for working with different Perso Bureaus has been introduced in the PIN Management module.
      Upgrade Note:
      Please verify current card production settings on test and production environments using the following SQL query:
---
select distinct pko.value pbid from pm_keys_opt pko where pko.amnd_state = 'A' and pko.code = 'PBID' 
and not exists (select 1 from pm_keys pk where pk.id = pko.pm_keys__oid and pk.des_key = '01010101010101012020202020202020');
---

If the query returns a non-empty result, please contact Customer Support for instructions on correcting system settings according to the new behaviour.
      Updated Manuals: [data_preparation_and_card_personalisation\administrator_manuals\Card_Production_Setup.pdf] [data_preparation_and_card_personalisation\emv_smart_cards\EMV_Card_Production_Setup.pdf]
    • [CARDS-54243]
      • Business to Card transaction licenses have been added. Please contact Customer Support for configuration if you use these transactions.
    • [CARDS-53926]
      • [JCB Release 17.2] BIT54 is inherited now in chargebacks. No additional action is required.
    • [CARDS-53973]
      • Supported changes to the enhanced TC 33 Acquirer Capture File. Added new fields and new values and changed existing fields to existing TCR records. Implemented Money Transfer Data processing  for original credit transactions(OCTs)

    • [CARDS-54073]
      • [VISA REL] Oct17-588 has been supported.
Updating personalization data of tokens in 3730 message has been added.
    • [CARDS-53809]
      • Use of the TOTAL_BAL_TYPE tag for prepaid cards has been changed. See Client Upgrade Notes.
      Upgrade Note:
      The algorithm for using the TOTAL_BAL_TYPE tag in configuration of services, tariffs, etc. has changed.

If the TOTAL_BAL_TYPE tag with the value TOTAL_BAL_TYPE=AVAILABLE; is used for configuration of prepaid cards, the additional tag TOTAL_BAL_TYPE_SIGN=+; must be added. Otherwise, the system calculates the amount available for top-up incorrectly when a card has a negative AVAILABLE balance. A negative balance may be generated for a card due to fees charged for card issuing, etc.

Use of the TOTAL_BAL_TYPE tag is only recommended in configuration of prepaid cards and only in combination with the AVAILABLE balance. If this tag is used with another balance type, or in the configuration of other Product types (not prepaid cards), contact Customer Support.

Customer Support provides separate preliminary scripts that should be run in a copy of the production system before starting upgrade to the new version. 
If tpreliminary scripts find the aforementioned settings in the system, contact Customer Support for additional recommendations.
      Updated Manuals: [tags description] [product_management\Service_Packages.pdf] [tariff_management\Tariff_Management.pdf]
    • [CARDS-53839]
      • Fixed issue. Now the "Client Template Details" form in the "Customer Profile\Operations" menu shows sensitive attributes as masked and non-editable. To comply with PA-DSS requirements, a service attribute which can contain PAN should inherit its value from a sensitive dynamic handbook parameter or be directly marked as sensitive by the SENSITIVE=Y tag in the Additional Data field.
      Upgrade Note:
      To comply with PA-DSS requirements, all service attributes which can contain PAN should inherit their values from a sensitive dynamic handbook parameter or be directly marked as sensitive by the SENSITIVE=Y tag in the "Additional Data" field.
The SENSITIVE=Y tag should be registered in "Full\DB Administrator Utilities\System Utilities\Tagged Data Objects" for the TD_MSG_ATTR.ADD_DATA object.
      Updated Manuals: [customer_profile\Configuring_WAY4_Customer_Profile.pdf]
    • [DBK-2836]
      • Corrected work of functions SUBTRACT_LIST_ITEMS_D, ADD_LIST_ITEMS_D in sy_convert package with delimiters other than ";".
      Upgrade Note:
      Currently incoming delimiter variable value in the functions is used to separate tags list instead of standard delimiter value ";". Custom objects, which use aforementioned functions might be impacted. The old behavior can be kept if incoming delimiter variable value is set as ";".

    • [CARDS-53336]
      • JCB: Added message codes ("RjP-----","RJP-----","RmP-----","RmR-----") for reject processing.
      Upgrade Note:
      If the new JCB ISO format is used, the following Message Types must be added (OpenWay\Full\Configuration Setup\Transaction Types\Message Types - All):
1.
Channel=JCB
Name=Rejected Item Fin
Code=RmP-----
Category=Advice
Is Authorization=Fin
Trans Type=Rejected Item Fin
2.
Channel=JCB
Name=Rejected Fixing
Code=RmR-----
Category=Advice
Is Authorization=Fin
Trans Type=Rejected Fixing
Msg Details=OUT_ST=C;
3.
Channel=JCB
Name=Rejected Item
Code=RjP-----
Category=Advice
Is Authorization=Fin
Trans Type=Rejected Item
4.
Channel=JCB
Name=Rejected File
Code=RJP-----
Category=Advice
Is Authorization=Fin
Trans Type=Rejected File

      Updated Manuals: [core_banking_interface\cb_gate\CB_Gate_Setup.pdf]
    • [CARDS-53705]
      • Union Pay Audit Trailer Import. Supported loading Exceptional Processing Credit Adjustments and settlement for them.
    • [CARDS-53712]
      • Supported export of DCI Card Product Submission file for different DCI Releases. Version number filled from DCI_RELEASE global parameter.
    • [CARDS-53769]
      • Supported processing DCI Card Production Confirmation file and storing information from this file in the process log.
    • [CARDS-53771]
      • JCB ISO Inward (pipe): added the ability to charge a cardholder using Cardholder Billing Amount (BIT 6) instead of Reconciliation Amount (BIT 5). "ACP_<memberid>"="Y" new pipe parameter must be set to use this functionality for a specific member.
    • [CARDS-53809]
      • Use of the TOTAL_BAL_TYPE tag for prepaid cards has been changed. See Client Upgrade Notes.
      Upgrade Note:
      The algorithm for using the TOTAL_BAL_TYPE tag in configuration of services, tariffs, etc. has changed.

If the TOTAL_BAL_TYPE tag with the value TOTAL_BAL_TYPE=AVAILABLE; is used for configuration of prepaid cards, the additional tag TOTAL_BAL_TYPE_SIGN=+; must be added. Otherwise, the system calculates the amount available for top-up incorrectly when a card has a negative AVAILABLE balance. A negative balance may be generated for a card due to fees charged for card issuing, etc.

Use of the TOTAL_BAL_TYPE tag is only recommended in configuration of prepaid cards and only in combination with the AVAILABLE balance. If this tag is used with another balance type, or in the configuration of other Product types (not prepaid cards), contact Customer Support.

Customer Support provides separate preliminary scripts that should be run in a copy of the production system before starting upgrade to the new version. 
If tpreliminary scripts find the aforementioned settings in the system, contact Customer Support for additional recommendations.
      Updated Manuals: [tags description] [product_management\Service_Packages.pdf] [tariff_management\Tariff_Management.pdf]
    • [CARDS-53839]
      • Fixed issue. Now the "Client Template Details" form in the "Customer Profile\Operations" menu shows sensitive attributes as masked and non-editable. To comply with PA-DSS requirements, a service attribute which can contain PAN should inherit its value from a sensitive dynamic handbook parameter or be directly marked as sensitive by the SENSITIVE=Y tag in the Additional Data field.
      Upgrade Note:
      To comply with PA-DSS requirements, all service attributes which can contain PAN should inherit their values from a sensitive dynamic handbook parameter or be directly marked as sensitive by the SENSITIVE=Y tag in the "Additional Data" field.
The SENSITIVE=Y tag should be registered in "Full\DB Administrator Utilities\System Utilities\Tagged Data Objects" for the TD_MSG_ATTR.ADD_DATA object.
      Updated Manuals: [customer_profile\Configuring_WAY4_Customer_Profile.pdf]
    • [DBK-2836]
      • Corrected work of functions SUBTRACT_LIST_ITEMS_D, ADD_LIST_ITEMS_D in sy_convert package with delimiters other than ";".
      Upgrade Note:
      Currently incoming delimiter variable value in the functions is used to separate tags list instead of standard delimiter value ";". Custom objects, which use aforementioned functions might be impacted. The old behavior can be kept if incoming delimiter variable value is set as ";".
  • 03.45.29.16
    • [CARDS-52529]
      • Enhanced inheritance of document tags, transaction conditions and attributes to a financial presentment from an authorization document. In addition to inheritance for documents from our devices, attributes are inherited for our issuing documents and sponsor for acquirer documents. Sponsor document inheritance can be turned off by using the COND_INH_FOR_AFF global parameter where "Y" allows attribute inheritance and "N" disables it. The document tag with same values can also be used.
      Upgrade Note:
      In addition to inheritance for documents from our devices, "Transaction Condition", "Transaction Condition Attributes"  and "Additional Information tags" are inherited for our issuing documents and sponsor for acquirer documents. If sponsor documents should not inherit these attributes, the COND_INH_FOR_AFF global parameter should be set to "N" (do not inherit). The parameter's default value is "Y" (inherit attributes). The document tag COND_INH_FOR_AFF with the same values can also be used.
It is recommended to verify financial document processing results for the following cases:
1. Issuer:
- single/multiple financial document matched with authorizations for transactions with own cards card on own devices.
- single/multiple financial document matched with authorizations for transactions with own cards on foreign devices.
- single/multiple financial document matched with authorizations for transactions with own cards on affiliated host devices.
2. Acquirer:
- financial document linked to pre-authorization (by the PREAUTH_ID tag in the doc.add_info field) performed with foreign card on own device. 
- financial document linked to pre-authorization (by the PREAUTH_ID tag in the doc.add_info field) performed with affiliated card on own device. 
3. Sponsor for acquirer:
- financial document matched with the transit authorization performed with foreign card on affiliated host devices. 
- financial document matched with the transit authorization performed with affiliated card on affiliated host devices. 
4. Sponsor for issuer:
- financial document matched with the transit authorization performed with affiliated card on foreign host devices. 
- financial document matched with the transit authorization performed with affiliated card on affiliated host devices.
      Updated Manuals: [core\Global_Parameters.pdf] [tags description] [transaction_management\Documents.pdf]
    • [CARDS-54106]
      • Acquiring for transport merchants is supported: authorizations can be deferred and aggregated for cost reduction, special stop lists for merchants calculated. For details please contact your business representatives.
    • [CARDS-51891]
      • All pregenerated ICC keys will now be stored in separate tables.
    • [CARDS-52904]
      • A new work mode has been added to acnt_api.PREPARE_ENTRY_DATA0() 
- with the parameters ObjToCache => acnt_api.CollScopeFinAndAuth and AuthFilterMode => acnt_api.afAllNonFin. The API returns authorization and financial documents with balance changes, and records from credit_history that did not change balances and/or account Amount Available. 
- with the parameters ObjToCache => acnt_api.CollScopeAllCreditHistory and AuthFilterMode => acnt_api.afAllNonFin. The API returns only records from credit_history that did not change balances and/or account Amount Available.
    • [CARDS-53280]
      • A Parent Pack link will be redefined from a history record if the Service Pack has not been approved yet.
    • [CARDS-53456]
      • "OpenWay\Advanced Applications R2\Setup\Appl Type" now allows the TARIFF_CODE_EXT tag to be used in Tariff sections for setting a tariff code.

    • [CARDS-53475]
      • The "Custom Parms" new button has been added to the "Contract Preferred" form (OpenWay\Advanced Applications R2\Cardholder Input & Update by Applications) to pack/unpack the "Custom Parms" tagged field.
A section with the "Preferred" object type is supported for applications created manually according to the application types.

    • [CARDS-53501]
      • A new Event type with the "CLS_UNIQUE" code is used to set a classifier with a future date and empty "Date To" in WAY4Web. This prevents the situation when Single events are stored in the usage action table in Posted status forever.
For each financial institution that has an Event type with the "CLS" code and duration=Single, a new Event type with the "CLS_UNIQUE" code will be added during the  upgrade process.
      Updated Manuals: [core\Contract_and_Client_Classifiers.pdf] [product_management\Events.pdf]
    • [CARDS-53515]
      • Existing records in the VISIBLE_CLASSIFIER_TYPES handbook are marked as "Customer Service Workbench" records. New records can now be created indicating their relation to Customer or Merchant workbenches.
    • [CARDS-53551]
      • The ability to configure an instalment fee to waive all not opened fee invoices on full early repayment has been added. To enable this mode, the WAIVE_ON_FER tag should be specified in special parameters for the fee in the instalment scheme.
      Updated Manuals: [instalment_management\WAY4_Instalments.pdf]
    • [CARDS-53554]
      • Advanced Applications R2 can skip Product status verification during contract application approval if the new global parameter APPL_ALLOW_NOT_READY is set to "Y". Application accept will check this status anyway.
      Updated Manuals: [application_management\r2\CBS_XML_Applications_R2.pdf] [core\Global_Parameters.pdf]
    • [CARDS-53564]
      • The INST_PLAN_ID tag is set in documents created for invoice event fees.
Additional tags can be inherited from an instalment plan into a document created by an invoice event or invoice event fee. The list of tags should be configured in the INST_EVENT_INHERIT_TAGS global parameter (can be specified for a financial institution).
      Updated Manuals: [core\Global_Parameters.pdf] [instalment_management\WAY4_Instalments.pdf]
    • [CARDS-53270]
      • UPI Audit Trailer Import. Supported creating settlement documents for Fee Collection/ Funds Disbursements (FCP file).
      Upgrade Note:
      1. If message codes S2III1ZF, S2III2ZF, S2IAI1ZF, S2IAI2ZF are configured for the UPI channel (menu item "OpenWay\Full\Configuration Setup\Transaction Types\Message Types - All"), the bank should delete them.
2. Add the new transaction type "Fee Collection and Funds Disbursement Total" (menu item "OpenWay\Full\Configuration Setup\Transaction Types\Transactions - All").
3. Add new message codes S1--I--F, S2I-I1ZF, S2I-I2ZF, S2O-I2ZF
Contact Customer Support for details.
    • [CARDS-53476]
      • Removed unnecessary transaction amount validation for transit authorization reversals.
    • [CARDS-53548]
      • Card Expire information will not be inherited from an authorization if it is already filled in the financial document.
      Upgrade Note:
      Card Expire information will not be inherited from an authorization/pre-authorization/transit authorization document if it is already filled in a financial document. This behaviour is required, for example, for tokenization transaction processing. Interfaces using expire date information from a financial document may be impacted. An interface should be changed to get the card expire date from authorization/pre-authorization/transit authorization document to support previous system behaviour.

  • 03.45.29.14
    • [CARDS-51850]
      • It is now possible to clear the ServiceComment and License fields of a PaymentType using mBilling request.
    • [CARDS-52015]
      • Biller Management: ATM Retail contracts are now created with consideration of the requested channel.
    • [CARDS-52038]
      • A new CLIENT_ADDRESSES view has been created to show all addresses for a client and its contracts. The old CLIENT_ADDRESS_DATA view should be replaced in all customizations and Web Services. It will be removed in future versions.
    • [CARDS-52866]
      • If a SEPA Customer-To-Bank Export process fails with a validation error message, it is now logged in Process Message with "Error" type.
    • [CARDS-53171]
      • Supported work with applications for a multi-level contract hierarchy with different clients in application types. 
One application can contain several client sections and each client section can have its own subsections for addresses, classifiers, etc. 
If the client section is not mandatory, verification of client data is supported - at least one of the identifiers must be specified: reg_number, client_number, social_number, itn. When empty, the application sub-tree is ignored. 
The client section can also be the top one in the application for the contract: ObjectFor = Contract - the case of new client creation with its contract as a sub-contract for the specified one. 
In both cases, application type is required to have a contract section under such a client section at the next level with ActionType = Add.
      Updated Manuals: [application_management\r2\Advanced_Applications_R2_Module.pdf] [application_management\r2\Advanced_Applications_Workflow.pdf]
    • [CARDS-53329]
      • VISA Prepared Outward Processing: supported "single authorization multiple capture" specific for the "VISA Outward Files Completing" procedure. If the "MULTI_CLR"="Y" parameter is set, multiclearing messages will be sorted and exported in separate batches/files.

      • Supported uniqueness of client individual taxpayer number (ITN field). It's only checked if the field is not empty and the global parameter "UNIQUENESS_CLIENT_ITN" for the financial institution is not set to "N" (No). The default parameter value is "Y" (Yes) and ITN uniqueness is checked.
      Upgrade Note:
      The uniqueness of the client individual taxpayer number (ITN field) is now checked during client creation and modification. It's necessary to ensure that this field value is unique or set the additional global parameter UNIQUENESS_CLIENT_ITN to "N". The default value for this parameter is "Y".

    • [CARDS-53300]
      • For number variables (like %TRANS_AMOUNT%, %SUM(...)%) by default, if the format is not declared in the variable, use the formatting style (OpenWay\Full\Configuration Setup\Client Classifiers\Formatting Styles) with the "default" code.
      Upgrade Note:
      The "Formatting Styles" handbook (OpenWay\Full\Configuration Setup\Client Classifiers\Formatting Styles) must have a record with "Formatting Type"=Numbers, "Style Code"=default, and with the "Pattern" and "Decimal Separator" fields filled in. If this record is missing or incompletely filled in, it must be added or completed.
      Updated Manuals: [product_management\Client_Messages.pdf]
    • [CARDS-53358]
      • Fixed the inability to receive authorization requests from one IPS member to another when both members are served in the same processing centre but direct interbranch routing between them is blocked.
Please check external services configuration to share the source channel for correct authorization processing where <ChannelCode> is a source channel:
 * for Transaction Switch users, external adapter contains "special_processing_options sourceChannelID=<ChannelCode>"
 * for NetServer users, external channel contains <MODULE TYPE="NETWORK"> section with <PARAMETER NAME="SOURCE_CHANNEL_ID" VALUE="<ChannelCode>"/>
The case is directly related to situations when a message received from IPS channel will be routed back to the same channel.
    • [CARDS-53362]
      • Changed behaviour: pursuant to VISA requirements, the CPNA tag is no longer filled in with the "Visa Money Transfer" string for domestic money transfers if the correct value was not found.
    • [CARDS-53364]
      • Biller Management: fixed an error that randomly occurred when adding or updating payment type group.
    • [CARDS-53373]
      • Transaction conditions and attributes inheritance from authorization document is supported for tokenized transactions.
    • [CARDS-53375]
      • AMEX DAF Import. Fixed totals checking.

    • [I1703160402]/[CARDS-52474]
      • Product Inspector test script import has been modified when in the file being imported there are test scripts with the same codes that already exist in the destination WAY4Cards system. 
Previously, all test script steps already present in the destination database were deleted, which led to links being lost in comparing script results with the standard ones. This behaviour cannot be restored.
In the first step of the import procedure, all the existing test steps in the database are marked with the new status "Obsolete". In the second step, the system checks if the step number exists in the file being imported. If not, the step in the database is kept with the "Obsolete" status, otherwise the step gets a status and inherits other parameters from the file being imported. When a Product Inspector script is run, a step with the "Obsolete" status behaves the same way as a step with the "Skip" status.
      Upgrade Note:
      Product Inspector test script import has been modified when in the file being imported there are test scripts with the same codes that already exist in the destination WAY4Cards system. In the first step of the import procedure, all the existing test steps in the database are marked with the new status "Obsolete" (earlier steps were deleted). In the second step, the system checks if the step exists in the file being imported. If not, the step in the database is kept with the "Obsolete" status, otherwise the step gets a status and inherits other parameters from the file being imported. When a Product Inspector script is run, steps with the "Obsolete" status are processed the same way as  steps with the "Skip" status.
If a step with the "Obsolete" status isn't necessary, it is recommended to delete it from the Product Inspector script.
      Updated Manuals: [product_inspector\WAY4_Product_Inspector_Manual.pdf]
    • [I1703201358]/[CARDS-52738]

    • [CARDS-51856]
      • Created a new risk report "Exceeded Total Credit/Refund Transact. Nmbr to Total Purchase Transact. Nmbr Ratio" (OpenWay\Acquiring\Merchant Risk Management\Risk Reports - Acquiring Single).
It is necessary to set the TOTCRDRTRANSNUMRATIO risk scheme parameter (OpenWay\Full\Configuration Setup\Products\Acquiring Products\Device Risk Schemes) - Total Credit/Refund Transact. Nmbr to Total Purchase Transact. Nmbr Ratio.
Only device contracts for which the ratio of the Credit/Refund transactions to the total number of purchase transactions in a period exceeds the TOTCRDRTRANSNUMRATIO parameter value set in the risk scheme will be included in the report.
Only Credit (Trans Type IDT=0616) and Retail (Trans Type IDT=0515) transactions will be analysed when generating the report.
    • [CARDS-51857]

    • [CARDS-52234]
      • VISA Fee Prediction: Added Fee Program Areas for Visa Gold purchase and credit voucher transactions for Japan issuers.
      Upgrade Note:
      Visa will implement changes to interregional and AP regional fee structures that apply to Visa Gold transactions issued from Japan. Acquirers must support the changes to the fee programs that will be assessed on Visa Gold purchase and credit voucher transactions for Japan issuers. According to this release requirement acquirers must configure Fee Program Areas in the Standard Handbook manually: Handbook Type is FEE_PREDICTION__FEE_PROGRAM_AREA, for Filter1 values "1","B","C","E","F" Name must be "Interregional" and Code must be "JPN". Furthermore, acquirers in the AP region must add an extra record in the Standard Handbook: Handbook Type is FEE_PREDICTION__FEE_PROGRAM_AREA, for Filter1 value "A" Name must be "Intra-AP" and Code must be "JPN".
      Updated Manuals: [visa_interface\20XX_XX_VISA_Requirements.pdf]

  • 03.45.29.13
    • [CARDS-52308]
      • In WAY4 Datamart version 03.45.10, new FI Group Load functionality for performing several loads to Datamart (ETLs) for one banking date has been supported.
The fi_load_group tag should be put in f_i.special_parms to configure financial institution groups to be loaded during a certain ETL.
The mp_fi_load_group table and forms for filling in the fi_load_group tag in f_i.special_parms has been added from WAY4 Cards version 03.45.30.
      Updated Manuals: [Datamart\manuals\language\Datamart_Administration.pdf]
    • [CARDS-52379]
      • Supported new Fleet BERTLV request tags: EA.FFXX.DB - Item cost for client including total discount calculated by third-party device, 
EA.FFXX.DC - Item price for client including per-unit discount calculated by third-party device,
EA.FFXX.DD - Total item discount for client calculated by third-party device.
    • [CARDS-53017]
      • For Transaction Types (TRANS_TYPE table) added Trans_Code unique check:
- in "Transaction Types" and "Transactions - All" forms with the button Actions... -> Check All
- in Message Dictionary generation with the menu OpenWay\Full\Configuration Setup\Main Tables\Generate Message Dictionary.
      Upgrade Note:
      Added an automatic check of the uniqueness of the value in a transaction type's Trans Code field when generating a transaction dictionary. Generation fails for records with a code that is not unique. Customer Support provides an additional test script for checking the configuration in advance. If records that are not unique are found, they must be corrected so that their codes are unique. Please contact Customer Support in the event of difficulties.
      Updated Manuals: [core\Common_References_Books.pdf] [transaction_management\Documents.pdf]
    • [CARDS-53282]
      • Unused CUST_GL_TRANSFER procedure has been dropped
    • [CARDS-53296]
      • New tags have been added to Fleet BERTLV response message: EA.FFXX.D6 - Item cost for client including total discount calculated by issuer, EA.FFXX.D7 - Item price for client including per-unit discount calculated by issuer, EA.FFXX.D8 - Total item discount for client calculated by issuer.
    • [CARDS-53156]
      • IPS Products. Added AMEX products.
    • [CARDS-53195]
      • DCI IPSE Export. Fixed Billing File records generation.
    • [CARDS-53226]
      • Generation of corrections in intelligent backdated processing has been improved. When a liability tree is processed, corrections will be generated for transfers between Main/Sub trees in the liability hierarchy. Additionally corrections can now be generated for transfers to not amount available accounts, this feature can be enabled by setting the STORNO_NOT_AMAV_CORRECTIONS global parameter to "Y".
      Updated Manuals: [reversal_management\Reversal_Management.pdf]
    • [CARDS-53244]
      • Added a "Currency" column which reflects the currency of "Amount" and "Fee" fields to the "All Docs" tab in Case Management screens.
    • [CARDS-53283]
      • Each ITEM_DUE is now processed separately in Acquiring products configuration. Previously, using a Due Type other then Value Days Due could cause a collapse of several ITEM_DUE with different signs, leading to incorrect information in Merchant Statement reports.
    • [CARDS-53291]
      • Fixed the inability to redefine the PARTIAL_APPROVAL_ENABLE property in Services or transaction subtypes.
    • [CARDS-53334]
      • NSPK Processing (pipes): fixed incorrect processing for PDS-0176 and PDS-0190 for AMEX.
    • [I1704037380]/[CARDS-53331]
      • If the "Current Grace Date" is requested via the bal_log.CURRENT_GRACE_DATE function, the system returns the value of the contract date "Full Payment Date" (FP_DATE, stored in ACNT_LOG.trg_date_5). To override the returned value for the bal_log.CURRENT_GRACE_DATE function, store the required value in the trg_date_4 field of the ACNT_LOG table.
    • [I1704189347]/[CARDS-52998]
      • Fixed double fee charging in issuing contracts for financial documents that inherit the fee amount from an authorization document (FROM_AUTH=FEE_AMOUNT is used in basic transaction service setup) when the fee is configured as a Misc service with the tag "MTR_FEE;" and triggered by a usage limiter on authorization document processing.
    • [I1705221304]/[CARDS-53272]
      • IPS Products. Updated according to last NSPK specification.
    • [CARDS-53277]
      • Affiliated BII Outward Processing (pipe) : supported export of NSPK G2C Credit transactions.
  • 03.45.29.12
    • [CARDS-53239]
      • The document processing procedure creates and fills CLR_SEQ_COUNT (multiple clearing count) and CLR_SEQ_NUM (multiple clearing sequence number) tags in Sales Completion documents for Multiple Capture transactions on own acquiring side.
    • [CARDS-52562]
      • New sy_conf_group_rec records automatically created during opt_classify.CLASSIFY_CARD_BRANDS() execution are now marked with the AUTO=Y; tag in the add_info field.
    • [CARDS-52937]
      • Added the ability to set the "SKIP_AUTH_EVNT;" tag in the ServiceInfo field of the form "OpenWay\Full\Configuration Setup\Merchant Device Setup\Additional Online Services -> [Full Info]" to suppress standard notification event generation.
    • [CARDS-53201]
      • VISA VCF Export (pipe): added the ability to redefine card numbers for some accounts on export for mixed company structure. The prefixes of these accounts must be listed in the "ACCOUNT_PREFIX" pipe parameter value, separated by commas. The new pipe parameter, "CUST_GET_CARD_NUMBER" must contain an SQL expression which returns the redefined card number value.
    • [CARDS-53235]
      • Authorization requests for cards with multiple relations will be rejected if no contract exists with the specified relation and the SET_DEFAULT_ACCOUNT global parameter is set to 'N'. Authorization advices and financial presentments will be processed for the default relation contract.
      Updated Manuals: [core\Global_Parameters.pdf]
    • [CARDS-53243]
      • Changed the "CM.Operations.All Docs" form in the "CM Risk Management" and "Dispute Assistant" menu items. Removed the [TARGET_AMOUNT] and [TARGET_AMOUNT_FEE] computed fields. Added a new link [Srvc/Fee] to view all financial flows from all macrotransactions.
      Upgrade Note:
      To improve performance, the following changes have been made in the "CM.Operations.All Docs" form available from the "CM Risk Management" and "Dispute Assistant" menu items: 
- The [TARGET_AMOUNT] and [TARGET_AMOUNT_FEE] computed fields have been removed. 
- A new link [Srvc/Fee] has been added to view information about entries generated for a document.
This change may require to modify the internal regulations or customize the form to preserve previous behaviour.
    • [CARDS-53254]
      • Changed default SQL values for analyzing parent Service Packs for the P_CAN_DISPENSE_CASH and  P_CAN_ACCEPT_CASH parameters in the "XLS_NSPK_Statistics_Acquiring_Devices" report.
      Updated Manuals: [mir_statistical_reports\MIR_Statistical_Reports.pdf]
    • [I1610288767]/[CARDS-53236]
      • The ALLOW_REV_IN_TREE global parameter can be redefined for merchant contracts and financial institutions (see the standard manual "Acquiring Module User Manual").
      Updated Manuals: [acquiring_authorisation\Voice_Authorization.pdf]
    • [CARDS-49243]
      • An equal condition is used to count the number of accounts in the "Total Outstanding" line of the "Aged Analysis of Total Outstanding" section, and "Number of Accounts" line of the "Card Issuance" section in the "QMR VISA Statistics Issuing" report.
    • [CARDS-52827]
      • Supported configuration of the "Cardholder_Account_Statement" and "Cardholder_Contract_Statement" reports using Date Schemes.
      Upgrade Note:
      The algorithm for due date calculation in customer reports has been changed to support configuration via contract functional dates. The new behaviour may differ from previous behaviour when the due date is a non-working day. In this case, explicit configuration of functional date shifts will be needed - see the manual <OW_HOME>\manuals\english\Product_management\Functional_Dates.pdf
    • [CARDS-52991]
      • DDDW domain with name "tariff_group__l" has been renamed to "tariff_group__lf". 
DBManager does not support work with non-unique codes of tariff types.
    • [CARDS-53163]
      • Fixed inability to add elements to several Exception Lists (OpenWay\Risk Based Assessment\Exception lists) without reopening the sub-form.
    • [CARDS-53193]
      • Correct funds unblocking is supported for multiple financial presentments and multiple authorizations in different currencies for one transaction chain. In this case, the new pending amount is calculated as the difference between all authorizations pending (without fees) and the financial presentment settlement amount converted into the contract currency. Then it is accumulated under the first matched authorization. The pending value for the initial authorization is stored in the document add_info tags BLK_BASE, BLK_FEE, BLK_CURR.
    • [CARDS-53238]
      • Th P_ORDER_AGED_ANALYSIS parameter has been deleted from the "XLS_Visa_Statistics_Issuing_Business" report.
      Updated Manuals: [visa_statistical_reports\quarterly_operating_certificates\VISA_Statistical_Reports.pdf]
    • [CARDS-53251]
      • Changed behaviour: now processing of authorization documents with service class Transaction, Online Payment or External Payment will change a contract's counter for authorization code generation independently of the UPD_AUTH_SEQ_N parameter value.
    • [CARDS-53278]
      • The mechanism that gathers and generates information for tags used when running Product Inspector scripts has been fixed. To activate the mechanism, the global parameter PI_COLLECT_TAGS should be set to "Y". In this case, information is stored in process message with the message type "X". The  parameter is switched off by default (value "N").
      Updated Manuals: [product_inspector\WAY4_Product_Inspector_Manual.pdf]
    • [I1704041217]/[CARDS-53192]
      • MasterCard IPM OnUs Outward. The pipe no longer fills DE93.
    • [I1704187095]/[CARDS-53269]
      • Usage limiter's end date calculation has been enhanced for usage limiters with Period Type = Billing for sub-contracts.
    • [I1704265122]/[CARDS-53279]
      • DF32, DF33, DF34, DF36, DF3A tags definition added to Chip Scheme Parameters Usability.
    • [CARDS-51624]
      • MasterCard Transaction Management. A warning message and opening a "CHBK_FRAUD_COUNTER" Event have be added for cases when the number of Fraud Chargebacks is exceeded. DA v2. Create Chargeback activity can't be performed if the number of Fraud Chargebacks is exceeded.
    • [CARDS-53149]
      • DCI Merchant Management. Supported DCI International Merchant Registration.
      Updated Manuals: [diners_club_interface\Diners_Merchants.pdf]
    • [CARDS-53265]
      • AMEX GNS Inward. Supported empty chargeback gross settlement amount for certification.
    • [CARDS-53268]
      • JCB Outward: for all chip read transactions the "C" value is exported in 22.7 subfield.
  • 03.45.29.11
    • [CARDS-52569]
      • mVISA: Merchant data have been added to outward parameter in tagged format for merchant card credit request response.
    • [CARDS-52590]
      • New forms to view and edit client and contract parameters have been implemented. Menu item "OpenWay\Issuing\Customer Support\Contract Parameters".

    • [CARDS-52715]
      • TRACK1_DDF and TRACK2_DDF default values have been added for UPI/CUP cards.
    • [CARDS-53024]
      • The following variables have been added to support multicurrency debit products in statement reports ad:
-%SIBLING_MTR%, with values Y / N  indicating sibling order transaction.
-%MTR_OPPOSITE$, prefix for the opposite contract from a transaction.
      Updated Manuals: [issuing\user_manuals\Cardholder_Statements.pdf] [product_management\Client_Messages.pdf]
    • [CARDS-53097]
      • A document's posting date is used instead of transaction date to calculate ARN.
    • [CARDS-53117]
      • Filling Invoice Party Name for Direct Credit from the RCEIVR_NAME document tag has been supported.
    • [CARDS-53123]
      • Check of RC and document status for the "set credit limit" Product Inspector step has been added.
      Upgrade Note:
      Now the system always checks the response code value and status of the credit limit document generated by the Product Inspector step. 
It is recommended:
- to fix the reasons for an incorrect response code and document status for a previously generated standard Product Inspector script.
- to indicate the new successful Product Inspector script and corresponding log as the standard ones.
Note: standard scripts and logs only need to be changed if a credit limit was set with an error.
    • [CARDS-53130]
      • Changed layout of add_info_* tags for biller contracts.
    • [CARDS-53141]
      • The Consistency Types form for ETL to Datamart has now an editable option for loading by financial institution groups.
      Updated Manuals: [Datamart\manuals\language\Datamart_Administration.pdf]
    • [CARDS-53166]
      • Events processing during the correction process has been enhanced to support proper event information loading into Datamart. The start local date and end local date of an event record will now be set as the current banking date if the event was posted or closed during the correction process.
    • [CARDS-53203]
      • The SEND_REVERSE tag can now be set in a document to allow a reversal to be sent to the payment system before an advice has been sent.
      Updated Manuals: [transaction_management\Documents.pdf]
    • [I1704120504]/[CARDS-53120]
      • Changed behaviour when online requests based on Advanced Applications R2 for urgent operations such as contract status change, contract event posting, classifier setting, PIN attempts clearing are accepted in NoWF mode and cannot be performed immediately due to contract unavailability on the node (Response Code 2288) or a Deadlock (Response Code 2270), the application will be declined and a warning message will be returned as an error.
Behaviour for non-urgent operations, offline application accept and workflow application processing hasn't been changed. In this case, applications will be processed by the next automatic accept process.
      Updated Manuals: [application_management\r2\Advanced_Applications_R2_Module.pdf] [application_management\r2\Advanced_Applications_Workflow.pdf]
    • [CARDS-46540]
      • Due normalization has been improved for Issuing accounts with Due Types: Payment Due, Long Payment Due, Contract Due, Fixed Day Due. If several due items with the same Due Date exist for an account, then only one Due transfer will be performed for the total Due Amount.
    • [CARDS-48323]
      • IRD configuration has been modified for Spain.
    • [CARDS-51938]
      • Excluded technical operations from Risk Rule usage limiter processing. Technical operations are operations where transaction type and service class are not filled.
    • [CARDS-52269]
      • If an online reversal did not lead to a change in the amount available, a notification will not created.
    • [CARDS-52323]
      • Fixed error when cross-balance macrotransactions created by a standing order were not linked to the document.
    • [CARDS-52384]
      • A new API has been added, acnt_api.SEARCH_CLIENT_EXT. The API extends acnt_api.SEARCH_CLIENT with the ClientCategory input parameter.
Both APIs acnt_api.SEARCH_CLIENT(_EXT) now have different RetCode/RetMsg error values:
1/Client not found
2/Too many Clients were found
3/Client number conversion error
100/Internal error ORA-xxxxxx
For the old acnt_api.SEARCH_CLIENT API, search results have changed. If more than one client was found, the API returns null as ClientID and an error in RetCode.
      Upgrade Note:
      The client search algorithm has been changed for acnt_api.SEARCH_CLIENT. If more than one client was found, the API procedure now returns an error. 
It is recommended to use the new API procedure acnt_api.SEARCH_CLIENT_EXT instead of acnt_api.SEARCH_CLIENT for a more exact client search. 
A new input parameter, ClientCategory, can be used to specify the client category when 'CLIENT_NUMBER', 'REG_NUMBER', 'ITN' and 'SOCIAL_NUMBER'  values define the client search method.
    • [CARDS-52808]
      • In WAY4 Web added check of client privileges to access uploaded files and merchant tree contracts.
    • [CARDS-52860]
      • The "Account Balances" section in the "XLS_AMEX_Statistics_Issuing_Business" report has been corrected:
- Corrected calculation of 'Credit Outstanding Balance Total' and 'Current Credit Outstanding Balance' amount when the P_MIRROR_OVD parameter value is 'Y'.
- Changed row order to fit AMEX specification requirements.
- Delinquency group's rows are shown with zero values if there are no corresponding data.
    • [CARDS-52966]
      • The menu branch "OpenWay\MIR Statistics Reports\MIR. Details" (with all menu items) and menu items "OpenWay\MIR Statistics Reports\MIR Notification Report (briefly)", "OpenWay\MIR Statistics Reports\MIR Acknowledgement Report (briefly)", "OpenWay\MIR Statistics Reports\MIR Settlement Report (briefly)", "OpenWay\MIR Statistics Reports\MIR Settlement Results (briefly)", "OpenWay\MIR Statistics Reports\MIR Submission Report (briefly)" have been moved to "OpenWay\MIR\MIR. Reports\" menu branch.

    • [CARDS-53167]
      • Changed population of the CSOF tag (Source of Funds) for Money Transfers to a Visa card from the card of another IPS according to Visa requirements. Now the "06" value is returned for Credit accounts, and the "05" value is returned for Debit/deposit access accounts.
    • [CARDS-53169]
      • spac.RESET_INTEREST has been enhanced for custom cases, when Interest Rate should be changed from the Billing cycle start date after holidays, if Interest Rate should be changed in a custom procedure after a new billing cycle starts.
    • [CARDS-53170]
      • Service limit tariffs with preference based on Issuer country (Area) can now be used for source services.
    • [CARDS-53177]
      • Merchant Management: Fixed processing of incomplete operations.
    • [CARDS-53182]
      • To apply a Tax Tariff according to its own Date From instead of an Interest Tariff apply mode's From Billing Start, set the tag TAX_APPLY_MODE=OWN; in the Tax Tariff apply rules.

    • [CARDS-53185]
      • Resolved issue: now Advanced Applications R1 for AuthMethod modification does not take into account closed authentication schemes.
    • [CARDS-53210]
      • Removed unexpected call of document reprocessing when routing a message in the Distributed Processing solution.
    • [CARDS-53211]
      • Date_Expire and Card_Expire contract dates are now considered in calculation of the "Account Balance" section of the "XLS_AMEX_Statistics_Issuing_Business" report.
    • [CARDS-53214]
      • Fixed incorrect filling of source and target number fields for chargeback documents if the message contains EMV cryptogram data.
    • [CARDS-53216]

    • [CARDS-53218]
      • Changed the value displayed in the "Total Due" field in the "ROOT\OpenWay\Customer Service\Customer Service" form. Previously, the field showed the current due amount. Now the total due amount is displayed.
    • [CARDS-53221]
      • Decreased possibility of deadlock when several authorization requests for one card are received at the same time.
    • [I1612096107]/[CARDS-52844]
      • IC Document Export: fixed "An invalid XML character (Unicode: 0x1a) was found" error when exporting a document containing special characters. Invalid symbols are replaced with the "?" character in an outgoing file.
    • [I1703281144]/[CARDS-53100]
      • DA v2: Added checking that data in the document add_info field is properly terminated with a semicolon for documents that are manually edited. If not, a semicolon will be added to the end of the add_info field.

      Upgrade Note:
      The algorithm for calculating the date of generating/charging an annual miscellaneous Service fee has changed. If the following configuration is used, it is strongly recommended to perform thorough functional testing on the new WAY4 Cards version: 
- recurring fee type ("Full/Configuration Setup/Transaction Types/Fee Types") has the parameter value Charge Event="Yearly".

    • [I1704245616]/[CARDS-53038]
      • IRD criteria of contactless transactions have been revised in the MEA region according to the MasterCard Interchange manual.
    • [I1704264344]/[CARDS-52981]
      • When searching for an authorization document for a financial presentment by RRN, no time period limitations are applied. In other search cases, the period is extended to 10 days.
    • [I1705030725]/[CARDS-53058]
      • When an authorization and financial presentment have different transaction types, the transaction direction is additionally checked. If the direction differs, documents are not matched.
    • [CARDS-53004]
      • Mobile banking: a requirement for the value of the allow_multiple_user_sessions parameter has been added. The parameter must be set to "false" in accordance with PA-DSS.
      Updated Manuals: Security &amp; key management | PCI DSS Implementation Guide
    • [CARDS-53005]
      • Interactive channels API: a requirement for the value of the csrf_protection parameter has been added. The parameter must be set to "true" in accordance with PA-DSS.
      Updated Manuals: Security &amp; key management | PCI DSS Implementation Guide
    • [CARDS-53006]
      • Messenger banking: a requirement to not disclose private IP addresses has been added in accordance with PA-DSS.
      Updated Manuals: Security &amp; key management | PCI DSS Implementation Guide
    • [CARDS-53007]
      • Messenger banking: a requirement for the value of the session_expiry_sec parameter has been added. The parameter must be set to "300" in accordance with PA-DSS.
      Updated Manuals: Security &amp; key management | PCI DSS Implementation Guide
    • [CARDS-53008]
      • Mobile banking: a requirement for the value of the debug_enabled parameter has been added. The parameter must be set to "false" in accordance with PA-DSS.
      Updated Manuals: Security &amp; key management | PCI DSS Implementation Guide
    • [CARDS-53009]
      • WAY4 Web: a requirement for the value of the EnableDeveloperInfo parameter has been added. The parameter must be set to "false" in accordance with PA-DSS.
      Updated Manuals: Security &amp; key management | PCI DSS Implementation Guide

(MasterCard Services: Added services according to Release 17.Q3 article AN 1004.)
    • [CARDS-53047]
      • Transaction Processing: Added checking of Service Code 701 as a chip code for AMEX.
  • 03.45.20.01
    • [CARDS-53201]
      • VISA VCF Export (pipe): added the ability to redefine card numbers for some accounts on export for mixed company structure. The prefixes of these accounts must be listed in the "ACCOUNT_PREFIX" pipe parameter value, separated by commas. The new pipe parameter, "CUST_GET_CARD_NUMBER" must contain an SQL expression which returns the redefined card number value.
    • [CARDS-53195]
      • DCI IPSE Export. Fixed Billing File records generation.
    • [CARDS-53226]
      • Generation of corrections in intelligent backdated processing has been improved. When a liability tree is processed, corrections will be generated for transfers between Main/Sub trees in the liability hierarchy. Additionally corrections can now be generated for transfers to not amount available accounts, this feature can be enabled by setting the STORNO_NOT_AMAV_CORRECTIONS global parameter to "Y".
      Updated Manuals: [reversal_management\Reversal_Management.pdf]
    • [CARDS-53238]
      • Th P_ORDER_AGED_ANALYSIS parameter has been deleted from the "XLS_Visa_Statistics_Issuing_Business" report.
      Updated Manuals: [visa_statistical_reports\quarterly_operating_certificates\VISA_Statistical_Reports.pdf]
    • [CARDS-53270]
      • UPI Audit Trailer Import. Supported creating settlement documents for Fee Collection/ Funds Disbursements (FCP file).
      Upgrade Note:
      1. If message codes S2III1ZF, S2III2ZF, S2IAI1ZF, S2IAI2ZF are configured for the UPI channel (menu item "OpenWay\Full\Configuration Setup\Transaction Types\Message Types - All"), the bank should delete them.
2. Add the new transaction type "Fee Collection and Funds Disbursement Total" (menu item "OpenWay\Full\Configuration Setup\Transaction Types\Transactions - All").
3. Add new message codes S1--I--F, S2I-I1ZF, S2I-I2ZF, S2O-I2ZF
Contact Customer Support for details.
    • [CARDS-53283]
      • Each ITEM_DUE is now processed separately in Acquiring products configuration. Previously, using a Due Type other then Value Days Due could cause a collapse of several ITEM_DUE with different signs, leading to incorrect information in Merchant Statement reports.
    • [CARDS-53291]
      • Fixed the inability to redefine the PARTIAL_APPROVAL_ENABLE property in Services or transaction subtypes.
    • [CARDS-53334]
      • NSPK Processing (pipes): fixed incorrect processing for PDS-0176 and PDS-0190 for AMEX.
    • [I1704187095]/[CARDS-53269]
      • Usage limiter's end date calculation has been enhanced for usage limiters with Period Type = Billing for sub-contracts.
    • [I1705221304]/[CARDS-53272]
      • IPS Products. Updated according to last NSPK specification.
    • [CARDS-51624]
      • MasterCard Transaction Management. A warning message and opening a "CHBK_FRAUD_COUNTER" Event have be added for cases when the number of Fraud Chargebacks is exceeded. DA v2. Create Chargeback activity can't be performed if the number of Fraud Chargebacks is exceeded.
    • [CARDS-53265]
      • AMEX GNS Inward. Supported empty chargeback gross settlement amount for certification.
    • [CARDS-53268]
      • JCB Outward: for all chip read transactions the "C" value is exported in 22.7 subfield.
    • [CARDS-53277]
      • Affiliated BII Outward Processing (pipe) : supported export of NSPK G2C Credit transactions.
  • 03.45.19.20
    • [CARDS-53014]
      • An online credit repeat message will not increase the amount available when it is received on an HA solution secondary node.
    • [CARDS-46540]
      • Due normalization has been improved for Issuing accounts with Due Types: Payment Due, Long Payment Due, Contract Due, Fixed Day Due. If several due items with the same Due Date exist for an account, then only one Due transfer will be performed for the total Due Amount.
    • [CARDS-49243]
      • An equal condition is used to count the number of accounts in the "Total Outstanding" line of the "Aged Analysis of Total Outstanding" section, and "Number of Accounts" line of the "Card Issuance" section in the "QMR VISA Statistics Issuing" report.
    • [CARDS-52827]
      • Supported configuration of the "Cardholder_Account_Statement" and "Cardholder_Contract_Statement" reports using Date Schemes.
      Upgrade Note:
      The algorithm for due date calculation in customer reports has been changed to support configuration via contract functional dates. The new behaviour may differ from previous behaviour when the due date is a non-working day. In this case, explicit configuration of functional date shifts will be needed - see the manual <OW_HOME>\manuals\english\Product_management\Functional_Dates.pdf
    • [CARDS-53163]
      • Fixed inability to add elements to several Exception Lists (OpenWay\Risk Based Assessment\Exception lists) without reopening the sub-form.
    • [CARDS-53167]
      • Changed population of the CSOF tag (Source of Funds) for Money Transfers to a Visa card from the card of another IPS according to Visa requirements. Now the "06" value is returned for Credit accounts, and the "05" value is returned for Debit/deposit access accounts.
    • [CARDS-53170]
      • Service limit tariffs with preference based on Issuer country (Area) can now be used for source services.
    • [CARDS-53177]
      • Merchant Management: Fixed processing of incomplete operations.
    • [CARDS-53182]
      • To apply a Tax Tariff according to its own Date From instead of an Interest Tariff apply mode's From Billing Start, set the tag TAX_APPLY_MODE=OWN; in the Tax Tariff apply rules.
      Updated Manuals: [accounting\Interests_Accrual.pdf] [tariff_management\Tariff_Management.pdf]
    • [CARDS-53193]
      • Correct funds unblocking is supported for multiple financial presentments and multiple authorizations in different currencies for one transaction chain. In this case, the new pending amount is calculated as the difference between all authorizations pending (without fees) and the financial presentment settlement amount converted into the contract currency. Then it is accumulated under the first matched authorization. The pending value for the initial authorization is stored in the document add_info tags BLK_BASE, BLK_FEE, BLK_CURR.
    • [CARDS-53205]
      • Supported General order category to retrieve data for Merchant Registration. DCI Russia Merchant Management.
      Updated Manuals: [diners_club_interface\Diners_Merchants.pdf]
    • [CARDS-53210]

    • [CARDS-53211]

    • [CARDS-53214]

    • [CARDS-52795]
      • The Standard Evening Contract Daily Update process has been renamed from "Contr Daily Update2" to "Contr Daily Update Evening". In the Upgrade procedure, process parameters are automatically updated for "Contr Daily Update Evening" in the form OpenWay\Full\Configuration Setup\Main Tables\Process Parameters.
      Upgrade Note:
      Standard evening contracts daily update process has been renamed. The name "Contr Daily Update Evening" is used instead of "Contr Daily Update2". During the Upgrade procedure, default parameters from the "Contr Daily Update2" process will be copied to the new process "Contr Daily Update Evening". After installation, information about the copied parameters can be found in the form OpenWay\Full\Configuration Setup\Main Tables\Process Parameters.
It may be necessary to change the list of processes in monitoring forms used by operators on duty.

Impact on: Member with "Device H2H" interface 
Old behavior: Document transaction date had local date time generated by host system.

  • 03.45.19.14
    • [CARDS-52781]
      • Added a new field, "WF Operation" to "OpenWay\Advanced Applications R2\Setup\Workflow Configuration\Activities" to define application workflow status after performing an activity: "To Closed" or "To Open". For a standard strategy it's recommended to set this field to "To Closed" for "Accept" and "Decline" activities and to "To Open" for "Approve" and "Capture and Edit Application" activities. 
"OpenWay\Advanced Applications R2\Application Processing\Close Posted Applications" allows workflow to be closed for all posted and declined applications when the workflow configuration is changed.
      Upgrade Note:
      A new field, "WF Operation" has been added to the form "OpenWay\Advanced Applications R2\Setup\Workflow Configuration\Activities". The field makes it possible to specify whether to close (To Closed) or to reopen (To Open) application workflow (WF) after an activity has been performed. 
In standard data, "To Closed" is set for the Accept and Decline (manual and system) activities and "To Open" is set for Approve, Capture and Edit Application activities. 
Previously, automatic closing of cases was not provided for in standard data. 
Since the absence of automatic closing of cases has a number of negative consequences (for example, open cases can't be deleted, it is not possible to determine whether application workflow has been completed according to case status, etc.), it is recommended to configure actions and workflow strategies to close the workflow process after work with an application has been completed.
To do so, it is sufficient to specify WF Operation=To Close for Accept and Decline activities (manual and system), or for other activities that are the last ones in application workflow, for custom strategies.
After custom actions have been corrected, all posted applications must be closed using the menu item "OpenWay\Advanced Applications R2\Application Processing\Close Posted Applications". This process can be performed in parallel mode if the PARALLEL parameter is configured for the "Close Posted Applications" process in "OpenWay\Full\Configuration Setup\Main Tables\Process Parameters"
After posted applications have been closed, the global parameter CHECK_OPEN_APPL_CASE can be set to "Y" to check if there are open application cases when closing the contract (if the CLOSE_IF_EMPTY tag is set in an Event to check whether there are open cases for a contract).
      Updated Manuals: [application_management\r2\Advanced_Applications_Workflow.pdf]
    • [CARDS-52834]
      • The ability has been added to properly recalculate contract state with correction documents for fees and interest in intelligent backdated processing. Correction transaction types should be marked using the STORNO_DELAY tag with the "Y" value if a fee is posted in Contracts Daily Update with the preceding date and "N" if a fee is posted in Contracts Daily Update with the current date.
      Updated Manuals: [reversal_management\Reversal_Management.pdf]
    • [CARDS-52841]

    • [CARDS-52890]

      Updated Manuals: [core_banking_interface\core_banking_interface\user_manuals\CBS_Interface_UFX.pdf]

    • [CARDS-52921]
      • VISA/MasterCard: The following menu items have been deleted:
- "OpenWay\VISA\VISA. Daily Procedures\VISA. Load Bin Table and Handbooks\OLD Remove Visa Inactive BIN's"
- "OpenWay\VISA\VISA. Daily Procedures\VISA. Load Bin Table and Handbooks\OLD VISA Domestic BIN Split"
- "OpenWay\VISA\VISA. Daily Procedures\VISA. Load Bin Table and Handbooks\OLD Load VISA & PLUS BIN Table"
- "OpenWay\VISA\VISA. Daily Procedures\VISA. Load Bin Table and Handbooks\VISA. Special\OLD Load VISA & PLUS BIN Table (Keep Old Groups)"
- "OpenWay\MasterCard\MC. Daily Procedures\MC. Load Bin Table and Handbooks\OLD Load MPE Daily Files"
- "OpenWay\MasterCard\MC. Daily Procedures\MC. Load Bin Table and Handbooks\OLD Load MPE Daily Files with Conversion"
- "OpenWay\MasterCard\MC. Daily Procedures\MC. Load Bin Table and Handbooks\MC. Full Replacement\OLD Load MPE BIN Table"
- "OpenWay\MasterCard\MC. Daily Procedures\MC. Load Bin Table and Handbooks\MC. Full Replacement\OLD Load MPE Replacement Files"
      Upgrade Note:
      Banks must use the new menu items: "OpenWay\VISA\VISA. Daily Procedures\VISA. Load Bin Table and Handbooks\VISA & Combined BIN Tables Import", "OpenWay\VISA\VISA. Daily Procedures\VISA. Load Bin Table and Handbooks\VISA & PLUS BIN Tables Import", "OpenWay\MasterCard\MC. Daily Procedures\MC. Load Bin Table and Handbooks\MC MPE Daily Files Import", "OpenWay\MasterCard\MC. Daily Procedures\MC. Load Bin Table and Handbooks\MC MPE Daily Files Import with Conversion", "OpenWay\MasterCard\MC. Daily Procedures\MC. Load Bin Table and Handbooks\MC. Full Replacement\MC MPE Full Files Import", "OpenWay\MasterCard\MC. Daily Procedures\MC. Load Bin Table and Handbooks\MC. Full Replacement\MC MPE Full Files Import with Conversion". Contact Support for details.
    • [I1612082576]/[CARDS-52928]
      • VISA BASEII Outward Processing (pipe): changed the logic for filling the "Reimbursement Attribute" field (TCx5 TCR 0 pos 168). Now the default value of the REIMB_ATTR_FROM_SERVICE parameter is "Y" instead of "N". If the REIMB_ATTR_FROM_SERVICE parameter is set to "Y", the "Reimbursement Attribute" field (TCx5 TCR 0 pos 168) will be filled with doc.TARGET_FEE_CODE field, if doc.TARGET_FEE_CODE is null, this field will be filled automatically by the pipe itself. Please review VISA services settings or if Fee Prediction is used, set up WAY4 according to the "VISA_RA_Configuration" manual. If the REIMB_ATTR_FROM_SERVICE parameter is set to "N", the "Reimbursement Attribute" field (TCx5 TCR 0 pos 168) is always calculated by the pipe itself. If the latter behaviour is needed, the parameter REIMB_ATTR_FROM_SERVICE = "N" should be set in the pipe.
      Upgrade Note:
      VISA BASEII Outward Processing (pipe): changed the logic for filling the "Reimbursement Attribute" field (TCx5 TCR 0 pos 168). Now the default value of the REIMB_ATTR_FROM_SERVICE parameter is "Y" instead of "N". If the REIMB_ATTR_FROM_SERVICE parameter is set to "Y", the "Reimbursement Attribute" field (TCx5 TCR 0 pos 168) will be filled with doc.TARGET_FEE_CODE field, if doc.TARGET_FEE_CODE is null, this field will be filled automatically by the pipe itself. Please review VISA services settings or if Fee Prediction is used, set up WAY4 according to the "VISA_RA_Configuration" manual. If the REIMB_ATTR_FROM_SERVICE parameter is set to "N", the "Reimbursement Attribute" field (TCx5 TCR 0 pos 168) is always calculated by the pipe itself. If the latter behaviour is needed, the parameter REIMB_ATTR_FROM_SERVICE = "N" should be set in the pipe.
      Updated Manuals: [visa_interface\VISA_Interface.pdf]
    • [CARDS-52027]
      • A financial document will not be matched with an authorization that has a different "PS Reference Number".
    • [CARDS-52395]
      • Functionality missing in 03.44 for linking a financial document to a matched preauthorization document has been restored. If a financial document received in back-office from an OnUs source, is matched with a preauthorization document during the document processing procedure, the preauthorization document's identifier is stored in the financial document's add_info field as the value of the "PREAUTH_ID" tag.
System identifiers that a document was received from an OnUs source when at least one of the following conditions is met:
1. A document Source Channel is indicated with the parameter IsOnUs=Yes or IsOnUs=null in the form "OpenWay\Full\Configuration Setup\Main Tables\Message Channels".
2. A document Source Member Id value is null or is marked in the BIN Table with the "CAN_BE_ONUS;" tag or the value is registered as "Acq BIN" in the form "OpenWay\Full\Configuration Setup\Main Tables\Bank Acquiring Parameters" used for own acquiring configuration, or a financial institution is registered for this Member ID value in the form "OpenWay\Full\Configuration Setup\Main Tables\Financial Institutions".

      • Fixed funds unblocking in the case of multiple authorizations with multiple presentments.
    • [CARDS-52871]
      • Fixed an error with matching recurring transactions

    • [CARDS-52899]

    • [CARDS-52909]

    • [CARDS-52915]
      • The "OFFICER" scope has been added to validation conditions for an authentication scheme linked to a consumer record.
    • [CARDS-52926]
      • Product approval has been changed, "Product Renew Mode" form has been added.
    • [CARDS-52934]
      • Fixed error on adjustment document posting if the original authorization was deleted by the Housekeeping process.
    • [I1611299904]/[CARDS-51699]
      • Added transfer destination identification type to the procedure for creating a document by a payment order to allow the use of other contract identifiers in addition to PAN.
    • [I1704121217, I1704192844]/[CARDS-52867]
      • Optimised the procedure for posting macrotransactions for reversal and adjustment documents if the value of the additional global parameter PATCH_REVERSE_INTEREST is set to "Y".
    • [I1704135142]/[CARDS-52903]
      • A financial document will not be matched with an authorization of a different transaction type even if the reference numbers are the same.
      Updated Manuals: [transaction_management\Documents.pdf]
    • [I1704192981. Wrong IC for new visa B2B Virtual Payments (ICFEE-178)]/[CARDS-52895]

    • [I1704206572]/[CARDS-52902]

    • [I1704207687]/[CARDS-52889]

    • [I1704243534]/[CARDS-52916]
      • Fixed "No Data Found" error during authorisation processing if contr_subtype.bin_record is invalid.
    • [CARDS-52785]
      • Updated "PA DSS Implementation Guide". The section "List of Third-Party Software Used, System Services and Protocols Used" has been changed. Added a warning that the mod_security component is an essential part of the application with regard to security.
      Updated Manuals: Security &amp; key management | PCI DSS Implementation Guide
    • [CARDS-52786]
      • Updated "PA DSS Implementation Guide". The section "Specifying Sensitive Data" has been changed. Added a warning that the system cannot function normally without the PVV and Encrypted PIN fields.
      Updated Manuals: Security &amp; key management | PCI DSS Implementation Guide
    • [CARDS-52807]
      • "PA DSS Implementation Guide" has been updated. The section "Encryption and Protected Protocols for Data Transmission" has been changed. Added a warning that when the TLS 1.2 protocol is used, encryption using the RC4 algorithm must be disabled.
      Updated Manuals: Security &amp; key management | PCI DSS Implementation Guide
    • [CARDS-52884]
      • Updated "PA DSS Implementation Guide". Full review for PA DSS 3.2 compliance (03.42.3.x, 03.43.3.x, 03.44.3.x).

  • 03.45.19.13
    • [CARDS-52806]
      • "MIR" Contactless cards issuing is supported in WAY4.
    • [CARDS-52634]
      • Added a new menu item, "OpenWay\Full\Daily Procedures\Consistency Points". In the standard configuration it makes it possible to trace calls of the standard "Close GL Entries" process. This is important as all GL entries generated on the previous banking day after closing GL will be registered in "OpenWay\Full\DB Administrator Utilities\Special OpenWay Utilities\GL\GL Trace Exceptions". In configurations with the Datamart interface this menu item will also show Datamart-related consistency points.
      Updated Manuals: [accounting\WAY4_Accounting.pdf]
    • [CARDS-52782]

    • [CARDS-52722]
      • The following menu items have been renamed:

OpenWay\WAY4 Datamart Interface\Objects mapping\Account Mapping Step by Step\Lock Datamart Mapping

OpenWay\WAY4 Datamart Interface\Objects mapping\Account Mapping Step by Step\Release DWH Mapping ->
OpenWay\WAY4 Datamart Interface\Objects mapping\Account Mapping Step by Step\Release Datamart Mapping

The OpenWay\WAY4 Datamart Interface menu branch is only provided to customers with the corresponding license.
See the "Upgrade Notes on Impact changes" section for more details.
      Upgrade Note:
      Old menu item names are not supported. If there are custom menu items using the standard menu items listed above, it is necessary to update link names for them. If link names are not updated, custom menu items will become invalid.
      Updated Manuals: Datamart | Datamart_WAY4_Settings.pdf
    • [CARDS-52803]
      • A new global parameter AUTH_AMOUNT_DIFF_PCNT_RETAIL has been added. The new parameter is used for all transactions except those with hotel, car rental or airline MCC codes, for which the existing parameter AUTH_AMOUNT_DIFF_PCNT is used. This parameter can set the maximum difference between authorization and financial presentment amounts as a percentage. If the difference is below this value, the whole blocked amount will be unblocked, otherwise only the financial amount will be unblocked.
      Upgrade Note:
      Starting with version 03.44, the algorithm for unblocking authorization amounts during financial document processing has been changed. A new global parameter AUTH_AMOUNT_DIFF_PCNT_RETAIL has been added that sets the maximum difference between authorization and financial presentment amounts as a percentage. If the difference is exceeds this value, when processing a financial document, the corresponding error message will be generated and the difference between the authorization amount and financial presentment amount will be blocked.
The parameter is used for all transactions, with the exception of transactions with several financial documents for one authorization (for example in the case of car rental, hotel reservations). The global parameter AUTH_AMOUNT_DIFF_PCNT is used for these exceptions.
The aforementioned behaviour impacts document processing in issuer systems. To restore previous system behaviour when the whole authorization amount was blocked, set the global parameter AUTH_AMOUNT_DIFF_PCNT_RETAIL a value allowing a 100% difference between authorization and financial presentment amounts.
      Updated Manuals: [core\Global_Parameters.pdf]
    • [CARDS-52809]
      • Fixed funds unblocking when multiple presentments for one authorization are posted in an order different from accept order.
    • [CARDS-52815]
      • Fixed lengthy execution of the approve process for related acquiring contracts.

    • [CARDS-52536]
      • The "Liab Category" field has been made available for editing in the Device Contract form.
On contract Approve, if the value in the "Liab Category" field from the Product and the value from the current contract are different, the corresponding message with the text "Switch Liability Category to <>" will be generated in the Process Log for this contract.
    • [CARDS-52732]
      • Due tolerance configuration is now supported in backdated payment processing in the Reversal Management module. Maximum tolerance supported period is 10 days. In common cases it is recommended to use backdated payments instead of due tolerance setup.
