    • [CARDS-52402]
      • Added the ability to search for cases by Contract Number in all case lists in the "Operations" menu for all Case Management categories.
    • [CARDS-52558]
      • By default, the posting date after the cut-off time on a device is set to the next working day based on the default calendar. 
A new feature has been added to redefine the calendar type: the "ACQ_CLNDR_TYPE" parameter defines a special type of acquiring calendar (Full - Configuration Setup - Main Tables - Calendar Types). If the parameter "ACQ_CLNDR_TYPE" is not set, the default calendar will be used. This feature is available only if the "ENABLES_SHIFT_DAY" global parameter is set.
    • [CARDS-52561]

    • [CARDS-52671]

    • [CARDS-52733]
      • The ability to postpone the first payment for an instalment plan up to a certain date has been added. This date should be specified as the value of the SHIFT_DATE tag in document tags, instalment scheme special parameters, or instalment tariff special parameters in YYMMDD format. The first payment will be scheduled according to instalment scheme date configuration but not earlier than the specified date.
      Updated Manuals: [instalment_management\WAY4_Instalments.pdf]

    • [CARDS-51064]
      • Liability contract hierarchy is supported in reversal management. To allow intelligent backdated processing for a contract with liability subcontracts, the STORNO_LIAB tag should be set in its product; in this case, the whole liability tree will be recalculated.

      • BIN record search on contract subtype validation now checks BIN record status. Active records have a higher priority for being selected than records that are inactive or closed. However, active BIN records with "Data Source" = Own have a lower priority than inactive or closed records from other sources.

If this configuration is used, please contact Customer Support for guidance.

This impacts user access grants for this menu - please review access to the corresponding menu branches in the "OpenWay\Full\DB Administrator Utilities\Users & Grants\User Groups and Users - Edit" form and provide access to this menu branch, if necessary. - calculation of "Sales - of which Electron" subsection in the transaction section has been supported.
- the sections "No. of terminals installed at merchants" and "Number of mPOS terminals installed at merchants" have been renamed to "No. of terminals active at merchants" and "Number of mPOS terminals active at merchants". These sections contain information about terminals on which at least one transaction was made during the report period.
      Updated Manuals: [visa_statistical_reports\quarterly_operating_certificates\VISA_Statistical_Reports.pdf]

    • [CARDS-52798]

    • [CARDS-52800]
      • Optimized getCardHolderVerificationMethodsReq query for VDEP.
    • [CARDS-52803]
      • A new global parameter AUTH_AMOUNT_DIFF_PCNT_RETAIL has been added. The new parameter is used for all transactions except those with hotel, car rental or airline MCC codes, for which the existing parameter AUTH_AMOUNT_DIFF_PCNT is used. This parameter can set the maximum difference between authorization and financial presentment amounts as a percentage. If the difference is below this value, the whole blocked amount will be unblocked, otherwise only the financial amount will be unblocked.
      Upgrade Note:
      Starting with version 03.44, the algorithm for unblocking authorization amounts during financial document processing has been changed. A new global parameter AUTH_AMOUNT_DIFF_PCNT_RETAIL has been added that sets the maximum difference between authorization and financial presentment amounts as a percentage. If the difference is exceeds this value, when processing a financial document, the corresponding error message will be generated and the difference between the authorization amount and financial presentment amount will be blocked.
The parameter is used for all transactions, with the exception of transactions with several financial documents for one authorization (for example in the case of car rental, hotel reservations). The global parameter AUTH_AMOUNT_DIFF_PCNT is used for these exceptions.
The aforementioned behaviour impacts document processing in issuer systems. To restore previous system behaviour when the whole authorization amount was blocked, set the global parameter AUTH_AMOUNT_DIFF_PCNT_RETAIL a value allowing a 100% difference between authorization and financial presentment amounts.
      Updated Manuals: [core\Global_Parameters.pdf]

      • Fixed funds unblocking when multiple presentments for one authorization are posted in an order different from accept order.

    • [CARDS-52181]
      • The DCC_CONTRACT tag is checked during Nostro contract approve; it should be the same for Main and Sub Nostro contracts. When searching for the DCC_CONTRACT tag in Nostro contracts, the tag is first searched for in the Sub Nostro contract, then in the Main Nostro contract, and then on the Nostro Account Scheme. Earlier, the DCC_CONTRACT tag value in the Main Nostro contract was not considered.
      Upgrade Note:
      Clients using Dynamic Currency Conversion (DCC) or Multi Currency Pricing (MCP/MCA) products must perform a check using CHECK_v1_CARDS-52181_dcc_contract_numbers.sql script validating the settings of DCC_CONTRACT tags in NOSTRO contracts. If the check returns a non-empty number of strings, a detailed check must be performed and the results of both checks must be sent to Customer Support.
      Updated Manuals: [dcc\DCC_Setup.pdf]

    • [I1703160402]/[CARDS-52474]
      • Product Inspector test script import has been modified when in the file being imported there are test scripts with the same codes that already exist in the destination WAY4Cards system. 
Previously, all test script steps already present in the destination database were deleted, which led to links being lost in comparing script results with the standard ones. This behaviour cannot be restored.
In the first step of the import procedure, all the existing test steps in the database are marked with the new status "Obsolete". In the second step, the system checks if the step number exists in the file being imported. If not, the step in the database is kept with the "Obsolete" status, otherwise the step gets a status and inherits other parameters from the file being imported. When a Product Inspector script is run, a step with the "Obsolete" status behaves the same way as a step with the "Skip" status.
      Upgrade Note:
      Product Inspector test script import has been modified when in the file being imported there are test scripts with the same codes that already exist in the destination WAY4Cards system. In the first step of the import procedure, all the existing test steps in the database are marked with the new status "Obsolete" (earlier steps were deleted). In the second step, the system checks if the step exists in the file being imported. If not, the step in the database is kept with the "Obsolete" status, otherwise the step gets a status and inherits other parameters from the file being imported. When a Product Inspector script is run, steps with the "Obsolete" status are processed the same way as  steps with the "Skip" status.
If a step with the "Obsolete" status isn't necessary, it is recommended to delete it from the Product Inspector script.
      Updated Manuals: [product_inspector\WAY4_Product_Inspector_Manual.pdf]
    • [I1703174475]/[CARDS-52501]
      • Unnecessary generation of "Invalid product changes" error message during Contracts Daily Update procedure has been fixed for contracts that do not have a product.
    • [I1703175143]/[CARDS-52525]
      • "CM Dispute Assistant" menu item distribution process has been fixed. Now it is uploaded to customers who have a license for Dispute Assistant functionality.
    • [I403199808]/[CARDS-52506]
      • Restored the original conditions (that were used before DA v2 was developed) to call DA v1.

  • 03.45.09.14
    • [CARDS-50086]
      • Added new variables %FDT_<DT_CODE>:[date format]% and %PAST_DUE_DATE:[deliquency group]:[date format]% for messages about contract dates. These variables can be used in client message setup for SMS Banking.
      Updated Manuals: [product_management\Client_Messages.pdf]
    • [CARDS-50541]
      • Renamed the "ConfGroup" button to "Mapping" in the form "OpenWay\Full\Configuration Setup\Common Handbooks\User Classifiers".
      Updated Manuals: [core\Contract_and_Client_Classifiers.pdf]
    • [CARDS-52237]
      • A new classifier "ACQ_LEVEL_MARKER" with the "ACQ_MERCHANTS" value has been added to the "OpenWay\WAY4 Datamart Interface\Configuration Groups" menu for the "DWH_CONF" group.

    • [CARDS-52280]
      • The internal procedure for creating a duplicate contract no longer "forces" approval of the contract if it was duplicated because it is linked with another contract, for example, in the case of combo-cards.
    • [CARDS-52290]
      • Added ability to enter INHERIT_LOST_CARD_EXPIRE=Y; in card subtype properties.
    • [CARDS-52299]
      • VDEP (Visa Digital Enablement Program) service API, including token creation and additional VDEP token information checking on authorization operations has been implemented.
    • [CARDS-52309]
      • Obsolete menu branch "InterSystem controller" has been removed from the standard OpenWay\Acquiring\ menu.
    • [CARDS-52310]
      • Copying a product to an existing product in another financial institution will not invalidate the parent product if only sub-products are changed. After copying, it is only necessary to approve sub-products, the version of the parent product and unaffected sub-products does not change.
      Updated Manuals: [product_management\Products_and_Subtypes.pdf]
    • [CARDS-52302]
      • Corrected loyalty action limit restriction if bonus service is configured for another contract using the CONTRACT_FOR tag.
    • [I1612046735]/[CARDS-52303]
      • For the "test script import" pipe, search for a CLIENT_TYPE value for the APPL_CLIENT.CLT tag has been modified, now only financial institution is checked.
    • [I1701270697]/[CARDS-52291]
      • Fixed incorrect currency conversion rate use in issuer authorization after return from Stand-in.
    • [I1702208476]/[CARDS-52312]
      • Added a new response type, "Transaction Confirmed", to "Safe Doc" forms.
    • [I1702225223]/[CARDS-52304]
      • The Approve procedure can be be called for sub-products. If the main product is not ready, Approve will be executed for the entire hierarchy; if the main product is ready, only the sub-product will be approved.
A new form has been added, OpenWay\Full\Configuration Setup\Products\Product Definition\Products (No Hierarchy), for viewing all products without hierarchy.
      Updated Manuals: [product_management\Products_and_Subtypes.pdf]
    • [CARDS-51495]
      • Reports XLS_CB_f250_1.rdf, XLS_CB_f250_2.rdf, XLS_CB_f250_3.rdf:
- Added count of contactless cards, transactions and devices.
- Supported consolidated report for all financial organization branches.
- Supported counting of cards with only 2 groups: debit/credit.
      Upgrade Note:
      Change in the logic of Reports XLS_CB_f250_1.rdf, XLS_CB_f250_2.rdf, XLS_CB_f250_3.rdf: the "SHOW_IN_250" tag will be automatically deleted from the "Add Info" field of the "DWD_CARD_CATEGORY" classifier in the "DWH_CONF" configuration group (OpenWay\WAY4 Datamart Interface\Configuration Groups).
      Updated Manuals: [rf_reporting\250\Form_250.pdf]

      • Added the ability to validate a cardholder's date of birth together with other security values. See documentation for details.

  • 03.45.09.13
    • [CARDS-51408]

    • [CARDS-52225]
      • A new action, "Set Billing Day", which allows the contract billing date to be changed, has been added for contracts in Product Inspector. The value should be specified in the "Action Code" field and can be in the range from 1 to 31.
      Updated Manuals: [product_inspector\WAY4_Product_Inspector_Manual.pdf]
    • [CARDS-52257]
      • "Instead orders" processing have been enhanced: sorting by the "priority" have been added.

    • [I1612121917]/[CARDS-51820]
      • "No Check" Auth scenario has been removed from forms as obsolete. The additional global parameter ENABLE_NO_CHECK is no longer supported.
      Upgrade Note:
      The additional global parameter ENABLE_NO_CHECK is no longer supported. It is not possible to create new products/contract with Auth scenario=No Check (existing contracts with Auth Scenario=No Check will be processed as See Main).
      Updated Manuals: [core\Global_Parameters.pdf] [product_management\Products_and_Subtypes.pdf]

  • 03.45.09.12
    • [CARDS-52115]
      • The closing operation has been added to e-commerce chains.
    • [CARDS-52118]
      • An e-commerce chain will be closed automatically when the period MULT_CAPT_PERIOD from the authorization date is over.
MULT_CAPT_PERIOD is set as a tag in Device_type.Emv_Conf_File.
    • [CARDS-51493]
      • New actions to recalculate contract functional dates have been added to the CSS screen OpenWay\Customer Service\Customer Service -> [Contr.Dates] form.

    • [CARDS-52064]
      • "Device Parm Ctrl" and "Merchant Management" additional info types are now supported in Advanced Applications R2 for contract additional information.

    • [CARDS-52112]
      • "OpenWay\Full\Configuration Setup\Accounting Setup\Bank Divisions",  "OpenWay\SEPA\Issuing Mandate Input & Update" and "OpenWay\SEPA\Acquiring Mandate Input & Update" menus now make it possible to set up Ultimate Creditor and Ultimate Debtor data.

    • [CARDS-52116]
      • SEPA Customer to Bank  Export: Changed criterion to select invoice party for Ultimate Creditor (UltmtCdtr) data element; now data with party type "UC" (Ultimate Creditor) is exported, earlier data with party type "BF" (Beneficiary) was used to populate this data element. See also CARDS-52112.
    • [CARDS-52124]
      • Instalments with "Monthly Interest" configuration have been simplified. The "Next Working Day" and "Previous Working Day" values are converted into a single value, "Split Interest". The split invoice effective date will no longer be shifted. At the end of the month, the dates of transfers generated by fee invoice opening will depend on the contract's Accounting Scheme EOM configuration.
      Upgrade Note:
      An Instalment Scheme's "Next Working Day" and "Previous Working Day" Monthly Interest field values  are converted into a single value, "Split Interest". An instalment's end of month interest transfer dates will depend on the Accounting Scheme's end of month configuration.
      Updated Manuals: [instalment_management\WAY4_Instalments.pdf]
    • [CARDS-52187]
      • Generation of unique transaction chain value stored in the PERS_NAME_REC document tag has been added to Product Inspector.
    • [CARDS-52197]
      • Data from field 112 have been parsed on Purchase token operation.
    • [CARDS-52226]

      • VISA VCF Export: added the "ACCOUNT_PREFIX" parameter to define the first symbols of accounts for special processing. Default value is "CH".
    • [CARDS-52190]
      • VISA VCF Export: added "REPORT_TO_LINK_T10" and "PARENT_LINK_T10" parameters which make it possible to override "REPORT_TO_LINK" and "PARENT_LINK" parameters for T10 records.
Added "TWO_LEVEL_STRUCTURE"="Y"/"N"(default) parameter. If "Y" it is allowed to set the parent link for card directly to a corporate contract.
    • [CARDS-52198]
      • Final tokenization decision tag has been added to TNK_ACTIVATION message.
    • [CARDS-52209]
      • Modified IC tariffs and RA configuration for all regions in accordance with VISA release requirement: 2.8 Changes to Private Label Transfer Pricing.
    • [CARDS-52234]
      • VISA Fee Prediction: Added Fee Program Areas for Visa Gold purchase and credit voucher transactions for Japan issuers.
      Upgrade Note:
      Visa will implement changes to interregional and AP regional fee structures that apply to Visa Gold transactions issued from Japan. Acquirers must support the changes to the fee programs that will be assessed on Visa Gold purchase and credit voucher transactions for Japan issuers. According to this release requirement acquirers must configure Fee Program Areas in the Standard Handbook manually: Handbook Type is FEE_PREDICTION__FEE_PROGRAM_AREA, for Filter1 values "1","B","C","E","F" Name must be "Interregional" and Code must be "JPN". Furthermore, acquirers in the AP region must add an extra record in the Standard Handbook: Handbook Type is FEE_PREDICTION__FEE_PROGRAM_AREA, for Filter1 value "A" Name must be "Intra-AP" and Code must be "JPN".
      Updated Manuals: [visa_interface\20XX_XX_VISA_Requirements.pdf]
    • [I1610204653]/[CARDS-52179]
      • IC tariffs have been modified for the United Kingdom in accordance with MasterCard Interchange Bulletin No. 40, 14 October 2016.
    • [I1611068909]/[CARDS-51671]
      • IC tariffs have been modified for Ireland in accordance with MasterCard Interchange Bulletin No. 22, 2 November 2016.
  • 03.45.09.11
    • [CARDS-51138]
      • When a contract is created or attached with same IDT as another contract in a Product Inspector test script, a numerical suffix will be added to its IDT to stop duplicate IDTs from appearing in the Product Inspector log.
      Updated Manuals: [product_inspector\WAY4_Product_Inspector_Manual.pdf]
    • [CARDS-51755]
      • An instalment fee configured as a "Portion fee" will now be taken in the full amount for one portion on full early repayment. On partial repayment no fee is taken.
      Updated Manuals: [instalment_management\WAY4_Instalments.pdf]
    • [CARDS-51888]
      • A new form, "Mp Payment Scheme Member BINs" has been created for the new table, mp_ps_member_bin; a link to "Mp Payment Scheme Member BINs" has been added to the "Mp Payment Scheme Identification" form.

      • A new value, "Year", has been added to limiter period types for usage limiter templates.

    • [CARDS-52132]
      • The "Usage Template Details" form has been redesigned.
      Updated Manuals: [product_management\Usage_Limiters.pdf]
    • [CARDS-52158]
      • The KEEP_CONTRACT_ID tag is set in a Misc Service (Service Details) or transaction subtype (Fee Algorithm).
When a Misc document is created, the contract identifier is specified in add_info.
      Updated Manuals: [tags description]
    • [CARDS-51716]
      • Fixed behaviour. All error and warning messages that are inserted while processing rejected authorizations transferred from Secondary to Primary get the "Error Info" and "Warning Info" message types. If the original authorization was successful in Secondary, the message type remains "Error" or "Warning".
    • [CARDS-52022]
      • Fixed incorrect processing of usage limiters with the SingleSliding period type when the limiter's period was not defined for a particular contract with an application or manually. Without this additional determination, the limiter is not analyzed.
      Upgrade Note:
      Fixed incorrect processing of usage limiters with the SingleSliding period type when the limiter's period was not defined for a particular contract. 
It is necessary to run the following query to check if this problem ever occurred:

select count(*) from usage_templ where limit_renew_type='s' and amnd_state = 'A';

If this query returns a non-zero value, contact Customer Support for further instructions.
    • [CARDS-52093]
      • Fixed "Failed to calculate DP routing, use default routing" warning for Authentication Server Context operations.
    • [CARDS-52111]
      • Fixed incorrect authorisation document replication processing which led to inconsistency of data between primary and secondary nodes.
    • [CARDS-52133]
      • Instalment Event = "Plan Closed", according to which an Instalment Event Fee is charged is no longer generated when an instalment plan in preview or inactive status is closed.
    • [CARDS-52142]
      • Error using three delimiters ('|') instead of two when answering TAR messages during MDES transactions has been fixed.
    • [CARDS-52152]
      • The "Attachment" value has been removed from the "For contracts" list of available values for Service Packages. Additional Service Packages should be used for ATTACHMENT services.
      Upgrade Note:
      On system upgrade, the value For Contracts = "Attachment" in Service Package settings will automatically be replaced with For Contracts = "Additional". System behaviour is not affected.
      Updated Manuals: [product_management\Service_Packages.pdf]
    • [CARDS-52153]
      • Filter for standard Timezone Contract Daily Update (CDU) menu items has been changed; now the liab_category field is used instead of liab_contract.
    • [CARDS-52154]
      • User must change password if it was reset by admin and parameter DEF_PW_CHANGE is set to Y.
    • [CARDS-52155]
      • Fixed issue. Now in Product Inspector test scripts, the case domain set in the "Set Domain" step is not used for cases created by an event.
      Updated Manuals: [product_inspector\WAY4_Product_Inspector_Manual.pdf]
    • [CARDS-52160]
      • Description of mp_etl_parm for parameter with value_type = 'GATHER' and scope 'STAT' in mp_etl_parm has been changed.
    • [CARDS-52164]
      • Display of balance amounts after performing the balance prediction procedure has been corrected in WAY4 Web. Cache clearing has been added.
    • [I1702196631]/[CARDS-52141]
      • Fixed amount calculation for standing orders with the BY_BATCH tag; now zero amount orders are not recalculated based on account balance.
      Upgrade Note:
      Behaviour of standing orders with BY_BATCH tag has changed. Orders with "Order Type" different than "Debit Amount" and "Credit Amount" will not generate any transfers. Earlier these orders generated transfers based on account balance ignoring batch processing.
Configuration should be checked and if such orders are used, reconfiguration should be made. Either the BY_BATCH tag should be removed from the order or the Order Type should be changed to "Debit Amount" or "Credit Amount" depending on business requirements.
    • [CARDS-52048]
      • DA v2: Supported processing of a duplicate secondary document if is matched with an original document.
    • [CARDS-52080]
      • The TAR response code for VISA authorizations has been changed from 5 to the real response code of the transaction.
    • [CARDS-52084]
      • MasterCard CDF Export: Added the ability to customize the StatusCode field for the CorporateInformation_4000 and AccountInformation_4300 aggregates.
    • [CARDS-52104]
      • VDEP Active account management velocity checking result and Device identifier tags have been added to document.
    • [CARDS-52123]
      • MasterCard IRD Calculation: Base IRD Configuration now uses native DE22, PDS0023 and PDS0052 values to define IRD specification.
    • [I1612120086]/[CARDS-51705]

    • [CARDS-51948]
      • Special instalment options can be configured for our card transactions made on a partner's devices acquired in different banks. Partner is identified by a pair of Member ID and Merchant IDs which should be configured in the Instalment Partners handbook. Special configuration of a service is also required.

      opt_classify has been changed and should be merged if previously customised.
    • [CARDS-52018]
      • Tokenization activation code stored under a document has been masked.
    • [CARDS-52049]
      • The CURRENT_CYCLE tag is supported for all Functional Dates.

    • [CARDS-52075]
      • "Currency", "Available", "Blocked", "Credit limit" fields have been added to the "OpenWay\Customer Service\Customer Service-> [Related] form.
    • [CARDS-52083]
      • Added the ability to perform early repayment of an instalment transaction. The Service should be configured with the INVOICE_ACTION=EARLY_REPAYMENT tag in service details. The document's additional data field can contain the INST_PLAN_IDT tag with the idt of the instalment plan for which early repayment is being performed. If no tag is present in the document, all instalment plans will be paid one by one in the order of creation. Early repayment keep mode can be specified using the INST_ER_KEEP tag with the values "T" - keep tenor, "P" - keep portion amount.
      Updated Manuals: [instalment_management\WAY4_Instalments.pdf]
    • [CARDS-52085]
      • In order to make housekeeping for Cases -
 relations between CM_CASE_ACTIV and CM_CASE_OBJ are switched off for the Housekeeping process in the standard Housekeeping setting. "Import Standard Settings" must be performed after upgrade.
    • [I1503163267]/[CARDS-52030]
      • Added the ability to log missing ATC values to a document's additional information. A new global parameter, LOG_MISSING_ATC_TO_DOC=Y activates this feature.
      Updated Manuals: [core\Global_Parameters.pdf] [tags description]
    • [CARDS-50195]
      • In the "Outgoing Files Logic.srd", "Outgoing Files Resp.srd", and "Outgoing Files.srd" forms, the "Sended By" label has been changed to "Sent by". In the "Incoming Files Logic.srd" and "Incoming Files.srd" forms, the "Received By" label has been changed to "Received by".

      • Supported creation of COMBO_Cards by applications.
    • [CARDS-52022]
      • Fixed incorrect processing of usage limiters with the SingleSliding period type when the limiter's period was not defined for a particular contract with an application or manually. Without this additional determination, the limiter is not analyzed.
      Upgrade Note:
      Fixed incorrect processing of usage limiters with the SingleSliding period type when the limiter's period was not defined for a particular contract. 
It is necessary to run the following query to check if this problem ever occurred:

select count(*) from usage_templ where limit_renew_type='s' and amnd_state = 'A';

If this query returns a non-zero value, contact Customer Support for further instructions.
    • [CARDS-52074]
      • Fixed incorrect inheritance of the return code from an original document when a repeat message is received.
    • [CARDS-52111]
      • Fixed incorrect authorisation document replication processing which led to inconsistency of data between primary and secondary nodes.
    • [I1610314143]/[CARDS-52065]
      • Optimized "Contract" tab performance in the Case Details screen.
    • [I1611079238]/[CARDS-51706]
      • Union Pay Inward Processing: Fixed Settlement S2 level amounts. Union Pay Audit Trailer Import: Added Settlement S2 level for Reimbursement Fees. Manual Action: adding message types for S2 level Reimbursement Fees.
      Upgrade Note:
      New message types must be added (Full/Configuration Setup/Transaction Types/Message Types - All): 
Acq Reimb Fee Detail Online (Code S2-AF---0, Trans type "Acq Reimb Fee Detail"),
Acq Reimb Fee Detail Batch (Code S2-AF---1, Trans type "Acq Reimb Fee Detail"),
Acq Reimb Fee Detail Total Dispute and manual (Code S2-AF---2, Trans type "Acq Reimb Fee Detail"),
Iss Reimb Fee Detail Online (Code S2-IF---0, Trans type "Iss Reimb Fee Detail"),
Iss Reimb Fee Detail Batch (Code S2-IF---1, Trans type "Iss Reimb Fee Detail"),
Iss Reimb Fee Detail Total Dispute and manual (Code S2-IF---2.Trans type "Iss Reimb Fee Detail").

      • The error "Incoming TransCondition does not correspond to TransAttributes" is interpreted as a warning in acquiring.
    • [CARDS-52046]
      • VISA Enhanced Acquirer Capture File Import pipe: added filling doc.settlement_amount and currency with Original Price Amount and Original Price Currency Code values from incoming file for DCC transactions.

      • IC tariffs have been modified for the Czech Republic in accordance with MasterCard Interchange Bulletin No. 1, 2017.
    • [CARDS-52080]
      • The TAR response code for VISA authorizations has been changed from 5 to the real response code of the transaction.
    • [CARDS-52084]

    • [CARDS-52104]

      • SRC_FX_TRF/TGT_FX_TRF tags are now always written into macrotransaction additional information, when the corresponding FX tariffs were used for macrotransaction Source/Target amount calculation accordingly.
    • [CARDS-51710]
      • The BILLING_DAY contract parameter has now the highest priority for calculating Billing Date for Monthly billing.

    • [CARDS-51839]
      • Validation for billing interval type in Account Scheme and in Date Scheme has been added.
      Updated Manuals: [product_management\Functional_Dates.pdf]
    • [CARDS-51868]
      • Fixed incorrect document applying in an HA solution primary node when original processing did not modify static data.
    • [CARDS-51926]
      • UPI Audit Trailer Import: Fixed file name processing.
    • [CARDS-51928]
      • Corrected PVV data format in 0302 message for VISA.
    • [CARDS-51960]
      • Country Table: Revised record for Madagascar. Code (3 bytes) must be "MDG", Code (2 bytes) must be "MG", Code (Numeric) must be "450", Curr Name must be "MALAGASY ARIARY", Curr Code must be "MGA", N Curr Code must be "969". No impact on transaction processing.
      Upgrade Note:
      Open form "Country Table" (menu item "OpenWay\Full\Configuration Setup\Main Tables\Country Table") and check that the record for Madagascar has the following values: Code (3 bytes) must be "MDG", Code (2 bytes) must be "MG", Code (Numeric) must be "450", Curr Name must be "MALAGASY ARIARY", Curr Code must be "MGA", N Curr Code must be "969".
    • [CARDS-51965]
      • Instalment fee code is now taken from an Instalment Scheme even if the fee rate is passed in document tags. Previous system behaviour was to use "FEE" as a fee code value regardless of Instalment Scheme settings.
      Upgrade Note:
      Changed the procedure for generating fee invoice records for instalment plan fees when the fee percentage or amount is passed in document tags. Earlier these records were created with the "FEE" debt code (this value corresponds to the Invoice Events - Fee Code setting). Now the debt code is taken from instalment scheme fee parameters depending on the Calc Scheme.
If an Instalment Scheme contains several fees with the same Calc Scheme, debt code will be taken from the first one. If no fees are configured in the Instalment Scheme, or debt code is not specified for the corresponding fee, the "FEE" value will be used as earlier.
      Updated Manuals: [instalment_management\WAY4_Instalments.pdf]
    • [CARDS-51981]
      • Problem with setting version attribute and INT_TRF tag for an Accounting Scheme has been corrected in situations when there are no contracts and normalization orders for this scheme.
    • [CARDS-51983]
      • TMID value is inherited from the original document when a secondary document is posted in routing transit authorisation messages.
    • [I1701163750]/[CARDS-51967]
      • Changed BIN routing search for P2P transactions from cards to accounts.
    • [I1701242974]/[CARDS-51980]
      • Corrected contract status check - no reversals are allowed for a closed contract even if there is a valid contract status with code 14.
    • [I1702012564]/[CARDS-51961]
      • MasterCard MPE Import: excluded the IP0036T1 table from checking for presence.

    • [CARDS-51920]
      • Set the "Final Write-Off Amounts" amount type group for the "Create Final Write-Off" activity.
    • [CARDS-51922]
      • Liab Contract link has been added to the OpenWay\Full\Configuration Setup\Accounting Setup\Bank Accounting Contracts form.
    • [CARDS-51929]
      • "Service Card PIN Management" and "Service Card Send / Receive Production Batches" links have been added to the "OpenWay\Acquiring" menu branch.
      Upgrade Note:
      New functionality has been added to the "OpenWay \ Acquiring" menu branch (new menu branches "Service Card PIN Management" and "Service Card Send / Receive Production Batches"). Make sure users who have full access to this branch really should have the right to mark and issue service cards. If necessary, create the correct custom menu branches and update user rights.
      Updated Manuals: [acquiring\user_manuals\Acquiring_Module.pdf]
    • [CARDS-51689]
      • MIN_BILLING parameter default behaviour has been changed.
      Upgrade Note:
      The behaviour of the MIN_BILLING parameter has changed. This parameter is set as a tag value in days in an Accounting Scheme or as the Min Billing parameter in Billing Scheme tariffs.
Earlier it was necessary to set value to one day less than the required minimum length of a billing cycle. For example, to limit the minimum length of a cycle to 28 days it was necessary to set MIN_BILLING=27. Now the actual value, MIN_BILLING=28 must be set. Accordingly, the parameter's behaviour now corresponds to documentation.
The change only affects values set as days. Values set in months do not have this problem.
If a client's configuration uses the MIN_BILLING parameter in Accounting Schemes or in Billing Scheme tariffs, the preliminary phase of upgrade will show a message that a problematic configuration exists. Additional details can be found in Process Messages.
In this case, it is necessary to analyse if a shift of minus one day was used in existing settings. If so, the value must be corrected by adding one day.
Values should be corrected after the upgrade process is finished but before the first Contract Daily Update process.
For more information, contact WAY4 support.
    • [CARDS-51725]
      • To copy a Billing Date from the top contract to Sub-liab contracts when the Billing Date is recalculated for the top contract, the tag value RECALC_BILLING=COPY_TO_LIAB_SUBS; should be used.
      Updated Manuals: [product_management\Functional_Dates.pdf]

  • 03.44.99.14
    • [CARDS-50363]
      • Added a new configuration group with the "LIMIT" code (OpenWay\WAY4 Datamart Interface\Configuration Groups) for all classifiers related to DWF_CONTRACT_LIMIT mapping.
      Upgrade Note:
      A new configuration group with the "LIMIT" code has been added to OpenWay\Datamart\Report Representation Group\Configuration Groups\Configuration Groups. A new classifier
with the "DWF_CONTRACT_LIMIT" code has been automatically added to the "LIMIT" configuration group.
It is highly recommended to move the following classifiers to the new "LIMIT" group by loading DWH_HOME\db\scripts\oracle\dwh\opt_cards_objects\HEAD\client\datam\DWH_SY_CONF_GROUP_ENG.TXT file with the Copy Configuration tool:
CURRENT_LIMIT_AMOUNT_CODE (Usage Limiter Codes to be loaded into DWF_CONTRACT_LIMIT fact)
CONTRACT_AMOUNT_CODE (Current values used to limit contract financial operations from acnt_contract to be loaded into DWF_CONTRACT_LIMIT fact)
CONTRACT_AMOUNT_PRODUCT (List of products for enforcing calculation of a contract limit amount with the acnt_api.ACNT_BAL function to be loaded into DWF_CONTRACT_LIMIT fact)
ACNT_BALANCE_CODE (Current values used to limit contract financial operations from acnt_balance table to be loaded into DWF_CONTRACT_LIMIT fact)
DWF_CONTRACT_LIMIT (Limits current value)
    • [CARDS-50719]
      • Issuer scripts creation is supported for cards permanently working in a secondary node.
    • [CARDS-51721]
      • A new Tariff Role, "Conversion" has been supported to define FX Rate markup. These tariffs are used in multi-currency acquiring Products to support an acquirer conversion margin over the bank's internal or external FX rates and merchant reimbursement in a currency other than the transaction settlement currency.
      Upgrade Note:
      During the upgrade process, the global parameter USE_FX_TARIFF_ROLE=N; will be set if FX Rate markup (FX_TARIFF) configurations configured with tariffs set in Services are present in the system. After upgrade and after the corresponding updates to external systems exporting rate values for their subsequent import to WAY4 Cards, the procedure for changing tariff role settings must be run using the new menu item OpenWay\Full\DB Administrator Utilities\Special OpenWay Utilities\Tariff Switch FX Tariff Role. 
The procedure can be run in the following modes:
 - "Check only" - check only, data will not be updated.
 - "Check and Update" - all checks and changes to the data of active tariffs set in Services and tariff types (tariff_group) are made, and the USE_FX_TARIFF_ROLE parameter will be given the "Y" value as a result.
      Updated Manuals: [tags description] [tariff_management\Tariff_Management.pdf]

    • [CARDS-49605]
      • Card Member ID is sent to the controller depending on Target ONUS criteria: if the Target channel is not ONUS, send_member_id, otherwise target_member_id.

    • [CARDS-51001]
      • It is possible to create Tokens in Stand-In mode.
      Updated Manuals: [ultimate_ha\distributed processing\Distributed_Processing_setup.pdf]
    • [CARDS-51097]
      • Tariff personalization forms have been enhanced. A separate form, "Tariff By Contract" that can be viewed at OpenWay\Tariffs\Tariff for Contracts (Edit Personal) - Active Trf shows contract tariffs that are available for personalization and makes it possible to personalize the product/template tariff or to restore the default value. Personalization can be performed by defining new tariff values, all other data is copied from the template/global tariff with the same "Tariff Code Ext" value.
      Updated Manuals: [tariff_management\Tariff_Management.pdf]
    • [CARDS-51205]
      • Trace information for calculated contract parameters calculation has been added.
    • [CARDS-51411]
      • Added the ability to process instalment daily interest accrual. To enable the feature, instalment fee codes that need daily interest accrual should be specified in the INST_DAILY_INTEREST_CODES global parameter (can be redefined in the financial institution), and invoice events to make financial transfers should be configured.
      Upgrade Note:
      In previous behaviour, the procedure instl.DAILY_INTEREST_FC called from the custom procedure cust_eod_before was used in accrual of instalment loan interest. Now the procedure is called from the standard INSTL package. It is necessary to exclude calls of  instl.DAILY_INTEREST_FC from the custom procedure and configure the global parameter INST_DAILY_INTEREST_CODES with a list of "Fee Code" codes from the form for configuring "Invoice Events" responsible for daily accrual of interest.
      Updated Manuals: [instalment_management\WAY4_Instalments.pdf]
    • [CARDS-51477]
      • The same Result Event can now be a trigger for any change of classifier value.
      Updated Manuals: [core\Contract_and_Client_Classifiers.pdf] [tags description]
    • [CARDS-51511]
      • Instalment plan recalculation is now automatically called when contract Billing Date or Due Date is changed.
      Updated Manuals: [instalment_management\WAY4_Instalments.pdf]
    • [CARDS-51521]
      • Advanced Applications R2: is is now possible to activate a Preview instalment plan and to cancel early repayment.
      Updated Manuals: [application_management\r2\Advanced_Applications_R2_Module.pdf] [application_management\r2\CBS_XML_Applications_R2.pdf]
    • [CARDS-51540]
      • It is now possible to call a notification event several days before a regular fee is charged.
      Updated Manuals: [tags description] [product_management\Events.pdf] [product_management\Service_Packages.pdf] [transaction_management\Documents.pdf]
    • [CARDS-51553]
      • Ability to use some client attributes as contract parameters without their registration has been implemented. For example CLIENT.COMPANY_NAME or CLIENT.AGE can now be used as IF_PARM tag values.
      Updated Manuals: [core\Contract_and_Client_Classifiers.pdf] [product_management\Client_Messages.pdf] [product_management\Events.pdf] [product_management\Service_Packages.pdf]
    • [CARDS-51578]
      • The "Delete File" button to delete a case object has been added to the "Files" tab of the case details screen.
      Updated Manuals: [case_management\Case_Management_Configuration.pdf]
    • [CARDS-51604]
      • Simulated instalment plan save mode has been added. Plans can be saved in full mode ("F" - default), partial ("P"), minimum ("M"), or not saved at all ("N"). Save mode is determined by the INST_SIM_SAVE global parameter which can be redefined by the same tag in Service special parameters.
      Updated Manuals: [core\Global_Parameters.pdf] [instalment_management\WAY4_Instalments.pdf] [tags description]
    • [CARDS-51642]
      • The ("Custom" = "?") value has been added for Charge Event and Event Order domains for use in Fee Types and Standing Orders forms.
      Updated Manuals: [product_management\Standing_Orders.pdf] [transaction_management\Documents.pdf]
    • [I1504289193, I1505264242]/[CARDS-51640]
      • The "Active Tariffs" form in OpenWay\Tariffs\Tariff for Contracts (Edit Personal) - Active Trf has been enhanced. Tariffs specified in the account scheme, account templates, services, standing orders and date schemes are shown with the "Yes" value in the "Used In Cfg" field of the form.
      Updated Manuals: [tariff_management\Tariff_Management.pdf]
    • [I1510305116]/[CARDS-48831]
      • Product Inspector: Supported creation of Final (Second) Chargeback for Dispute Assistant v2.
    • [I1611302204]/[CARDS-51502]
      • The error message "Invalid contract hierarchy" will appear during the Contracts Daily Update procedure and contract closure process to avoid an infinite loop when a contract is linked to itself as the parent contract.
    • [I1612147610]/[CARDS-51483]
      • The "Duplicate with Data" activity is now available for tariff subdomains. The result of "Duplicate with Data" is that all "Is Ready" status tariff data values are duplicated in the same "Is Ready" status.
      Updated Manuals: [tariff_management\Tariff_Management.pdf]
    • [CARDS-50923]
      • Default acquiring product configurations have been added to the standard configuration.
    • [CARDS-51277]
      • Mirroring to Classifier for contract parameters with "Location of Current Vvalue" = Client configuration has been fixed.
      Updated Manuals: [core\Contract_and_Client_Classifiers.pdf]
    • [CARDS-51435]
      • Fixed incorrect "PIN change" processing on TS IRouter when request to an external system is required.
    • [CARDS-51449]
      • Added sorting by ID for application action logging in PI test results.
    • [CARDS-51452]
      • Added deferred authorisation processing to financial document accept procedure.
    • [CARDS-51486]
      • Additional validation for global tariff data input has been added. When "Start Date" is not specified, the ability to set the tariff from the current banking date will be validated. When it is prohibited, the error message "Tariff Start Date Missing" will be returned.
      Upgrade Note:
      When importing global tariffs with an empty start date through the Tariff Import and Tariff Domains pipes, the error "Global Tariff cannot be applied from current date" will be returned. To import a global tariff with an empty start date and approve it with the current banking date, "ANY_DATE" must be set for the pipes' DATE_CHECK_MODE parameter.
    • [CARDS-51487]
      • For the "Merchant Contract Statement" report, parameter values (P_DATE_FROM; P_DATE_TO; P_ZIP_CODE; P_REPTYPE; P_SQL_TRACE; P_F_I; P_ID) can be set directly without local_constants. If these parameters are not set, values from local_constants will be used.
    • [CARDS-51489]
      • MasterCard CDF Export. Enhanced customization.
    • [CARDS-51492]
      • Transaction Processing: Added checking of Service Code 702 for AMEX.
    • [CARDS-51496]
      • Now we collect multiple authorizations for one presentment only if ps_ref_number (TREF) are equal.
    • [CARDS-51504]
      • A new form, Acnt Saved Limits.srd has been added to show MIN/MAX values for balances with the SAVE_LIMITS tag.
      Updated Manuals: [core\Balance_types.pdf]
    • [CARDS-51517]
      • Amounts for reversal and adjustment operations in report "Cardholder Account Statement" have now been changed: amounts of these operations are similar to the amounts of Cardholder Contract Statement report.
    • [CARDS-51530]
      • VISA Enhanced Acquirer Capture File: fixed doc.MERCHANT_ID filling. This field is filled only from the TCR1 record of the file being imported.
    • [CARDS-51533]
      • NSPK SIOM Outward: fixed Oracle grants for Clerk role.
    • [CARDS-51535]
      • Changing of hardcoded balances for contracts has been optimised.
    • [CARDS-51549]
      • Duplication of Response Code in Voice Authorisation Response messages has been fixed.
    • [CARDS-51563]
      • Ability to change the CUP Channel name letter has been implemented.
    • [CARDS-51569]
      • Non tariff-dependent conditions for usage limiters with tariffs are checked before tariff search to minimize database load.
    • [CARDS-51571]
      • Fixed calculation of the "PS_ISS_INT_PRODUCT_NAME" statistic parameter.
    • [CARDS-51572]
      • NSPK Outward Processing: fixed ARN recalculation for Adjustments, when an Adjustment has the same date as original transaction.
    • [CARDS-51579]
      • JCB Variable Outward: fixed ARN field 31 subfield 2 filling. Now it matches PDE3901.2. Removed DE14 filling for non ICC transactions.
    • [CARDS-51580]
      • Fixed calculation of the "Account Balance" section in the "AMEX Statistics Issuing Business" report.
    • [CARDS-51586]
      • IRouter: Removed unnecessary incorrect PIN tries processing in routing contract.
    • [CARDS-51592]
      • Processing of the default Service (with id=0) for correct representation of "%SERVICE$..." variables has been added.
    • [CARDS-51629]
      • The error message "History mode can not be empty" has been modified to the warning message "History mode may be required" when approving a Service Package.
      Updated Manuals: [core\Balance_types.pdf]
    • [CARDS-51647]
      • Overdue substate restore procedure has been fixed for invoice payment reject.
    • [I1509142952]/[CARDS-51531]
      • IC Documents Export, IC Documents Import. The "EXCLUDE_TAGS" parameter has been added to IC Documents Export, IC Documents Import pipes, making it possible to exclude export/import of the specified tags from/to doc.add_info.
    • [I1611104436]/[CARDS-51596]
      • Increased the precision of reading FX rates for macrotransactions to 12 digits for use in screen forms and reports.
    • [I1611117990]/[CARDS-51595]
      • Fixed fee collection processing if both source and target BINs have the CAN_BE_ONUS tag.
    • [I1611305517]/[CARDS-51501]
      • Interchange tariffs have been modified for EU (Intra-Western) in accordance with MasterCard Interchange Manual.
    • [I1611305656]/[CARDS-51348]
      • Product Inspector test script import has been modified when in the file being imported there are test scripts with codes that already exist: a UI dialog is displayed to confirm the script update. If script update is chosen, all the existing test steps will be deleted and the new one rewritten. This dialog window appears only if the pipe's SILENT mode parameter is switched off.
      Upgrade Note:
      Test script import has been modified. When the file being imported contains scripts with the same codes as those already in the database, and the user confirmed update, the old behaviour was to merge data: script steps from the file being imported whose numbers matched those already in the database were rewritten, and all other steps in the database (if any) remained unchanged. The new behaviour allows users to repeat confirmation of the need to update the script and old steps are totally deleted before writing new data from the file.
      Updated Manuals: [product_inspector\WAY4_Product_Inspector_Manual.pdf]
    • [I1612200174]/[CARDS-51505]
      • MasterCard IPM Outward: Now we don't send DE54 Cashback amount in chargebacks.
    • [I1612293501]/[CARDS-51620]
      • Incorrect PostingStatus values are no longer assigned to documents moved from a secondary HA node when deferred processing takes these records in a different order than the original one.
    • [CARDS-51481]
      • JCB ISO Outward (variable): added the "EXT_CURR_EXP" parameter for changing the currency exponent on transaction export.
      Upgrade Note:
      JCB ISO Outward (variable): added the "EXT_CURR_EXP" parameter for changing the currency exponent on transaction export. Parameter format: EXT_CURR_EXP = <3_digit_currency><1_digit_exponent_to_be_used>. This parameter can be used if the currency exponent in WAY4 differs from the JCB currency exponent.
For example EXT_CURR_EXP = 7040 (use 0 exponent for VND currency).
    • [CARDS-51561]
      • MasterCard Release 17.Q2 Global 594: Supported loading the Payment Account Reference field of an ADDR message to the document tag PAR.
    • [CARDS-51576]
      • RA configuration has been modified for Great Britain and the Czech Republic.
    • [CARDS-51581]
      • MasterCard CDF Export: Supported merging documents for Financial Adjustment Records.
    • [CARDS-51631]
      • IPS Product Definition: Changed name for VISA product "X" from "Reserved" to "B2B Virtual Payments".
    • [CARDS-51658]
      • MasterCard NSPK Outward: From 28.02.2017, the pipe will fill PDS0765 for MoneySend Payment Transactions.
    • [I1511020079]/[CARDS-49191]
      • AMEX: supported functionality to reverse outgoing AMEX GFSG files.
    • [I1612198860]/[CARDS-51583]
      • P2P data validation rules required for IPS channels will also be validated for affiliate channels if the card BIN group channel is defined as an IPS channel.
    • [ID901121006]/[CARDS-51526]
      • AMEX GNS Inward and Outward: Supported Contactless and Wallet transactions.

DB Kernel

  • 03.45.29.11
    • [DBK-2692]
      • The ability has been added to migrate HA services between nodes in force mode.
      Updated Manuals: [db_kernel\db_replication\DB_Replication_Monitoring.pdf] [ultimate_ha\distributed processing\Distributed_Processing_operation.pdf]
    • [DBK-2649]
      • Secondary node detach process cannot be started if all data has not been synchronized to the Primary node.
    • [DBK-2697]
      • Checking W4Web components privileges has been changes. See manuals.
      Updated Manuals: [W4W\doc\Web_Client\Language\System_Core\Officers_and_Grants.pdf]
    • [DBK-2712]
      • Added an additional check during synch process start to check that the node is attached.
    • [DBK-2090]
      • Fixed WAY4R latency calculation if the time was out of synch in the source and the destination node.
    • [DBK-2644]
      • All java classes running within Oracle JVM will be recompiled in order to avoid internal Oracle JVM exceptions.
      Upgrade Note:
      The offline phase of upgrade may last longer than usual due to recompilation of all java classes running within Oracle JVM.
    • [DBK-2719]
      • Fixed: HA support for SAF in TS.
  • 03.45.19.17
    • [DBK-2644]
      • All java classes running within Oracle JVM will be recompiled in order to avoid internal Oracle JVM exceptions.
      Upgrade Note:
      The offline phase of upgrade may last longer than usual due to recompilation of all java classes running within Oracle JVM.
  • 03.45.19.15
    • [DBK-1766]
      • Eliminated deadlocks in W4R.Apply sy_proc_aux.
    • [DBK-1945]
      • Fixed TRACEFILE_IDENTIFIER process parameter.  It now works correctly with parallel jobs.
    • [DBK-2624]
      • "Upgrade the Online1 Node"  procedure now requires using Forced switch, as described in section "Emergency Mode" for HA-Switch Solution.
      Upgrade Note:
      Upgrade process for online nodes of a full HA-Switch solution has changed.
Please check HA-Switch Operation manual, section "Upgrading the Online1 Node", step 9.
      Updated Manuals: [ultimate_ha\ha_switch\HA_Switch_operation.pdf]

UFX Core

  • 2.2.16-0005
    • [UFX-278]
      • Upgrade Note:
      WAY4Gate, TS SOA UFX and various UFX export pipes now validate certain database table fields to have correct value (one of the enumerated values supported by WAY4Cards). This applies to the following fields: standing_order.is_active, acnt_contract.production_status, acnt_contract.check_usage.
If a custom value is encountered in any of these fields, an error will be raised.
  • 2.2.14-0003
    • [UFX-363]
      • The Tariff Import pipe now supports importing a subdomain without its parent domain.
    • [UFX-359]
      • XML Applications Overall Response pipe behavior has been aligned with the manual: extension is padded with zeros to be exactly three digits long.
      Upgrade Note:
      XML Applications Overall Response pipe has changed the naming of output files. Now extension is padded with zeros to be exactly three digits long. Previously is was never padded. There is no way to restore previous behavior.
If there are automated processes consuming files written by XML Applications Overall Response pipe, please make sure that they can correctly handle files with new naming (with zero-padded extension).

WAY4 Manager

Check Scripts Grouped by Products

There are following types of non-upgrade scripts: preliminary scripts (scripts show if customer has configuration or data, which will be impacted on new version), diagnostic scripts (scripts collect some configuration/data statistics).

File location: in the folder "<NEW_OWS_HOME>\db\scripts\oracle\check\checkdata\".

The command string should be used to run scripts. Two ways are supported:

1. Run all scripts:

<NEW_OWS_HOME>\db\ssp4.bat connect=<Owner>/<Password>@<HOST>:<PORT>:<SID> <NEW_OWS_HOME>\db\scripts\oracle\check\checkdata.ss4 <Log_Folder>

2. Run scripts related to one task (for example scripts for task CARDS-12345):

<NEW_OWS_HOME>\db\ssp4.bat connect=<Owner>/<Password>@<HOST>:<PORT>:<SID> <NEW_OWS_HOME>\db\scripts\oracle\check\checkdata.ss4 <Log_Folder> "CARDS-12345"

, where <NEW_OWS_HOME> - path to new OWS_HOME;

<Owner>/<Password>@<HOST>:<PORT>:<SID> - connection string to current WAY4 version (before upgrade installation) under Owner user;

<Log_Folder> - folder with scripts results and their logging.

Example:

C:\03_47_30_00\db\ssp4.bat connect=MyOwner/MyPassword@111.11.11.111:1521:orcl C:\03_47_30_00\\db\scripts\oracle\check\checkdata.ss4 C:\temp\check_script_res_47\

Case management

  • [I1804119098]/[CARDS-57800]
    • Added a check that the CODE field has been filled in for Case Parameters, Activity Reasons, Strategy Step, and Strategy. It is now mandatory to fill in the field. Also fixed the Duplicate Strategy procedure.
    Upgrade Note:
    The CODE field in the menu item "Case Management\Configuration Setup\Domain Configuration" must be filled in for the following objects: Case Parameters, Activity Reasons, Strategy, and Strategy Step. 
If the CODE field is not filled in, it is not possible to approve a strategy that was obtained by using the "Duplicate" action to copy an existing strategy.

To find objects with an empty CODE field, run check script .
    Check Scripts:
    <OWS Home>\db\scripts\oracle\check\checkdata\cards\CARDS-58609_CM_conf_check.sql
    Updated Manuals: [case_management\Case_Management_Configuration.pdf]

    DB kernel

  • [DBK-3208]
    • Changed the pipe com.openwaygroup.pipe.write_audit_log_file.jar output to syslog (rfc5424) format.
    Upgrade Note:
    If data are exported from the sy_audit_log table (for more information, see the document "WAY4 Audit Log Export") to an external monitoring system, ensure the external monitoring system is ready to receive logs in syslog format.
Check for this pipe in the process log. Process name is PIPE: Audit Log Writing(com.openwaygroup.pipe.write_audit_log_file.jar).
    Check Scripts:
    Check script for this change is: CHECK_v1_DBK-3208_write_audit_log_file.sql  Script returns either "passed" (no action required) or "warning" if any action required.

    Notifications

  • [CARDS-54717]
    • Changed the result of a value returned by the %TRANS_REASON_DETAILS% variable. Now it returns the whole text from the doc.reason_details field instead of text from doc.add_info.
    Upgrade Note:
    In case the previous %TRANS_REASON_DETAILS% variable behaviour should be kept, it is recommended to find a setup that uses the variable and change %TRANS_REASON_DETAILS% to %DOC_TAGS% and %TRANS_REASON_DETAILS:tag% to %DOC_TAGS:tag%.
    Check Scripts:
    The check scripts below can be used to find message templates:
CARDS-54717_SMS_template_reason_details_01.sql
CARDS-54717_SMS_template_reason_details_02.sql
CARDS-54717_SMS_template_reason_details_03.sql
CARDS-54717_SMS_template_reason_details_04.sql
    Updated Manuals: [notifications\transaction_notifications\Transaction_Notifications.pdf]

    Check Scripts Grouped by Releases

    There are following types of non-upgrade scripts: preliminary scripts (scripts show if customer has configuration or data, which will be impacted on new version), diagnostic scripts (scripts collect some configuration/data statistics).

    File location: in the folder "<NEW_OWS_HOME>\db\scripts\oracle\check\checkdata\".

    The command string should be used to run scripts. Two ways are supported:

    1. Run all scripts:

    <NEW_OWS_HOME>\db\ssp4.bat connect=<Owner>/<Password>@<HOST>:<PORT>:<SID> <NEW_OWS_HOME>\db\scripts\oracle\check\checkdata.ss4 <Log_Folder>

    2. Run scripts related to one task (for example scripts for task CARDS-12345):

    <NEW_OWS_HOME>\db\ssp4.bat connect=<Owner>/<Password>@<HOST>:<PORT>:<SID> <NEW_OWS_HOME>\db\scripts\oracle\check\checkdata.ss4 <Log_Folder> "CARDS-12345"

    , where <NEW_OWS_HOME> - path to new OWS_HOME;

    <Owner>/<Password>@<HOST>:<PORT>:<SID> - connection string to current WAY4 version (before upgrade installation) under Owner user;

    <Log_Folder> - folder with scripts results and their logging.

    Example:

    C:\03_47_30_00\db\ssp4.bat connect=MyOwner/MyPassword@111.11.11.111:1521:orcl C:\03_47_30_00\\db\scripts\oracle\check\checkdata.ss4 C:\temp\check_script_res_47\

    Change types:

    • Added New Feature
    • Changed Feature
    • Fixed Bug
    • New Task
    • Sub-task
    • Support of Payment System Release Requirements
    • Standard Configuration Update
    • Backporting
    • Information Note

    Cards

    • 03.45.30.77
      • [I1804119098]/[CARDS-57800]
