  • [CARDS-56981]

    • Rolled back the changes made by article AN 1103 on 06.02.2018 for MasterCard IRD 79 (only for Europe Acquirers) configuration according to the article AN 1103 on 27.02.2018.

    Updated Manuals: [ips_releases\mastercard\20XX_XX_MC_Requirements.pdf]

  • [CARDS-57450]

    • Added IRD configuration which is based on Full MPE 18.Q2.

  • [CARDS-57836]

    • Added currency VENEZUELA BOLIVAR SOBERANO to the currency table.

  • [CARDS-57947]

    • Supported AN 1097 enhancement pursuant to MasterCard 17.Q3 release for Dual Message (clearing). ATM Access Fee from an incoming presentment is stored in the "TATM_SERV_FEE_AMOUNT" document tag if PDS1001 contains it. In addition, ATM Service Fee is populated in PDS1001 of an exported chargeback if this information was in the incoming presentment.

  • [CARDS-57988]

    • Supported new "3" ("mPOS Software-based PIN Entry Capability") value for the DE22.2 field for incoming MasterCard IPM messages. It is processed like "1" ("PIN entry capability") value.

  • [CARDS-57990]

    • Supported MasterCard 18.Q4 AN1630 release article. Added new PDSs 0184, 0185, 0186 processing (import/export) in "IPM Inward Processing" and "IPM Outward Processing" pipes.

  • [I1706010066]/[CARDS-54489]

    • MasterCard Services. Added service packages "STD-STD MC SPC - MasterCard MoneySend for Commercial Product Forbidden" and "STD-STD MC SPC - MasterCard MoneySend for Small Business Card Allowed" to meet requirements of Global Operations Bulletin No. 8 on 1 August 2016 article "Reminder of Revised Standards for MoneySend Payment Transaction Support for Small Business Card Issuers". To update MasterCard service package configuration use <OW_HOME>\db\datax\config\MC_IRD_CFG_SP_CC.txt.

  • [I1803013326]/[CARDS-56997]

    • Modified IRD configuration according to daily MPE files that were received before 01/Mar/18.

    Merchant portal

  • [I1704219382]/[CARDS-53378]

    • Added new API trans_api.GET_MTR_AMOUNT_EXT()

    Mobile banking

  • [CARDS-53086]

    • Resolved the issue with empty invoice details with special characters in Mobile Banking.

  • [CARDS-53004]

    • Mobile banking: a requirement for the value of the allow_multiple_user_sessions parameter has been added. The parameter must be set to "false" in accordance with PA-DSS.

    Updated Manuals: Security &amp; key management | PCI DSS Implementation Guide

  • [CARDS-53008]

    • Mobile banking: a requirement for the value of the debug_enabled parameter has been added. The parameter must be set to "false" in accordance with PA-DSS.

    Updated Manuals: Security &amp; key management | PCI DSS Implementation Guide

    Money transfers

  • [CARDS-53816]

    • B2B and G2B money transfers license validation has been implemented for the following transaction application codes: FD,GD,MD,OG,C02,C03,C04,C05,C06,C09,C55,C56,C57.

  • [CARDS-54224]

    • B2B and G2B money transfers license validation has been implemented for the following transaction application codes: FD,GD,MD,OG,C02,C03,C04,C05,C06,C09,C55,C56,C57.

  • [CARDS-51763]

    • Fleet documents UI DB API. If the "Fee description" field is empty, it will be filled in with the text "0.00 (Currency)".

  • [CARDS-54643]

    • 1. BAI C07 support has been implemented for Account-to-Person Credit money requests when the debited Account (CPID) cannot be routed in our system (an eWallet number, for instance). 2. The ALLOWED_MTRANSF_METH global parameter is no longer used. Please contact Customer Support for details.

  • [CARDS-54787]

    • Added the INTP2P tag to the add_info field of B2C, C2C and Credit money transfer transaction documents.

  • [CARDS-51563]

    • Ability to change the CUP Channel name letter has been implemented.

  • [CARDS-53107]

    • Routing search is performed either by member_id if filled, or by PAN.

  • [CARDS-53167]

    • Changed population of the CSOF tag (Source of Funds) for Money Transfers to a Visa card from the card of another IPS according to Visa requirements. Now the "06" value is returned for Credit accounts, and the "05" value is returned for Debit/deposit access accounts.

  • [CARDS-53362]

    • Changed behaviour: pursuant to VISA requirements, the CPNA tag is no longer filled in with the "Visa Money Transfer" string for domestic money transfers if the correct value was not found.

  • [CARDS-53571]

    • Corrected behaviour: credited card channel license is only analyzed to determine if _DOM/_INT suffixes must be added to source_fee_code value.

  • [CARDS-54212]

    • Implemented specific card debit transfers license validation for the following transaction application codes: C07, C52, AA, PP.

  • [CARDS-54468]

    • Fixed issue when payment transactions with PTID=C04 were processed as MasterCard MoneySend transactions.

  • [CARDS-54484]

    • Modified the money transfer transactions PTID and RPBA tags analysis algorithm. The USE_PTID_IN_P2P global parameter is no longer used. The PTID tag value is used for processing documents when the target card is a MasterCard card. The RPBA tag is used for VISA and other international payment systems.

  • [CARDS-56194]

    • Changed the algorithm for populating the CSOF tag. Now CSOF is populated with the "02" (or "05" for transfers to Visa from the card of another IPS) value for Money Transfers transactions if the source of funds is not defined in the BIN table.

  • [CARDS-56496]

    • Implemented Visa BAI AA support for Account-to-Person Credit money requests when the debited Account (CPID) cannot be routed in our system (an eWallet number, for instance).

  • [I1701163750]/[CARDS-51967]

    • Changed BIN routing search for P2P transactions from cards to accounts.

  • [I1703076137]/[CARDS-52813]

    • Updated license validation for C2C to an affiliated channel. Affiliate OnUs transactions will not require IPS license setup. The correct routing configuration is as follows: Affiliate should be specified as card BIN Group Channel and the BIN Table channel should indicate IPS.

  • [I1703201358]/[CARDS-52738]

    • If device_parms.device_location value is used as the source of the CPNA tag and the value consists of one word only, the tag value will be calculated as two device_parms.device_location values separated by a space character.

  • [I1706069710]/[CARDS-53514]

    • Money transfers Sender Data made optional for OnUs and Domestic transactions for CUP cards.

  • [CARDS-54243]

    • Business to Card transaction licenses have been added. Please contact Customer Support for configuration if you use these transactions.

  • [CARDS-54891]

    • Changed VISA OCT reversal processing. OCT reversals with Target Channel "VISA SMS" are rejected with Return Code "12" and Posting Status "Under Workflow". OCT reversals with Target Channel "VISA" are not sent in the online phase and should be sent in clearing.

    Updated Manuals: [transaction_management\Documents.pdf]

  • [CARDS-55030]

    • Changed P2P Money Transfer Account Funding and Original Credit Transactions Jurisdiction rules according to Oct17 VISA Release. Transactions between cards issued in a list of EU countries will be processed as domestic transactions.

  • [I1612198860]/[CARDS-51583]

    • P2P data validation rules required for IPS channels will also be validated for affiliate channels if the card BIN group channel is defined as an IPS channel.

    Multiple financial institutions

  • [CARDS-57134]

    • Fixed an incorrect system behaviour when copying a financial institution: if the "Numeration Scheme" field's value is set for the target financial institution, it is not duplicated from the source financial institution.

  • [I1804117663]/[CARDS-57718]

    • Changed a search rule for Interbranch Orders. In Way4Cards 03.45.30 minor versions, Interbranch Orders had to be configured for accounts specified in the "Fee Account" service field regardless of an account to which the document is actually posted in case of Active/Passive pair. Starting from version 03.45.30, supported a search for Interbranch Orders in both accounts of Active/Passive pair if one of these accounts is set as "Fee Account" in a service.

    NSPK interface

  • [CARDS-53254]

    • Changed default SQL values for analyzing parent Service Packs for the P_CAN_DISPENSE_CASH and P_CAN_ACCEPT_CASH parameters in the "XLS_NSPK_Statistics_Acquiring_Devices" report.

    Updated Manuals: [mir_statistical_reports\MIR_Statistical_Reports.pdf]

  • [CARDS-55861]

    • Added a new DEFAULT_USAGE pipe parameter to define the bin_table.usage field for NSPK (MIR, JCB, AMEX, UPI) ranges and VISA/MC ranges not corresponding to the appropriate original IPS bin range. NSPK MPE Import.

  • [CARDS-49993]

    • NSPK Inward Processing (pipe): fixed PDS-0306 (File Message Counts) verification - rejected messages are excluded from the value for comparison.

  • [CARDS-50351]

    • CH Payment Trans Type: Changed subtypes for "Our MIR Cards" and "MIR Cards". Now the "Fee Algorithm Options" field contains "SIC=6536;PTID_C06=6012;ACQ_ONLINE=Y;".

  • [CARDS-51434]

    • NSPK Outward ONUS: fixed PDS-0025.2 filling for reversals. A reversal will be exported only after receiving the appropriate [1644-685] (Financial Position) message for the original transaction.

  • [CARDS-51451]

    • NSPK Outward: added Member ID to error message when getting Member parameters.

  • [CARDS-51533]

    • NSPK SIOM Outward: fixed Oracle grants for Clerk role.

  • [CARDS-51572]

    • NSPK Outward Processing: fixed ARN recalculation for Adjustments, when an Adjustment has the same date as original transaction.

  • [CARDS-52966]

    • The menu branch "OpenWay\MIR Statistics Reports\MIR. Details" (with all menu items) and menu items "OpenWay\MIR Statistics Reports\MIR Notification Report (briefly)", "OpenWay\MIR Statistics Reports\MIR Acknowledgement Report (briefly)", "OpenWay\MIR Statistics Reports\MIR Settlement Report (briefly)", "OpenWay\MIR Statistics Reports\MIR Settlement Results (briefly)", "OpenWay\MIR Statistics Reports\MIR Submission Report (briefly)" have been moved to "OpenWay\MIR\MIR. Reports\" menu branch.

  • [CARDS-53095]

    • NSPK Interface: posting date is used instead of transaction date to calculate ARN.

  • [CARDS-53334]

    • NSPK Processing (pipes): fixed incorrect processing for PDS-0176 and PDS-0190 for AMEX.

  • [CARDS-53358]

    • Fixed the inability to receive authorization requests from one IPS member to another when both members are served in the same processing centre but direct interbranch routing between them is blocked. Please check external services configuration to share the source channel for correct authorization processing where <ChannelCode> is a source channel: * for Transaction Switch users, external adapter contains "special_processing_options sourceChannelID=<ChannelCode>" * for NetServer users, external channel contains <MODULE TYPE="NETWORK"> section with <PARAMETER NAME="SOURCE_CHANNEL_ID" VALUE="<ChannelCode>"/> The case is directly related to situations when a message received from IPS channel will be routed back to the same channel.

  • [CARDS-54071]

    • NSPK MPE Import (pipe): fixed filling country code for MIR, JCB, AMEX, UPI BIN table import.

  • [CARDS-54360]

    • SIOM: fixed finding Issuer Member ID when creating an ONUS SIOM document for an Affiliated Bank's card.

  • [CARDS-54406]

    • NSPK SIOM Inward: fixed linking incoming documents to incorrect SIOM documents.

  • [CARDS-54681]

    • NSPK Outward. Fixed DE22.5 filling.

  • [CARDS-54841]

    • Removed delimiters from response to tkn_activation transaction when there is only one phone number.

  • [CARDS-55214]

    • Fixed NSPK VISA Bin Table Import: when an incoming range has at least one corresponding (smaller or bigger) original VISA BIN range, only these corresponding records are created (copied) in NSPK BIN Group. Before, the "bigger" original incoming NSPK BIN range was also added to WAY4.

  • [CARDS-55293]

    • NSPK Inward Processing: fixed rollback procedure for "Interchange Total" and "Reimbursement Fee Total" documents that were created from incoming file.

  • [CARDS-55510]

    • NSPK Inward Processing: fixed incorrect processing of settlement incoming messages for financial advices as "Iss Ichng Detail Loyalty For Cardholder CR Inc". Now such messages without the DE-026 field are loaded as "Iss Ichng Detail CH Payment Inc" type.

  • [CARDS-55865]

    • Added analysis of the "On Us" transaction property when calculating "Number of Active cards" in the XLS_NSPK_Statistics_Issuing_Business_Prepared report.

  • [CARDS-56204]

    • Corrected 'Number of active cards' value for 'XLS_NSPK_Statistics_Issuing_Business_Prepared' report.

  • [CARDS-56419]

    • Corrected lines grouping in ''NSPK Cards, Part 2 (Cards and Territory)" statistical report.

  • [CARDS-56735]

    • Added the ability to run several NSPK Export processes in parallel.

  • [CARDS-57200]

    • Fixed WAY4 Manager form syntax error in the following forms: "SIOM Active List","SIOM Chain", "SIOM Doc", "SIOM Inactive List", "SIOM List".

  • [CARDS-57242]

    • Fixed issue when PDS 0375 was cut when importing 1644-685 settlement message by the "NSPK Inward Processing" pipe.

  • [CARDS-57636]

    • Added an additional check to verify the DE22.SF5 field when transactions are exported. If the DE22.SF5 field contains a value that is not supported by NSPK, the transaction is suspended.

  • [CARDS-57638]

    • Fixed an issue with filling in DE22 field for P2P Credit transaction export by NSPK Outward Processing pipe.

  • [I1702174295]/[CARDS-52110]

    • NSPK Inward Processing pipe: fixed incorrect message code (S2IIF1X1, S2III1X1) generation.

  • [I1702270914]/[CARDS-52869]

    • NSPK Outward Processing (pipe): fixed export of last adjustment, which reverses transaction completely.

  • [I1705221304]/[CARDS-53272]

    • IPS Products. Updated according to last NSPK specification.

  • [I1705264583]/[CARDS-53495]

    • NSPK Outward Processing (pipe): fixed ARN calculating for multiple adjustments.

  • [I1706150009]/[CARDS-53865]

    • NSPK Processing (pipes) : fixed processing of PDS 2063.

    Updated Manuals: [UFX_H2H_Interchange.pdf (NDA Specification for vendors)]

  • [I1710025092, I1710056161]/[CARDS-55020]

    • NSPK MPE Import: fixed performance issue when loading bin ranges for VISA (binv files). Changed default value for the "SEARCH_AS_SUB" pipe parameter from "N" to "Y". It allows new detailed VISA BIN token ranges to be imported more correctly. To restore old behaviour, the "SEARCH_AS_SUB"="N" pipe parameter must be set.

  • [I1710096925]/[CARDS-55076]

    • Changed the ARN calculation algorithm. To avoid "Incorrect Date in ARN (yDDD) : [7281], must not be less than trans_date" error, the transaction date is used to calculate ARN for the MIR interface. When the posting date is larger than the transaction date by 5 or more days, the posting date is used. For other payment system interfaces (MasterCard, Visa, AMEX) the transaction date is always used for ARN calculation.

  • [I1802098196]/[CARDS-57064]

    • Changed NSPK Outward Processing: DE37 is left-padded with zeroes if necessary to match NSPK ODPT format.

  • [I1802152665]/[CARDS-57019]

    • Changed NSPK Outward Processing: reversals containing the "REFUND"="Y" document tag and late reversals are exported as "credit" transaction type (DE03.01=20) to meet NSPK operation rules.

    Updated Manuals: [UFX_H2H_Interchange.pdf (NDA Specification for vendors)]

  • [I1803062849]/[CARDS-57164]

    • Fixed error when a format issue could lead to a fatal error for the "NSPK Outward Processing" pipe.

  • [I1806190567, I1806201990, I1806191767, I1806202149, I1806203481]/[CARDS-58233]

    • Fixed issue when "NSPK Inward Processing" pipe stops working with error "Incorrect adjustment message: must be Credit for Debit transactions!"

  • [CARDS-54236]

    • Added installation and configuration manuals (issuing and acquiring modules) for the MIR Loyalty Program.

    Updated Manuals: [nspk_interface\mir_loyalty\acquiring\MIR_ACQ_Loyalty_Support.pdf] [nspk_interface\mir_loyalty\issuing\MIR_ISS_Loyalty_Support.pdf]

  • [CARDS-54898]

    • Updated 2017_10_NSPK_Requirements.pdf. The section containing NetServer settings for MIR B-05 requirement has been removed. NetServer unconditionally behaves in compliance with MIR B-05 requirement.

    Updated Manuals: [ips_releases\20XX_XX_NSPK_Requirements.pdf]

  • [CARDS-58112]

    • Updated description of the acquiring configuration for the MIR Loyalty program. The recommended value of the "LOYALTY_SCHEME" inward pipe parameter has been changed to "MIR_PARTNER_ID".

    Updated Manuals: [nspk_interface\mir_loyalty\acquiring\MIR_ACQ_Loyalty_Support.pdf]

  • [CARDS-56729]

    • Supported MIR Single Message interface.

  • [CARDS-51484]

    Updated Manuals:

  • [CARDS-51594]

    • [NSPK REL] 17.1 B-02. NSPK Outward Processing will not export "1740-781" and "1740-782" messages if "NSPK_RELEASE"="17.1" global parameter is set.

  • [CARDS-51958]

    • NSPK Inward Processing (pipe): supported new G2C transaction processing.

  • [CARDS-51959]

    • Added the ability to validate a cardholder's date of birth together with other security values. See documentation for details.

    Updated Manuals:

  • [CARDS-53277]

    • Affiliated BII Outward Processing (pipe) : supported export of NSPK G2C Credit transactions.

  • [CARDS-53376]

    • [MIR REL] 2017.2 K-10: supported new PDS2175. It is used to export/import Card Acceptor URL containing Cyrillic characters. "NSPK_RELEASE"="17.2" global parameter must be set to use this functionality.

  • [CARDS-53502]

    • [MIR REL] 2017.2 B-05. NSPK Outward Processing (pipe): EMV tag 84 is filled with the "EMV_AID" document tag value if tag 84 is absent in addendum_doc chip data.

    Updated Manuals: [ips_releases\20XX_XX_NSPK_Requirements.pdf] [UFX_H2H_Interchange.pdf (NDA Specification for vendors)]

  • [CARDS-53641]

    • NSPK Outward Processing (pipe) : added the "COMMIT_INTERVAL" parameter to manage commit interval.

  • [CARDS-53642]

    • NSPK MIR: Added product TKN (MIR Token).

  • [CARDS-53995]

    • MIR tokenization is supported.

  • [CARDS-54003]

    • [MIR REL] 2017.2 B-10 NSPK Clearing Interfaces (pipes): supported new cash-to-card transaction processing.

  • [CARDS-54018]

    • [MIR REL] 2017.2 K-12 : supported "B" value for PDS0165.1 field.

  • [CARDS-54308]

    • NSPK Inward Processing (pipe): G2C MIR Transactions will be imported as Notifications based on the "MIR_FAST_FUNDS" additional global parameter value. The "FF_TO_NOTIF" tag from the BIN table and "FF_TO_NOTIF_DEF" pipe parameter are not analyzed anymore. Notification will be converted to Advice by the Document Processing procedure if necessary.

  • [CARDS-55802]

    • [MIR REL] 2018.1 B-20: NSPK MPE Import. Supported import of new file field BILCURRENCY_CODE. This field is stored in the CH_BILL_CURR tag in bin_table. To override this value, a new pipe parameter, CHANGE_CURR = "YYYXXX" can be used, where "YYY" is the currency code from the file and "XXX" is the currency code to store in the database.

  • [CARDS-55901]

    • Supported new ODPT DE22.6 (Pos Entry Mode subfield) "10" value for incoming clearing messages according to B-16 NSPK Release article. Also changed processing for DE22.6="82" value on import. NSPK_RELEASE=18.1 additional global parameter must be set for new processing.

  • [CARDS-55904]

    • Changed processing for DE22.5="4" value according to B-16 NSPK 18.1 release article for import files. NSPK_RELEASE=18.1 additional global parameter must be set for new processing.

  • [CARDS-55909]

    • Supported processing of DE25 for 1st presentment (1240-200 message) incoming message according to B-16 NSPK Release article.

  • [CARDS-55981]

    • Supported DCC amounts in DE54 clearing field according to B-19 release article. [NSPK Rel 18.1]

  • [CARDS-55987]

    • Supported new [1240-220] adjustment message according to B-18 NSPK 18.1 release article. "EXT_CASE_ID" document tag will contain DE72 (dispute case id in NSPK) value.

  • [CARDS-56300]

    • Added the ability to edit the doc.add_info field when creating an adjustment document.

  • [CARDS-57159]

    • Added the parameter CHANGE_CURR=643810 to the menu subitem for the com.openwaygroup.pipe.nspk.mpe_import.jar pipe in the standard menu item "OpenWay\MIR\MIR. Daily Procedures\MIR. Load MPE\MIR MPE Import".

  • [CARDS-57385]

    • Supported CIT and MIT transactions for the NSPK ODPT Clearing interface.

  • [CARDS-57468]

    • Added a new message channel (letter "f") for MIR SMS.

  • [I1705026998, I1705127863, I1705153646, I1702208472, I1705297867]/[CARDS-53441]

    • NSPK Bin Table Import (pipe): if NSPK BIN range for VISA/MC is not found and smaller (fully included in NSPK range) VISA/MC BIN ranges exist, these VISA/MC ranges are copied to the appropriate NSPK BIN Group. To avoid copying and restore the old behaviour, the new "COPY_SUBRANGES"="N" pipe parameter must be set.

  • [I1709041130]/[CARDS-54857]

    • Created new statistical reports "NSPK Cards, Part 1 (Cards and BIN)", ''NSPK Cards, Part 2 (Cards and Territory)" required by NSPK Bulletin 37.2017.

    Updated Manuals: [mir_statistical_reports\MIR_Statistical_Reports.pdf]

  • [I1710103490]/[CARDS-55295]

    • NSPK Inward Processing: supported file import using several connections to the database. To use this functionality, specify the required number of connections in the new N_OF_PARALLEL_THREADS pipe parameter.

    Notifications

  • [CARDS-50086]

    • Added new variables %FDT_<DT_CODE>:[date format]% and %PAST_DUE_DATE:[deliquency group]:[date format]% for messages about contract dates. These variables can be used in client message setup for SMS Banking.

    Updated Manuals: [product_management\Client_Messages.pdf]

  • [CARDS-52702]

    • Added a new variable, %BILLING_BALANCE%, for messages about billing balances. This variable can be used in client message setup for SMS Banking.

    Updated Manuals: [notifications\transaction_notifications\Transaction_Notifications.pdf]

  • [CARDS-53679]

    • Added a new variable for client message notification: %USG_LIM_ACTIVE:<Usage_Code>%, which returns varchar2(1). The variable returns the current status of a usage limiter with <Usage_Code>.

    Updated Manuals: [product_management\Client_Messages.pdf]

  • [CARDS-54051]

    • A new variable has been added for client message notifications: USG_EVENT_DETAILS:<TagCode>[:DateFormat]% Returns tag values from usage_action.EVENT_DETAILS. TagCode is mandatory and indicates tag name. DateFormat is optional and indicates the date format in a message if the tag value contains a date. Default date format for the tag is "YYYY-MM-DD"

  • [CARDS-54128]

    • A new variable has been added for client message notifications: USG_EVENT_DETAILS:<TagCode>[:DateFormat]% Returns tag values from usage_action.EVENT_DETAILS. TagCode is mandatory and indicates tag name. DateFormat is optional and indicates the date format in a message if the tag value contains a date. Default date format for the tag is "YYYY-MM-DD"

  • [CARDS-51361]

    • For date variables like %TRANS_DATE[[*shift]*date_format]% if [*date_format] is not declared the format with the "default" code described in "OpenWay\Full\Configuration Setup\Client Classifiers\Formatting Styles" is used. If there is no "default code" the standard date mask "YYYY-MM-DD HH24:MI:SS" is used.

    Updated Manuals: [issuing\user_manuals\Cardholder_Statements.pdf]

  • [CARDS-51592]

    • Processing of the default Service (with id=0) for correct representation of "%SERVICE$..." variables has been added.

  • [CARDS-51904]

    • In the "Cardholder Contract Statement" report added calculation of values for %VAR% variables if they are set in the P_MESSAGECODE_P parameter.

  • [CARDS-52269]

    • If an online reversal did not lead to a change in the amount available, a notification will not created.

  • [CARDS-53300]

    • For number variables (like %TRANS_AMOUNT%, %SUM(...)%) by default, if the format is not declared in the variable, use the formatting style (OpenWay\Full\Configuration Setup\Client Classifiers\Formatting Styles) with the "default" code.

    Updated Manuals: [product_management\Client_Messages.pdf]

  • [CARDS-53409]

    • If an online reversal did not lead to a change in the amount available, a notification will not be created.

  • [CARDS-54717]

    • Changed the result of a value returned by the %TRANS_REASON_DETAILS% variable. Now it returns the whole text from the doc.reason_details field instead of text from doc.add_info.

    Updated Manuals: [notifications\transaction_notifications\Transaction_Notifications.pdf]

  • [CARDS-55459]

    • Corrected the "Event Message Text" form to avoid [Dictionary] button error.

  • [CARDS-56694]

    • Restored translation of the %TRANS_TYPE% calculated variable to the language defined in the client record in client notification message templates. The problem with this variable was only observed in versions 03.44.31.06-07, 03.45.30.53-56, 03.46.30.05-08.

  • [CARDS-56753]

    • Added a new variable for client message notifications: %DFLT_TRANS_TYPE% It returns Transaction Name value from mess_dict without language translations.

    Updated Manuals: [notifications\transaction_notifications\Transaction_Notifications.pdf]

  • [CARDS-57203]

    • Added workaround for bug Oracle Solaris SPARC 64-bit, 11.2.0.4 (Bug 21659726 - Library cache lock waits for sys.jox_cbrls_lock object after upgrade to 12.1.0.2 in Java (Doc ID 21659726.8)). The workaround is to avoid using the Java function to convert a number to a string and use the pl/sql function to_char() to number conversions. The workaround is enabled by global configuration with the code "MSG_DEFAULT_AMOUNT_FORMAT" and value "999G999G999G990D00".

  • [I1611154209]/[CARDS-51591]

    • Notification generation for expired fund holds unblocking has been corrected. A new event code "CLOSED_AUTH_DOC" has been added.

    Updated Manuals: [product_management\Events.pdf]

  • [I1704076451]/[CARDS-52945]

    • When an attempt is made to open a MTR_FIN_REVERSE Event, a check is made of whether an Event with the "AUTH_T_R" or "AUTH_P_R" code was opened earlier. If one of these Events was opened, the Event with the "MTR_FIN_REVERSE" code will not be opened.

  • [I1704120003]/[CARDS-52793]

    • The language defined in "OpenWay\Full\Configuration Setup\Main Tables\Global Constants" or for an Officer is no longer used for SMS messages.

  • [I1708045371]/[CARDS-54423]

    • Fixed "ORA-06502: numeric or value error: character string buffer too small" exception during notification message generation during the posting process when %IF% and %THEN% message constructions are converted into values greater than 255 symbols.

  • [I1802215636]/[CARDS-57060]

    • Fixed an issue with string buffer overflow in Notifications when generated message length exceeded maximum length value of message text variable.

    Offline obfuscator

  • [DBK-2831]

    • Card number and personal data are obfuscated using format preserving encryption algorithms compliant with NIST.

  • [DBK-2833]

    • Added support of FPE Encryption algorithm in Offline Obfuscator. Use the new additional global parameter OBFUSCATION_ALGORITHM with possible values TRANSPARENT (by default) - the old algorithm, and FPE - FPE encryption.

  • [DBK-2925]

    • Added support of FPE Encryption algorithm in Offline Obfuscator. Use the new additional global parameter OBFUSCATION_ALGORITHM with possible values TRANSPARENT (by default) - the old algorithm, and FPE - FPE encryption.

  • [DBK-2457]

    • Added support of obfuscating latin-1 characters.

    PIN delivery

  • [CARDS-54578]

    • Fixed problem with RC 464 "More than one card found" error during PIN Delivery.

    POS management

  • [CARDS-52931]

    • Now we store local transaction date time received from "Device H2H" to Document transaction Date.

  • [CARDS-48740]

    • Final advice is supported for P2P transactions.

    Personal Data Management

  • [CARDS-57344]

    • Supported erasure of personal data on client request.

  • [CARDS-57740]

    • Enhanced standard personal data clearing process. Added obfuscation of personal data in the "Contract" and "Card Info" tables.

  • [CARDS-58294]

    • Added message to process_mess including information on number of clients whose personal data was erased by processes of erasing personal data by request and for closed contracts.

  • [CARDS-57949]

    • Added collection initialization before personal data erasure to avoid fatal error on first process launch.

  • [CARDS-58205]

    • Added selection of "Financial Institution", "Client Category" and "Client Type" to "OpenWay\Personal Data Management\Clients with their Personal Data Management status" form.

    Product inspector

  • [CARDS-51659]

    • A new menu for Datamart loading testing is supported, OpenWay\WAY4 Datamart Product Inspector.

    Updated Manuals:

  • [CARDS-51138]

    • When a contract is created or attached with same IDT as another contract in a Product Inspector test script, a numerical suffix will be added to its IDT to stop duplicate IDTs from appearing in the Product Inspector log.

    Updated Manuals: [product_inspector\WAY4_Product_Inspector_Manual.pdf]

  • [CARDS-51966]

    • The "OpenWay\Product Inspector\Test Data Clearing\" menu group has been renamed to "OpenWay\Product Inspector\Test Data Maintenance\". Added a new menu item, "OpenWay\Product Inspector\Test Data Maintenance\Gather Tables Statistics" for gathering table (UT_TEST, UT_TEST_MSG, TEST_SCHEME, TEST_STEP) statistics.

    Updated Manuals: [product_inspector\WAY4_Product_Inspector_Manual.pdf]

  • [CARDS-52187]

    • Generation of unique transaction chain value stored in the PERS_NAME_REC document tag has been added to Product Inspector.

  • [CARDS-52225]

    • A new action, "Set Billing Day", which allows the contract billing date to be changed, has been added for contracts in Product Inspector. The value should be specified in the "Action Code" field and can be in the range from 1 to 31.

    Updated Manuals: [product_inspector\WAY4_Product_Inspector_Manual.pdf]

  • [CARDS-52363]

    • Implemented a new Action Type, "Recalc Balance Type", for Product Inspector. It allows the balance to be recalculated for the current contract.

    Updated Manuals: [product_inspector\WAY4_Product_Inspector_Manual.pdf]

  • [CARDS-53123]

    • Check of RC and document status for the "set credit limit" Product Inspector step has been added.

  • [I1510305116]/[CARDS-48831]

    • Product Inspector: Supported creation of Final (Second) Chargeback for Dispute Assistant v2.

  • [CARDS-51234]

    • A new "test_script_export" pipe parameter, SILENT, with Y/N values has been added for use from Scheduler. If the parameter value is "Y", no dialog message will be shown.

    Updated Manuals: [product_inspector\WAY4_Product_Inspector_Manual.pdf]

  • [CARDS-51449]

    • Added sorting by ID for application action logging in PI test results.

  • [CARDS-52003]

    • A new log mode, INVOICE_FULL is supported in Product Inspector. In this mode, all invoice and instalment fields are logged and compared. To use the new mode, set LOG_MODE=INVOICE_FULL in step, script or launch details.

    Updated Manuals: [product_inspector\WAY4_Product_Inspector_Manual.pdf]

  • [CARDS-52054]

    • Fixed processing of general daily standing orders when running test scripts. Now general orders will be processed for the current contract's main contract, as in production.

  • [CARDS-52749]

    • Fixed generation of the message "I Temporary credit limit closed" during the "Close Temporary Limit" Product Inspector step. Also, it is not necessary to set the "CLOSE_CR_LIMIT" value for the "Action Code" field to close the Temporary Limit.

  • [CARDS-53278]

    • The mechanism that gathers and generates information for tags used when running Product Inspector scripts has been fixed. To activate the mechanism, the global parameter PI_COLLECT_TAGS should be set to "Y". In this case, information is stored in process message with the message type "X". The parameter is switched off by default (value "N").

    Updated Manuals: [product_inspector\WAY4_Product_Inspector_Manual.pdf]

  • [CARDS-54033]

    • To attach a contract with a non-unique contract number to a test script, the BNK=<FI bank code> tag should be specified in the test step. Contract search will be performed in the specified financial institution.

    Updated Manuals: [product_inspector\WAY4_Product_Inspector_Manual.pdf]

  • [CARDS-54184]

    • Fixed incorrect behaviour of the "Test Script Import" pipe when Standard Journals were imported even if the corresponding Test Scripts were not chosen for import. Now if Test Scripts are skipped by import, Standard Journals will be skipped as well.

  • [CARDS-55758]

    • Fixed an issue with the Product Inspector's "test script import" pipe that required UI elements and graphic objects when the pipe was running under Scheduler on *nix OS in silent mode (pipe parameter SILENT="Y").

  • [CARDS-55889]

    • Fixed transaction condition attributes mapping between values in the file and in the destination database during test scripts import.

  • [CARDS-56516]

    • Supported stateless terminals in Product Inspector.

    Updated Manuals: [product_inspector\WAY4_Product_Inspector_Manual.pdf]

  • [CARDS-56992]

    • Supported Terminal Composite Keys (MemberID+MerchantID+TerminalID) matching in Product Inspector tests. Added a new Product Inspector Step tag PI_DEVICE_CKEY.

    Updated Manuals: [product_inspector\WAY4_Product_Inspector_Manual.pdf]

  • [CARDS-57012]

    • Added processing of empty tags "TRANS_COND_ATTR", "SEC_TRANS_COND_ATT" values in test_script_import pipe.

  • [I1611305656]/[CARDS-51348]

    • Product Inspector test script import has been modified when in the file being imported there are test scripts with codes that already exist: a UI dialog is displayed to confirm the script update. If script update is chosen, all the existing test steps will be deleted and the new one rewritten. This dialog window appears only if the pipe's SILENT mode parameter is switched off.

    Updated Manuals: [product_inspector\WAY4_Product_Inspector_Manual.pdf]

  • [I1612046735]/[CARDS-51874]

    • For the "test script import" pipe, added searching of CLIENT_TYPE values for the APPL_CLIENT.CLT tag with the additional condition "F_I=? and CCAT=?".

    Updated Manuals: [product_inspector\WAY4_Product_Inspector_Manual.pdf]

  • [I1703160402]/[CARDS-52474]

    • Product Inspector test script import has been modified when in the file being imported there are test scripts with the same codes that already exist in the destination WAY4Cards system. Previously, all test script steps already present in the destination database were deleted, which led to links being lost in comparing script results with the standard ones. This behaviour cannot be restored. In the first step of the import procedure, all the existing test steps in the database are marked with the new status "Obsolete". In the second step, the system checks if the step number exists in the file being imported. If not, the step in the database is kept with the "Obsolete" status, otherwise the step gets a status and inherits other parameters from the file being imported. When a Product Inspector script is run, a step with the "Obsolete" status behaves the same way as a step with the "Skip" status.

    Updated Manuals: [product_inspector\WAY4_Product_Inspector_Manual.pdf]

  • [I1709154318]/[CARDS-55378]

    • Fixed incorrect behavior of the "Test Script Import" pipe when Standard Journals were imported even if the corresponding Test Scripts were not chosen for import.

  • [I1803267894]/[CARDS-57234]

    • Fixed an incorrect date format in test scripts exported from WAY4 Manager. The "yyyy-MM-dd HH:mm:ss" hardcoded format is now used in the "test_script_export" pipe for date fields.

  • [I1805164500]/[CARDS-58385]

    • Fixed an issue with cached data in Product Inspector when Compare filter is specified.

    Product management

  • [CARDS-55930]

    • Supported IF_DATE/IF_DATE_VALUE tags for flexible date checking in different processes.

    Updated Manuals: [tags description] [product_management\Events.pdf] [product_management\Preferred_Counterparties.pdf] [product_management\Products_and_Subtypes.pdf] [product_management\Service_Packages.pdf] [product_management\Standing_Orders.pdf] [product_management\Usage_Limiters.pdf] [tariff_management\Tariff_Management.pdf] [transaction_management\Documents.pdf]

  • [CARDS-51540]

    • It is now possible to call a notification event several days before a regular fee is charged.

    Updated Manuals: [tags description] [product_management\Events.pdf] [product_management\Service_Packages.pdf] [transaction_management\Documents.pdf]

  • [CARDS-51553]

    • Ability to use some client attributes as contract parameters without their registration has been implemented. For example CLIENT.COMPANY_NAME or CLIENT.AGE can now be used as IF_PARM tag values.

    Updated Manuals: [core\Contract_and_Client_Classifiers.pdf] [product_management\Client_Messages.pdf] [product_management\Events.pdf] [product_management\Service_Packages.pdf]

  • [CARDS-51756]

    • The ability to customize contract state information gathered during contract balance prediction on future date has been added.

  • [CARDS-51853]

    • The ability to limit a custom fee amount has been added - MAX_FEE. The predefined codes SRCF, SRCT, SRCA, TGTF, TGTT, and TGTA can be used as values of the MAX_FEE_FROM tag to take the limiting amount from the base macrotransaction.

    Updated Manuals: [product_management\Service_Packages.pdf]

  • [CARDS-51968]

    • OpenWay\Full\CMS Stat\Create Statistics menu item has been enhanced. Now it will connect a new group "PRODUCT_GROUP" that contains key elements of product configuration scope.

  • [CARDS-51990]

    • OpenWay\Full\CMS Stat\Create Statistics menu item has been enhanced. Now it will connect a new group "PRODUCT_GROUP" that contains key elements of product configuration scope.

  • [CARDS-52049]

    • The CURRENT_CYCLE tag is supported for all Functional Dates.

    Updated Manuals: [product_management\Functional_Dates.pdf]

  • [CARDS-52129]

    • A new value, "Year", has been added to limiter period types for usage limiter templates.

    Updated Manuals: [product_management\Usage_Limiters.pdf]

  • [CARDS-52132]

    • The "Usage Template Details" form has been redesigned.

    Updated Manuals: [product_management\Usage_Limiters.pdf]

  • [CARDS-52257]

    • "Instead orders" processing have been enhanced: sorting by the "priority" have been added.

    Updated Manuals: [product_management\Standing_Orders.pdf]

  • [CARDS-52288]

    • Current Usage Limiter Template Id (usage_templ_approved.id) has been added to exception output for usage limiter-related Oracle exceptions. Example of new output: ORA-20666: caused by ORA-01476: divisor is equal to zero [];[PROCESS_LIMIT_TEMPLATE_APPROVED=2710; ]; ORA-06512: at "OWS.CUST_USAGE_IS_ACTIVE", line 32 ..... ORA-06512: at "OWS.AUTH", line 3054

  • [CARDS-52310]

    • Copying a product to an existing product in another financial institution will not invalidate the parent product if only sub-products are changed. After copying, it is only necessary to approve sub-products, the version of the parent product and unaffected sub-products does not change.

    Updated Manuals: [product_management\Products_and_Subtypes.pdf]

  • [CARDS-52347]

    • Added automatic display of query filter for ROOT\OpenWay\Full\Configuration Setup\Common Handbooks\Custom Handbooks form.

  • [CARDS-52590]

    • New forms to view and edit client and contract parameters have been implemented. Menu item "OpenWay\Issuing\Customer Support\Contract Parameters".

    Updated Manuals: [acquiring\user_manuals\Acquiring_Module.pdf] [issuing\user_manuals\Customer_Support.pdf] [issuing\user_manuals\Issuing_Module.pdf]

  • [CARDS-52784]

    • Added a new global parameter CHECK_OPEN_APPL_CASE. The parameter with the "Y" value checks open application cases for a contract when the CLOSE_IF_EMPTY event tag checks open cases for the contract. The default value is "N".

    Updated Manuals: [product_management\Events.pdf]

  • [CARDS-52816]

    • New features in balance prediction (Late Payment and interest in ToPay amount).

  • [CARDS-52944]

    • Product Min/Max/Default credit limit amounts can be specified by threshold tariffs.

    Updated Manuals: [tags description] [product_management\Products_and_Subtypes.pdf] [tariff_management\Tariff_Management.pdf]

  • [CARDS-53017]

    • For Transaction Types (TRANS_TYPE table) added Trans_Code unique check: - in "Transaction Types" and "Transactions - All" forms with the button Actions... -> Check All - in Message Dictionary generation with the menu OpenWay\Full\Configuration Setup\Main Tables\Generate Message Dictionary.

    Updated Manuals: [core\Common_References_Books.pdf] [transaction_management\Documents.pdf]

  • [CARDS-53280]

    • A Parent Pack link will be redefined from a history record if the Service Pack has not been approved yet.

  • [CARDS-53374]

    • REASON_DETAILS field size has been increased from 255 to 3900 symbols in the STANDING_ORDER and DOC tables.

  • [CARDS-53501]

    • A new Event type with the "CLS_UNIQUE" code is used to set a classifier with a future date and empty "Date To" in WAY4Web. This prevents the situation when Single events are stored in the usage action table in Posted status forever. For each financial institution that has an Event type with the "CLS" code and duration=Single, a new Event type with the "CLS_UNIQUE" code will be added during the upgrade process.

    Updated Manuals: [core\Contract_and_Client_Classifiers.pdf] [product_management\Events.pdf]

  • [CARDS-53755]

    • A new custom procedure, CUST_EXTRA_LIM_NORM_TOP, has been implemented to redefine the top contract for extra limit normalization.

  • [CARDS-53803]

    • Correct standing orders processing for terminal contracts with same Terminal ID in different financial institutions is supported. If this duplication exists in the client configuration, the global parameter ALLOW_DUPL_TERMINAL_ID should be set to "Y". In this case, standing order documents for device contracts will be filled with additional contract search attributes: Merchant ID, Member ID and Spc Scheme for source, Member ID and Spc Scheme for target.

    Updated Manuals: [core\Global_Parameters.pdf]

  • [CARDS-53830]

    • Re-ageing (WAIVED_PD tag) can now be used for Current Due accounts. The corresponding balance type should be marked with the WAIVED_PD tag. See documentation for details.

  • [CARDS-53831]

    • Correct standing orders processing for terminal contracts with same Terminal ID in different financial institutions is supported. If this duplication exists in the client configuration, the global parameter ALLOW_DUPL_TERMINAL_ID should be set to "Y". In this case, standing order documents for device contracts will be filled with additional contract search attributes: Merchant ID, Member ID and Spc Scheme for source, Member ID and Spc Scheme for target.

    Updated Manuals: [core\Global_Parameters.pdf]

  • [CARDS-53847]

    • Added the ability to mark multi-currency Products with the tag MULTICURR_PRODUCT=Y. The tag should be specified in the top Product of a hierarchy. When the tag is set, additional checks will be performed when approving Products and contracts. Multi-currency Products require a separate license. Contact OpenWay Support for more details.

  • [CARDS-53872]

    • Information about interest fees has been added to Balance Prediction Log.

  • [CARDS-53873]

    • Added the ability to stop regular fee charging when a card is expired. The STOP_AFTER_CARD_EXPIRE; tag should be used in the transaction subtype Fee Algorithm or in Service details.

    Updated Manuals: [tags description] [transaction_management\Documents.pdf]

  • [CARDS-53876]

    • Added the ability to mark multi-currency Products with the tag MULTICURR_PRODUCT=Y. The tag should be specified in the top Product of a hierarchy. When the tag is set, additional checks will be performed when approving Products and contracts. Multi-currency Products require a separate license. Contact OpenWay Support for more details.

  • [CARDS-54217]

    • Calculated contract parameters can now be used for Quarterly calculations.

  • [CARDS-54275]

    • Extended information has been added to balance inquiries for multi-currency cards. The amount returned for 01 balance in authorization requests for multi-currency cards includes amounts in all currencies.

  • [CARDS-54355]

    • Re-ageing (WAIVED_PD tag) can now be used for Current Due accounts. The corresponding balance type should be marked with the WAIVED_PD tag. See documentation for details.

    Updated Manuals: [core\Balance_types.pdf] [tags description] [tariff_management\Tariff_Management.pdf]

  • [CARDS-54602]

    • Added the ability to calculate interest with "Int By Credit" mode for limit normalization between sibling contracts in multi-currency products. The target account template used in a sibling standing order should have the "Activate Int by Credit" value in the "Calc Int Mode" field. Multi-currency products require separate licenses. Please contact OpenWay Support for more details.

  • [CARDS-54950]

    • Added the ability to use one plastic for different accounting contracts depending on the transaction date. A separate license is required.

  • [CARDS-55227]

    • Added the ability to count a document's amount as a reversal in contract balances.

    Updated Manuals: [core\Balance_types.pdf] [tags description] [product_management\Service_Packages.pdf] [transaction_management\Documents.pdf]

  • [CARDS-55632]

    • Supported a new algorithm for applying interest rate on Due Date. See the account template attribute INT_RESET_DATE definition.

    Updated Manuals: [tags description] [product_management\Client_Messages.pdf]

  • [CARDS-55900]

    • Supported the INTEREST_DELAY parameter on the financial institution level. Use the INTEREST_DELAY tag with the "Y" or N" values in financial institution special parameters.

    Updated Manuals: [core\Global_Parameters.pdf] [tags description]

  • [CARDS-56021]

    • Added the ability to post a Product's Start Event only when the Product for the Contract changes, without posting on contract creation. The tag value PROD_CHANGE_RULE=OPEN,CHANGE_ONLY; should be used in the "Custom Rules" field of the Product's Start Event or in the "Special Parameters" field of the corresponding Event Type.

  • [CARDS-56074]

    • Implemented the ability to check Active Plastic for a card contract. The tag IF_DATE=CONTRACT.ACTIVE_CARD_EXPIRE; and appropriate IF_DATE_VALUE should be used in any check strings or apply rules.

  • [CARDS-56303]

    • Added the ability to configure several "free" contract relation types with different codes. To specify that a contract relation is "free", the FREE_RELATION tag should be specified in the "Posting Scheme" field. Old behaviour for relations with the FREE_RELATION code has been preserved.

  • [CARDS-56595]

    • Added additional trace messages for Week Days verification on Preferred search.

  • [CARDS-57976]

    • Supported new values for the classifier's "Applies To" field: "Product" and "Institution". These values do not allow to set the classifier value for the Contract or Client directly. A value can only be set on the corresponding level - Product or F_I.

    Updated Manuals: [core\Contract_and_Client_Classifiers.pdf]

  • [CARDS-58483]

    • Supported the inheritance of a card production event from the main card to supplementary cards during product upgrade.

  • [I1701238826]/[CARDS-53843]

    • Information about interest fees has been added to Balance Prediction Log.

  • [CARDS-46540]

    • Due normalization has been improved for Issuing accounts with Due Types: Payment Due, Long Payment Due, Contract Due, Fixed Day Due. If several due items with the same Due Date exist for an account, then only one Due transfer will be performed for the total Due Amount.

  • [CARDS-51683]

    • Usage_Limiters_Css.current_status value now considers the state of Contract Classifiers, as before. When the condition is false, the value is "S" (Service Deactivated).

  • [CARDS-51878]

  • [CARDS-51954]

    • Fixed incorrect processing of usage limiter additional actions (charging a fee or opening an Event, for example) when a document is declined.

  • [CARDS-52152]

    • The "Attachment" value has been removed from the "For contracts" list of available values for Service Packages. Additional Service Packages should be used for ATTACHMENT services.

    Updated Manuals: [product_management\Service_Packages.pdf]

  • [CARDS-52353]

    • Corrected behaviour: now the process OpenWay\Full\Configuration Setup\Main Tables\Renew All For Institution correctly approves Service Packages with additional packs: first all additional packs, then main packages.

  • [CARDS-52709]

    • Analysis of the interest_delay field has been added to interest calculation for the current CYCLE.

  • [CARDS-52926]

    • Product approval has been changed, "Product Renew Mode" form has been added.

  • [CARDS-52997]

    • FX_RATE tag calculation has been fixed for DCC Info Inquire documents, when DCC_FX_MODE=CR, and IPS currency differs from Merchant and CH currency.

  • [CARDS-53169]

    • spac.RESET_INTEREST has been enhanced for custom cases, when Interest Rate should be changed from the Billing cycle start date after holidays, if Interest Rate should be changed in a custom procedure after a new billing cycle starts.

  • [CARDS-53178]

    • Classifier domain functionality has been reduced for future compatibility with the new Product-based domain approach.

  • [CARDS-53218]

    • Changed the value displayed in the "Total Due" field in the "ROOT\OpenWay\Customer Service\Customer Service" form. Previously, the field showed the current due amount. Now the total due amount is displayed.

  • [CARDS-53703]

    • Fixed usage limiter redefinition when a contract is moved to another Product.

  • [CARDS-53826]

    • Calculation of maximum fee amount with the MAX_FEE tag has been enhanced. Calculation of minimum fee amount with the MIN_FEE tag has been added.

    Updated Manuals: [tags description] [product_management\Service_Packages.pdf]

  • [CARDS-53994]

    • Validation of contract functional dates Late Payment Date (LP_DATE) and Full Payment Date (FP_DATE) has been enhanced for Set and Recalculate operations. The new value of these dates should be equal to or less than the contract's Next Billing Date + 1 day if the previous value met this condition. When Late Payment Date or Full Payment Date equals Next Billing Date + 1, it means that the LP event or FP event will proceed right before Billing.

    Updated Manuals: [product_management\Functional_Dates.pdf]

  • [CARDS-54352]

    • Corrected interest calculation during balance prediction procedure when both grouped interest and projected interest calculations are used in product configuration.

  • [CARDS-54439]

    • A new global parameter, FROM_SEC_TRANS_DATE has been added to regulate behaviour of entry posting by transaction date (when FROM_TRANS_DATE configuration is used in services/transaction subtypes) for secondary documents. If FROM_SEC_TRANS_DATE = 'Y' (default behaviour) a secondary document's entries will be created with their own transaction date ('Sec Trans Date" document field). If FROM_SEC_TRANS_DATE = 'N', entries will be created with the original document transaction date ("Trans Date" document field).

    Updated Manuals: [core\Global_Parameters.pdf]

  • [CARDS-54550]

    • Enhanced due normalization for accounts with Due Type = "Contract Due" when the calculated date is a holiday according to the business calendar defined in the Account Scheme or Financial Institution, and when every calendar day is opened with the Contract Daily Updates process. In this case, Due normalization will be performed on the first working day after the holidays according to this business calendar. For due normalization, it is not recommended to use Functional Dates which may be a holiday. It is recommended to shift the resulting date to a working day.

    Updated Manuals: [product_management\Functional_Dates.pdf]

  • [CARDS-54695]

    • Now due macrotransactions processed using a standing order are linked to a standing order document only for acquiring contracts. For issuing contracts, due macrotransactions are not linked and item_due records are not closed as it interferes with backdated processing.

  • [CARDS-54979]

    • Added amendment information refresh on approve of Products, Service Packs and Account Schemes linked with a template record (Product Template, Parent Pack, Parent Scheme).

  • [CARDS-55316]

    • Added a new action, "Refresh Product List" to the forms "Acq Main Contract.srd", "Iss Main Contract.srd", and "Iss Main Contract - Corp.srd". This action makes it possible to refresh the list of allowed products for the current contract, if contract has the approval status "No"

    Updated Manuals: [issuing\user_manuals\Issuing_Module.pdf]

  • [CARDS-55613]

    • Restored default behaviour for charging regular fees. Documents for regular fees are not created now for contracts with Invalid contract statuses.

  • [CARDS-55919]

    • Corrected client and parent contract status check when creating a contract manually or using Advanced Application R2. When the client or parent contract has an invalid status, contract approve will fail with an error.

  • [CARDS-56076]

    • Fixed No Data Found error for Interest by Credit for Sibling Orders processing.

  • [CARDS-56164]

    • Added closing of related card contracts (except Applet-Contracts) when the base contract is closed.

  • [CARDS-56408]

    • Corrected the WAY4 Manager "CS.Set Client Classifier" form: now it is synchronised with the similar DB Manager form.

  • [CARDS-56622]

    • Optimized preparation of data for merchant screens with transactions when only last records should be shown.

  • [CARDS-56809]

    • Corrected behaviour of the SAVE_PAYMENT_FROM tag when there is a small underpayment for a card contract.

  • [CARDS-57103]

    • Fixed an Oracle variable overflow exception for due amount calculation.

  • [CARDS-57175]

    • Corrected billing date synchronisation between Main and Sub contracts of a liability hierarchy in the COPY_TO_LIAB_SUBS mode.

    Updated Manuals: [tags description] [product_management\Functional_Dates.pdf] [product_management\Products_and_Subtypes.pdf]

  • [CARDS-57236]

    • Fixed an issue with the process log error message: "Event Type with code CLS_UNIQUE not found". Now this message is shown only when the classifier is set from the future date, "Date To" is not specified and "Event Type" with the CLS_UNIQUE code is not found.

  • [CARDS-58024]

    • Added the ability to check which cards are active and require synchronisation during product upgrade. Decisions with codes specified in SYNC_MAIN_ACTIVE_DECISION and SYNC_SUPPL_ACTIVE_DECISION global parameters should be configured with the "Y" and "N" values to check whether the card is active. These can be one or two different decisions that are checked for main and supplementary cards accordingly.

  • [CARDS-58779]

    • Supported ability to use preferred by Area for secondary transactions.

  • [I1612133268]/[CARDS-51818]

    • Fixed approval of a child service pack if it was copied from another financial institution's pack and contains additional packs.

  • [I1702196631]/[CARDS-52141]

    • Fixed amount calculation for standing orders with the BY_BATCH tag; now zero amount orders are not recalculated based on account balance.

  • [I1703174475]/[CARDS-52501]

    • Unnecessary generation of "Invalid product changes" error message during Contracts Daily Update procedure has been fixed for contracts that do not have a product.

  • [I1704187095]/[CARDS-53269]

    • Usage limiter's end date calculation has been enhanced for usage limiters with Period Type = Billing for sub-contracts.

  • [I1705235303]/[CARDS-53377]

    • Selection of Bank Date and Local Date for CS Status Log has been changed when a classifier value is restored by a Classifier Action. This is relevant only for those customers who use Reversal Management or/and Datamart.

  • [I1706068798]/[CARDS-53661]

    • When searching for a Source Service for interbranch macrotransactions, processing of the global parameter "IBR_CHECK_COUNTRY" has been added. If the parameter value is "Y", the country will be analyzed on the Target side. The default value of the global parameter "IBR_CHECK_COUNTRY" is "N".

    Updated Manuals: [core\Global_Parameters.pdf]

  • [I1708081991]/[CARDS-55285]

    • Corrected filling number of documents for an item when posting a zero entry (e.g. when the total amount of all documents is 0). Zero documents number led to closing of zero due instead of creating a due transfer even if the ALLOW_ZERO_DUE tag was configured.

  • [I1711105367]/[CARDS-55526]

    • Fixed incorrect system behaviour: cases when the Parent Pack was removed from a Service Package, service_approved records under the Service Package were not created when reapproving the Service Package.

  • [I1711303675]/[CARDS-56191]

    • Corrected related contract definition for standing order when Contract Spc is specified.

  • [I1801224994]/[CARDS-56482]

    • Corrected inheritance of custom fee amount from authorisation document if amount calculated on authorisation was zero.

  • [CARDS-56117]

    • Supported hardcoded classifier "ABU" for saving a contract's "ABU" attribute. ABU (Automatic Billing Updater) functionality requires a separate license.

    Updated Manuals: [abu_issuing\ABU_Functional_Specification_Issuing.pdf] [abu_issuing\mastercard_automatic_billing_updater\Interacting_with_MABU_Issuing.pdf] [abu_issuing\visa_account_updater\Interacting_with_VAU_Issuing.pdf] [core\Contract_and_Client_Classifiers.pdf] [tags description]

    QR Payments

  • [CARDS-56298]

    • Implemented import of Alipay clearing files.

  • [CARDS-52987]

    • Added the "OpenWay\QR Payments" menu branch to configure and support mVisa functionality.

  • [CARDS-55668]

    • Implemented the ability to generate mVisa static QR codes in the DB Manager "OpenWay\QR Payments\QR Merchant Schemes" form, [Make QR] button.

  • [CARDS-56653]

    • Added the "OpenWay\QR Payments" menu branch to configure and support mVisa functionality.

  • [CARDS-56664]

    • Implemented the ability to generate mVisa static QR codes in the DB Manager "OpenWay\QR Payments\QR Merchant Schemes" form, [Make QR] button.

  • [CARDS-55312]

    • Changed constant data for the mVisa request according to VISA requirements.

  • [CARDS-56990]

    • Supported currency overrides.

  • [CARDS-57138]

    • Corrected mVisa qr_create pipe Device Currency code search algorithm. Search for currency code in the device contract if the currency is not defined for the device.

  • [CARDS-55784]

    • Added the P2P_ONUS tag to money transfer documents if both the Payer's and Recipient's cards in a transaction are OnUs.

  • [CARDS-56441]

    • Added the menu "OpenWay\Alipay".

  • [CARDS-57237]

    • Supported dispute cycle for mVisa Mobile Push Payment and processing the Fee Collection Transaction Identifier for BASE II Clearing Fee Collection Transactions in VISA and Affiliated BASE II Outward and Inward pipes. TC 10/TCR 0/ Transaction Identifier contains a right-justified, VisaNet generated value that is unique for each request. Pipes affected: Affiliated BASEII Inward Processing.cpp Affiliated BASEII Outward Processing.cpp Affiliated BASEII Prepared Outward Processing.cpp Visa Base II Outward Processing.cpp VISA BASEII Generic Inward Processing.hpp VISA BASEII Inward Processing.cpp VISA BASEII ONUS Marked Outward Processing.cpp VISA BASEII ONUS Outward Processing.cpp VISA BASEII Prepared Outward Processing.cpp (inward pipe ver-03.45.30.01,03.46.30.05 outward pipe ver-03.45.30.37)

    Remote access

  • [WM-3037]

    • Fixed error "Neither 'reports_directory' nor 'reports_home_directory' has been declared" in Remote Access client.

    Reversal management

  • [CARDS-51064]

    • Liability contract hierarchy is supported in reversal management. To allow intelligent backdated processing for a contract with liability subcontracts, the STORNO_LIAB tag should be set in its product; in this case, the whole liability tree will be recalculated.

    Updated Manuals: [product_management\Products_and_Subtypes.pdf] [reversal_management\Reversal_Management.pdf]

  • [CARDS-52834]

    • The ability has been added to properly recalculate contract state with correction documents for fees and interest in intelligent backdated processing. Correction transaction types should be marked using the STORNO_DELAY tag with the "Y" value if a fee is posted in Contracts Daily Update with the preceding date and "N" if a fee is posted in Contracts Daily Update with the current date.

    Updated Manuals: [reversal_management\Reversal_Management.pdf]

  • [CARDS-53166]

    • Events processing during the correction process has been enhanced to support proper event information loading into Datamart. The start local date and end local date of an event record will now be set as the current banking date if the event was posted or closed during the correction process.

  • [CARDS-55143]

    • Added the ability to keep properties (e.g. amount) of an event-based fee in backdated processing. The STORNO_FEE_ACTION=REAPPLY tag should be configured in the special parameters field of the event type.

    Updated Manuals: [product_management\Events.pdf] [reversal_management\Reversal_Management.pdf]

  • [CARDS-55144]

    • Added the ability to keep properties (e.g. amount) of an event-based fee in backdated processing. The STORNO_FEE_ACTION=REAPPLY tag should be configured in the special parameters field of the event type.

  • [CARDS-55567]

    • Implemented extended logging of backdated processing results. Classifier and balance differences after backdated processing can be logged based on the STORNO_LOG_OBJECTS global parameter. The parameter value is a list of required object types delimited by commas: C - classifiers (default value), B - balances. To log both classifiers and balances C,B should be set as the parameter value.

    Updated Manuals: [core\Global_Parameters.pdf] [reversal_management\Reversal_Management.pdf]

  • [CARDS-56338]

    • Automatic backdated processing now checks the USE_AUTO_STORNO document tag with values. The same values as in Transaction Subtypes are used. The tag value is inherited into secondary documents (adjustment, reversal), so if backdated processing for presentments is disabled using the USE_AUTO_STORNO=N tag, backdated processing will be disabled for all secondary documents in this document chain as well. The USE_AUTO_STORNO tag without a value still can be used, but it will not be inherited into secondary documents.

    Updated Manuals: [reversal_management\Reversal_Management.pdf]

  • [CARDS-51829]

    • Corrected filling history of latest operations in backdated processing.

  • [CARDS-52475]

    • In the Reversal Management module, correction of "Behavior Type" changes has been fixed when changes were done at correction start date.

  • [CARDS-52675]

    • Fixed changing of the "Is Ready" contract attribute when performing manual reversal management actions using DB Manager.

    Updated Manuals: [reversal_management\Reversal_Management.pdf]

  • [CARDS-52732]

    • Due tolerance configuration is now supported in backdated payment processing in the Reversal Management module. Maximum tolerance supported period is 10 days. In common cases it is recommended to use backdated payments instead of due tolerance setup.

  • [CARDS-53226]

    • Generation of corrections in intelligent backdated processing has been improved. When a liability tree is processed, corrections will be generated for transfers between Main/Sub trees in the liability hierarchy. Additionally corrections can now be generated for transfers to not amount available accounts, this feature can be enabled by setting the STORNO_NOT_AMAV_CORRECTIONS global parameter to "Y".

    Updated Manuals: [reversal_management\Reversal_Management.pdf]

  • [CARDS-53481]

    • Intelligent Backdated Processing functionality has been improved to correct balance history entry amounts for advice and reversal transactions when a balance type is specified in a custom fee service with an empty Fee Type reference.

  • [CARDS-53866]

    • Intelligent backdated processing now supports instalment event fees recalculation during the correction process.

  • [CARDS-54015]

    • Account renumeration is skipped during reversal processing contract initialization.

  • [CARDS-54116]

    • Backdated processing has been corrected so that contract state is not automatically recalculated for financial advice documents with the current date created in SMS mode.

  • [CARDS-54254]

    • Corrected recalculation of Instalment plans during backdated processing. The INST_PLAN_IDT field of a recalculated plan will be the same as that of the original instalment plan.

  • [CARDS-54437]

    • When every day including holidays is opened in WAY4 and documents are posted on holidays, backdated processing should not skip holidays when contract state is recalculated. To ensure this, the global parameter STORNO_SKIP_HOLIDAYS=N should be set (can be set for a financial institution). When the parameter's value is 'Y' (default value), backdated processing skips holidays and does not perform CDU or any other actions with contracts on holidays.

    Updated Manuals: [reversal_management\Reversal_Management.pdf]

  • [CARDS-54678]

    • Due normalization in backdated processing has been corrected.

  • [CARDS-54688]

    • Backdated processing start date is now always shifted to the previous working day before a holiday, according to the business calendar, even if the global parameter STORNO_SKIP_HOLIDAYS=N is set.

  • [CARDS-54707]

    • Due normalization during Intelligent Backdated Processing has been corrected for cases when Item Due was closed after loan repayment.

  • [CARDS-54739]

    • Backdated processing of liability contract hierarchy has been corrected when some contracts are opened on the processing date and others were opened earlier. Now the "Contract Billing not found" message does not occur in such cases.

  • [CARDS-54792]

    • Order of reapplying events with duration type = "Billing" has been corrected in backdated payment processing.

  • [CARDS-55011]

    • Corrected re-ageing due normalization recalculation on payment reversal using backdated processing.

  • [CARDS-55115]

    • Resolved performance issue on due processing during backdated processing.

  • [CARDS-55722]

    • Corrected "For Export" field filling in GL Traces created during backdated processing if the original GL trace was also created by backdated processing.

  • [CARDS-55749]

    • Added clearing of internal state for backdated processing on fatal error. Prevented incorrect processing of successive documents when automatic backdated processing of one of them resulted in a fatal error during mass document processing.

  • [CARDS-55825]

    • Fixed issue. Now generation of GL corrections for misc fee macrotransactions in backdated processing is based on target fee amount. If the correction macrotransaction has the same fee amount and equal GL traces, no GL corrections will be generated even if transaction amounts are different.

  • [CARDS-55864]

    • Eliminated the possibility of deadlocks in bank contract accounts when backdated processing is done in parallel.

  • [CARDS-56006]

    • Corrected macrotransaction posting date for reversal documents when automatic backdated processing is enabled for a financial institution and transaction subtype but disabled for the card product.

  • [CARDS-56429]

    • Corrected export of GL corrections when backdated processing is performed several times for the same period and the global parameter STORNO_AUTO_HIDE_GL_CORRECTION=Y is set.

  • [CARDS-56493]

    • Fixed instalment plan recalculation for billing day change in backdated processing if an instalment has no interest-based fees.

  • [CARDS-56535]

    • Fixed calculation of previous billing date in Reversal Management when "Apply Account Scheme Changes" was applied during the same billing cycle.

  • [CARDS-56588]

    • Corrected handling of suspended events created in current billing cycle in backdated processing.

  • [CARDS-56749]

    • Corrected handling of events with Duration Type = "Billing" in backdated processing.

  • [CARDS-56832]

    • Corrected ageing reclassification on backdated processing, reclassified amounts are no longer held in inappropriate accounts.

  • [CARDS-56868]

    • Corrected item intersection if backdated processing is done after account scheme changes have been applied.

  • [CARDS-57948]

    • Fixed fatal error when backdated processing is launched during CDU.

  • [I1703235650]/[CARDS-53980]

    • Recalculation of due amounts in Intelligent Backdated Processing is corrected when REFRESH_DUE configuration is used.

  • [I1807084877]/[CARDS-58556]

    • Added a check that CDU was performed for the contract involved in the backdated processing actions.

  • [I1807096765]/[CARDS-58630]

    • Corrected behaviour when backdated processing increased the WAIT_CYCLE counter of a suspended billing event that was created before the correction date.

    Risk management

  • [CARDS-47895]

    • Added the ability to limit the number of different cards for a monitoring rule. Add the "DIFF_CARDS;" tag to the SpcParms field to activate this mode. See documentation for details.

    Updated Manuals: [product_management\Usage_Limiters.pdf]

  • [I1703061992]/[CARDS-52390]

    • If the BASE_AMOUNT_TYPE tag with the TRANSACTION, RECONCILIATION, or SETTLEMENT value is set in a limiter template but there is no FX rate for the tuned data, the limiter counters will try to increase with the default amount received from the main process.

    Updated Manuals: [product_management\Usage_Limiters.pdf]

  • [CARDS-51938]

    • Excluded technical operations from Risk Rule usage limiter processing. Technical operations are operations where transaction type and service class are not filled.

  • [CARDS-52022]

    • Fixed incorrect processing of usage limiters with the SingleSliding period type when the limiter's period was not defined for a particular contract with an application or manually. Without this additional determination, the limiter is not analyzed.

  • [CARDS-52824]

    • Restored the ability to recalculate usage limiter counters for acquiring. Testing - Usage Recalculation.

  • [CARDS-53763]

    • Corrected the algorithm for calculating the amount to check limits on online standing order processing: the transaction currency is used instead of contract currency.

  • [I1702106547]/[CARDS-52437]

    • Fixed incorrect validation of merchant stop list conditions for the predefined condition "Suspicious Contra Party" in usage limiters.

  • [I1703038675]/[CARDS-52383]

    • Incorrect processing of several usage limiters with the same limiter type for one transaction is no longer possible.

  • [I1710057271]/[CARDS-55095]

    • Corrected calculation of the date range for display in standard forms when limiter parameters are modified by a tariff.

  • [CARDS-51856]

    • Created a new risk report "Exceeded Total Credit/Refund Transact. Nmbr to Total Purchase Transact. Nmbr Ratio" (OpenWay\Acquiring\Merchant Risk Management\Risk Reports - Acquiring Single). It is necessary to set the TOTCRDRTRANSNUMRATIO risk scheme parameter (OpenWay\Full\Configuration Setup\Products\Acquiring Products\Device Risk Schemes) - Total Credit/Refund Transact. Nmbr to Total Purchase Transact. Nmbr Ratio. Only device contracts for which the ratio of the Credit/Refund transactions to the total number of purchase transactions in a period exceeds the TOTCRDRTRANSNUMRATIO parameter value set in the risk scheme will be included in the report. Only Credit (Trans Type IDT=0616) and Retail (Trans Type IDT=0515) transactions will be analysed when generating the report.

  • [CARDS-51857]

    • Created a new report, Credits_Issued_By_Merchant.rdf. The report is run from OpenWay\MC Statistics Reports\Risk Reports\Credits Issued By Merchant.

    Updated Manuals: [mastercard_statistical_reports\quarterly_mastercard_reporting\MC_Credits_Issued_By_Merchant_Report.pdf]

  • [CARDS-51864]

    • Added a new report, MC_Acquiring_Fraud_Basis_Points.rdf, and statistic attributes (OpenWay\Full\Statistics\Dictionaries\Statistic Attributes (custom)) for its support: Trans classifier: Device Type Transaction (PS_TRN_DEVICE_TYPE) Trans classifier: Fraud Type (PS_TRN_FRAUD_TYPE) Trans classifier: Card Present (PS_TRN_IS_CARD_PRESENT), Trans classifier: Mastercard MO/TO/Ecomm Transaction (PS_TRN_MC_MOTOECOMM)

    Updated Manuals: [mastercard_statistical_reports\quarterly_mastercard_reporting\MC_Acquiring_Fraud_Basis_Points_Report.pdf]

    SEPA interface

  • [CARDS-52112]

    • "OpenWay\Full\Configuration Setup\Accounting Setup\Bank Divisions", "OpenWay\SEPA\Issuing Mandate Input & Update" and "OpenWay\SEPA\Acquiring Mandate Input & Update" menus now make it possible to set up Ultimate Creditor and Ultimate Debtor data.

    Updated Manuals: [product_management\Client_Messages.pdf] [sepa_interface\SEPA_Interface_operation.pdf] [sepa_interface\SEPA_Interface_setup.pdf] [transaction_management\Documents.pdf]

  • [CARDS-52116]

    • SEPA Customer to Bank Export: Changed criterion to select invoice party for Ultimate Creditor (UltmtCdtr) data element; now data with party type "UC" (Ultimate Creditor) is exported, earlier data with party type "BF" (Beneficiary) was used to populate this data element. See also CARDS-52112.

  • [CARDS-52866]

    • If a SEPA Customer-To-Bank Export process fails with a validation error message, it is now logged in Process Message with "Error" type.

  • [CARDS-53351]

    • SEPA. Added the menu item OpenWay\SEPA\SEPA. File Management\SEPA Outgoing Pending Files

  • [CARDS-53101]

    • Fixed Ultimate Creditor / Ultimate Debtor data export for sepa_customer_to_bank_export pipe.

  • [CARDS-53556]

    • SEPA Customer-To-Bank export: creditor address data is exported for SEPA Credit Transfer.

  • [CARDS-56118]

    • Added check for SOURCE MEMBER ID and TARGET CODE to SEPA Customer to bank export. If these fields are null, an error message is written in the process log and the document is skipped.

    SOA

  • [UFX-278]

  • [UFX-325]

    • Enhanced formatting. UFX Response messages now contain amounts with formatted exponent depending on currency.

  • [UFX-367]

    • New optional elements Title and Suffix have been added in UFX format under W4C_Address/<Address>.

    Updated Manuals: Application Managment | xml_appl_schema.chm

  • [UFX-371]

    • Added Instalment summary data to UFX additional statement for instalments.

  • [UFX-372]

    • Added InstalmentIDT (ID of the initial plan in a chain) to UFX additional statement response.

  • [UFX-377]

    • Added filtration of auth methods by code for Information requests. The value of the "ContractAuthMethod" parameter may contain a list of comma-separated codes to filter. A filter to return only active (is_ready != 'C') auth methods has been added for Information requests.

    Updated Manuals: Application Managment | xml_appl_schema.chm

  • [UFX-381]

    • Supported new "Conversion" Tariff Role in SOA UFX TariffData requests and Information requests.

  • [UFX-393]

    • Added Storno Correction statement type in UFX Additional Statement on WAY4Gate.

    Updated Manuals: Ufx Iinterchange | xml_doc_schema.chm

  • [UFX-404]

    • Added a configuration parameter for WAY4 Gate in the stmt-config section of the way4cadapter service configuration for including a reversed transaction in an additional statement.

  • [UFX-406]

    • Supported client search by ITN for UFX Information and Application requests.

  • [CARDS-52463]

    • Improved the error message returned by the stored procedure when DP service is requested for a non-existent client or contract.

  • [UFX-368]

    • There are no errors now if the amount is zero and DE049 field is empty or null.

  • [UFX-386]

    • Changed UFX Information response generation so that a standing order without currency will no longer have an empty <Currency/> element returned.

  • [I1702285837]/[UFX-391]

    • SAF is now allowed for reversal messages generated when a P2P_DIRECT transfer fails.

  • [I1703173525]/[UFX-388]

    • Fixed surcharge fee currency shown in UFX Statement. Transaction currency will be the same as surcharge currency.

  • [I1703176786]/[UFX-398]

    • Fixed processing of UFX billing payment operations on WAY4Gate in scenario when there is chip data in the UFX request, but no chip data in the authorization response from issuer (this is sometimes the case with MasterCard). Previously chip data from the request could be lost, now it is correctly processed and saved.

    Scheduler

  • [DBK-3078]

    • Removed restriction which prevents assigning a Scheduler Job to a day of month greater than 28.

  • [DBK-3115]

    • Removed restriction which prevents assigning a Scheduler Job to a day of month greater than 28.

  • [CARDS-52705]

    • Restored Scheduler Standard Menu Items. They are now put in "OpenWay\WAY4 Scheduler - Cards\Standard Menu Items".

  • [I1709153136]/[DBK-3068]

    • Fixed "java.lang.ClassNotFoundException: sqlj.runtime.ref.DefaultContext" error in Scheduler R1.

  • [DBK-2916]

    • Scheduler R1 end-of-life announcement: Support of Scheduler R1 will be terminated starting from 03.46.30.00!

    Security & key management

  • [I1702238064]/[CARDS-52336]

    • Added support for selecting root directory as SOURCE_DIR parameter in "PM RSA EMV Key Management".

  • [CARDS-52807]

    • "PA DSS Implementation Guide" has been updated. The section "Encryption and Protected Protocols for Data Transmission" has been changed. Added a warning that when the TLS 1.2 protocol is used, encryption using the RC4 algorithm must be disabled.

    Updated Manuals: Security &amp; key management | PCI DSS Implementation Guide

  • [CARDS-52884]

    • Updated "PA DSS Implementation Guide". Full review for PA DSS 3.2 compliance (03.42.3.x, 03.43.3.x, 03.44.3.x).

    Updated Manuals: Security &amp; key management | PCI DSS Implementation Guide

  • [CARDS-53005]

    • Interactive channels API: a requirement for the value of the csrf_protection parameter has been added. The parameter must be set to "true" in accordance with PA-DSS.

    Updated Manuals: Security &amp; key management | PCI DSS Implementation Guide

  • [CARDS-53006]

    • Messenger banking: a requirement to not disclose private IP addresses has been added in accordance with PA-DSS.

    Updated Manuals: Security &amp; key management | PCI DSS Implementation Guide

  • [CARDS-53007]
